Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Antoinette Pélagie sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe SENA 1, un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les deux premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The SENA 1 Group is made up of three people belonging to the same tontine group.  This is the third time that this group is requesting a loan from Alidé, so as to raise the standard of their business.  The representative of the group, Antoinette Pélagie, is the one in the photo with her hand raised.

Antoine Pélagie is 33 years old and lives in Benin.  Antoinette Pélagie has not attended school.  Antoinette Pélagie is married to a man named Mathias. The couple has four children, all in school, and all dependents.  Antoinette Pélagie lives together with her husband and children.

The couple shares the household responsibilities.  To support herself and her children, Antoinette Pélagie has run a business for the last decade selling yams, both fried and otherwise, in her area.  Secondarily, Antoinette Pélagie sells fabrics.

Antoinette Pélagie stocks up in a city in Benin as well as in her area.  In order to ensure the satisfaction of her clientele and to improve her turnover and profits, Antoinette Pélagie is asking for a third loan along with the other members of the SENA 1 Group. The two previous loans were properly repaid.

loans.use: to purchase bags of yams and fabric.

loans.name: La Fe 1, 3 & 4 Group

texts.en:
Renold is the coordinator of his group La Fe ("Faith") 1, 3 and 4. This group is located in a batey (a sugarcane company town) in the rural area surrounding La Romana, where the sugarcane harvest and tourist industry dominate the economy and most of the people are Haitian immigrants. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable electricity and running water (none of which is potable). 

He is excited to be taking out his third loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid his previous loan and grown his business. Renold plans to use this loan to invest in his business by buying rice, beans, sugar, canned food, vegetables, etc., He is running a colmado, a small grocery store. 

Renold makes his home in a simple structure with his long-term partner and three children. He has had his business for almost three years, starting with a small amount of savings. 

He says that his most difficult challenge is to buy a pick up to transport his merchandise. In the meantime he plans to continue to enjoy doing business. He will use his profits to invest in his business. His future plan is to have a house for his children.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, sugar, canned food, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Dora

texts.es: Dora, de 48 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y dinámica, además es alegre y sociable. Convive con Víctor quien es pintor, asimismo su vida la comparte a lado de sus tres hijas de 24, 20 y 9 años de edad, a las que quiere bastante, instaladas en su casa propia. El negocio que tiene Dora es la venta de abarrotes en general, contando con una bodega que abrió en su casa iniciándose con un capital, fruto de sus ahorros con su pareja. Es así que lo invirtio, dándole una rotación constante a sus productos, logrando así crecer su negocio y tener una buena clientela. A lo largo de estos 18 años de comercio se siente contenta, además que cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijas en la atención a los clientes cuando ella está fuera de casa. Le gusta su negocio pues le permite estar cerca de su familia, así como el tiempo libre que le deja para ocuparlo en otras actividades, asimismo el ingreso económico que le sirve para apoyar a su pareja con los gastos del hogar. Sin embargo no le gusta cuando sus clientes se retrasan en el pago de sus créditos, pero ella sabe que eso no debe perjudicar sus obligaciones con MFP. Además viendo la buena acogida que tiene su negocio desea continuar y mantenerlo. Este será el préstamo número 5 con la institución MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos. Además comenta sentirse bien con su banco comunal pues considera a sus integrantes ser personas puntuales con sus obligaciones de pago. Con el monto solicitado de 1500 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la compra de mercadería como abarrotes en general al por mayor para surtir su negocio, pues considera que con mayor variedad tendrá mayor preferencia de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Dora, age 48, is a hard-working and dynamic woman. She is also happy and sociable. She lives in her own home with Victor, who is a painter, and their three beloved daughters ages 9, 20 and 24. Dora runs a grocery store in her home using money that she and her partner had saved up. She invested this money in the business, and constantly rotates her products. This way, her business is growing and she has a good customer base. She has been in business for 18 years and is happy. Her daughters help out with the business when she is out. She enjoys her business because it allows her to be close to her family. It also gives her free time for other activities, and her income supports her partner with the household costs. However, she does not like it when her customers are late with payments, but she knows that this should not affect her obligations to MFP.
Furthermore, since her business is popular, she wants to continue it and keep it up. This will be her fifth loan with MFP, and she hopes for your collaboration so that she can continue toward her goals. She tells us that she feels good about her communal bank, because the members are punctual with their payments. With the requested 1500 Nuevos Soles, she will invest in the wholesale purchase of merchandise such as groceries to stock her business. She feels that her customers will be happier with greater variety to choose from.

loans.use: to buy a variety of basic staples to stock her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase bulk maize for the kenkey.

loans.name: La Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es: Elga, pertenece a la alcancía comunal La Nueva esperanza conformada por ocho integrantes, los cuales son todos vecinos ya que viven en el mismo barrio. Algo que las caracteriza es el esfuerzo que realizan diariamente por salir adelante y dar una mejora económica a sus hogares, muestra de ello es la señora Elga de 25 años de edad conviviente y madre de dos hijos que son menores de  edad y dependen de ella y su conviviente. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa en un pequeño puesto que pudo conseguir por medio de su suegra que se dedica también a lo mismo, hace ya más de 3 años que se dedica a esta actividad económica, También vende productos de belleza en sus ratos libres, gracias a su trabajo le ha dado muchas satisfacciones una de ella  es la educación de sus hijos y la construcción de su vivienda. Con el reciente préstamo lo piensa invertir en la compra de mercadería como son polos y pantalones.
texts.en:
Elga belongs to the La Nueva Esperanza communal bank, made up of eight members who are all neighbors who live in the same neighborhood.  Something that characterizes them is the effort they make daily to get ahead and give their homes economic improvement.  Elga is an example of this.  She is 25 years old and lives with her partner, and is the mother of two minor children who depend on her and her partner.

She works selling clothing in a small stall that she was able to get through her mother-in-law who also works in the same business.  It has been more than three years already that she has been working in this economic activity.  She also sells beauty products in her free time.  Thanks to her work she has received great satisfaction, such as the education of her children and the construction of her home.

With the recent loan she plans to invest in buying merchandise such as polo shirts and pants.

loans.use: to buy polo shirts and pants.

loans.name: Grace Efua

texts.en:
Grace Efua prepares millet porridge for sale at Efutu. 

Grace is married to a nurse and has five children. She uses her income to support the husband to pay utility bills. 

She will use her loan to purchase more millet, sugar and milk to prepare porridge for sale. With the new profit , she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bulk millet, sugar and milk for the porridge.

loans.name: Marcos Benedo

texts.es:
Marcos Benedo   tiene 30 años  estado civil actual Unión Libre, vive con la pareja  e  hijos. Vive en el Recinto Aguas frías de Mocache Cantón Mocache.

Ventanilla  EL PROGRESO  se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Aguas frías de Mocache, perteneciente al cantón Mocache, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz y frejol gandul.

Marcos Benedo se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz en terrenos propios hace cinco años. Las compras y las ventas lo hace en Ventanas.

El crédito solicito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos para los cultivos. El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos para el consumo de la familia y para invertir en la siembra. Su sueño es comprar una casa.

Disfruta mucho en sus tiempos libres descansar.
texts.en:
Marcos Benedo is 30 years old and lives in a common-law relationship with his partner and children.  He lives in the area of Aguas Frías de Mocache, Mocache canton.  The El Progreso communal bank is located in the the Aguas Frías de Mocache area in Mocache canton.  This bank works in short-cycle agriculture growing corn, rice, and pigeon peas.

Marcos Benedo has worked for five years in agriculture growing corn on his own land.  He buys his products in Mocache and sells them in the market in Mocache.

He requested the loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, and manure for the crops.  The loan has helped him increase his income for family use and invest in the planting.

His dream is to buy a house.  In his free time he very much enjoys resting.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, and manure for the crops.

loans.name: Djidjoho 2 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe DJIDJOHO 2 est composé de trois personnes qui sont des amies et qui appartiennent à un même groupe de tontine. C'est la quatrième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante  du groupe, du nom de Abissola Victoire est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Abissola Victoire est âgée de 27 ans et vit au Bénin. Abissola Victoire n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Abissola Victoire est mariée à un couturier du nom de Jean. Le couple a trois enfants dont certains scolarisés et deux restent à leur charge. Abissola Victoire vit ensemble avec son mari et ses deux enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les divers besoins de la maison. Afin de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Abissola Victoire vend depuis cinq ans environs, des serviettes et des torchons de table, de façon ambulante. Abissola Victoire s’approvisionne dans une ville du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Abissola Victoire sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe DJIDJOHO 2, un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les trois premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The Djidjoho 2 Group is made up of three women who are friends belonging to the same tontine group.  This is the fourth time that the group is asking for a loan from Alidé, this time hoping to raise the standard of their businesses.  The representative of the group, Abissola Victoire, is the one in the photo with her hand raised.

Abissola Vctoire is 27 years old and lives in Benin. Abissola Victoire has not attended school.  Abissola Victoire is married to a dressmaker named Jean.  The couple has three children, some of whom remain in school and two are dependents.  Abissola Victoire lives together with her husband and two children; the couple shares the responsibility of providing for household needs.

In order to provide for herself and her children, Abissola Victoire has been selling napkins and tablecloths for five years as an itinerant.  Abissola Victoire buys her inventory in a city in Benin.

In order to ensure customer satisfaction, as well as to increase her profits, Abissola Victoire is asking for a fourth loan from Alidé in conjunction with the other members of the Djidjoho 2 Group.  The three previous loans were properly repaid.

loans.use: to purchase napkins and tablecloths.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Aba sells kenkey (maize dumplings often used in soups) at Efutu. She has been selling kenkey for 20 years.  

Aba is a single parent with four children. As a single parent she uses her income to feed, cloth and pay the school fees of her children. 

Aba needs this loan to purchase bulk maize to prepare the kenkey for sale. With the new profit, Aba wishes to give her children the best education.

loans.use: to purchase bulk maize to prepare the kenkey for sale.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa, de 48 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, además de alegre y sociable, es conviviente con Luis quien es chofer, asimismo vive en compañía de sus hijos de 29, 28, 23 y 18 años de edad, instalados cómodamente en su casa propia. El negocio que tiene Rosa es una tienda de ventas de lubricantes para motos y motocarros, contando para eso con un local alquilado en una avenida muy transitada de su ciudad. Dicho negocio se inició con un pequeño préstamo hace 02 años, eso le ayudo a abastecer de poco productos, con el tiempo logró aumentar y ahora tener en stock cantidad de mercadería. Asimismo cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos y un sobrino al que paga por semana de trabajo. Le gusta su negocio pues fue concebido por una idea propia, logrando verlo concretizado y viendo los buenos resultados. Ahora desea incursionar en otro negocio que es la pesca, para eso ha comprado un bote de pesca artesanal, de esa manera estará logrando aumentar sus ingresos e ir creciendo como empresaria. Este será el préstamo número 01 con la institución MFP, se siente agradecida por contar con una línea de crédito para avanzar con sus planes y por ello se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Con el monto solicitado de 800 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la compra de lubricantes a precio por mayor  para así tener mayores ganancias.
texts.en: Rosa is 48 and is a hard-working woman.  She is also happy and sociable.  She lives with her partner, Luis, who is a chauffeur.  She also lives with her children, who are 29, 28, 23, and 18.  They live comfortably in their own home.  Rosa has a business selling lubricants for motorcycles and motorcycle rickshaws.  She has a rented location on a very frequented avenue in her city.  She started her business with a small loan two years ago.  This helped her supply a few products.  With time, she managed to grow and now she has a large quantity of merchandise in stock.  She also has the support of her children and a nephew whom she pays weekly for their work.  She likes her business which was conceived from her own idea, and she has seen it come to life and have good results.  Now she hopes to start another business, which is fishing.  She has bought a handmade fishing boat, and in this way, she will increase her income and grow as a businesswoman.  This is her first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma.  She is thankful to have a line of credit to advance her plans, and this is why she promises to make her payments on time.  With the requested amount of 800 PEN, she will invest in the wholesale purchase of lubricants so she can make better profits.

loans.use: to buy more lubricants.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary extracts palm oil for sale at Efutu. She has been doing this for the past 18 years now. 

Mary is married to a farmer and has four children. Mary assists the husband to pay utility bills.  

She needs this loan to purchase more palm fruit to extract the oil for sale. With the new profit, Mary plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more palm fruit to extract oil for sale.

loans.name: Jose Agustin

texts.es:
José Agustina tiene 53 años es casado vive con la esposa y con los hijos. Vive en el Recinto Aguas frías de Mocache, Cantón Mocache.

Ventanilla EL PROGRESO  se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Aguas Frías de Mocahe, perteneciente al cantón Mocache, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz.

José Agustín  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz en terrenos propios. Compra sus productos en Mocache y las vende en el mercado de Mocache.

El crédito solicito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos para los cultivos. El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos para el consumo de la familia y para invertir en la siembra. Su sueño es comprar una casa.
Disfruta mucho en sus tiempos libres haciendo deporte.
texts.en:
José Agustín, 53, is married and lives with his wife and children in the Aguas Frías de Mocache rural community in the Mocache Canton.

The communal bank EL PROGRESO is located in the same community and belongs to the Mocache Canton.  Its members are short-cycle crop farmers who grow corn and rice.

José Agustín is a farmer who grows corn and rice on his own land.  He buys supplies in Mocache and sells his produce at the market in Mocache.

He is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizer and compost for his crops.  The loan will help him increase his income to provide for his family and to invest in planting.  His dream is to buy a house.

He enjoys playing sports in his free time.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizer and compost for his crops.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Aba sells cassava and plantain at Efutu. 

She is married to a farmer and has six dependents. 

Aba has been selling food for 30 years now. She uses her income to help  her husband to provide for  their family. 

Aba will use her loan to purchase more food to sell. With the new profit, Aba will expand her business.

loans.use: purchase food for sale.

loans.name: Mahukpego 7 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MAHUKPEGO 7 est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. C'est la sixième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante  du groupe, du nom de Gbèhodé est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Gbèhodé est âgée de 53 ans et vit au Bénin. Gbèhodé n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Gbèhodé est mariée à un cultivateur du nom de Pascal. Le couple a cinq enfants dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Gbèhodé vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les divers besoins de la famille. Afin d'assurer les diverses charges de la famille, Gbèhodé vend de l’huile de palme et des vins de palme dans sa région. Gbèhodé s’approvisionne dans une région du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Gbèhodé sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MAHUKPEGO 7, un sixième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les cinq premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The Mahukpego 7 Group consists of three people who live in the same neighbourhood.  This is the sixth time that this group has taken out a loan from Alidé in order to raise the standard of their business.  The representative of the group, Gbèhodé, is the one pictured with her hand raised.

Gbèhodé is 53 years old and lives in Benin.  Gbèhodé has not attended school.  Gbèhodé is married to a farmer named Pascal. The couple has five children, some of whom are in school and all are dependents.  Gbèhodé lives together with her husband and their children.  The couple works together to provide for the various household needs.

In order to ensure the various family expenses, Gbèhodé sells palm oil and palm wines in her area.  Gbèhodé buys her stock from a region in Benin.

Seeking to satisfy her clientele and to improve her turnover and profits, Gbèhodé is asking for a sixth loan from Alidé in conjunction with the other members of the Mahukpego 7 Group. The five previous loans have been properly repaid.

loans.use: to purchase cans of palm oil and palm nuts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase bulk maize to prepare the kenkey for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase more food for sale.

loans.name: Jesugnon 6 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe JESUGNON 6 est composé de trois personnes qui vivent dans le même quartier. C'est la cinquième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Floride est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Floride est âgée de 42 ans et est mariée à un commerçant du nom de Sylvain. Le couple a cinq enfants dont certains scolarisés et quatre restent à leur charge. Floride vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la maison sont assurées par le couple. Pour y parvenir, Floride mène comme activité depuis treize ans environs la vente de divers articles (savons, biscuits) à son domicile. De façon secondaire, Floride vend des charbons de bois et de la farine de manioc. Cette activité lui permet de contribuer sans grande difficulté aux besoins de sa famille. Floride s’approvisionne dans une région du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Floride sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe JESUGNON 6, un cinquième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les quatre premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The Jesugnon 6 Group consists of three people who live in the same neighbourhood.  This is the fifth time that this group is asking for a loan from Alidé in order to improve the standard of their business.  The representative of the group, Floride, is pictured here with her hand raised.

Floride is 42 years old and is married to a merchant named Sylvain.  The couple has five children, some of whom are in school and four remain dependents.  Floride lives together with her husband and their children.  The various household needs are provided for by the couple.  To meet this end, Floride has run a business for about thirteen years selling various products (soaps, biscuits) from her home.  Secondarily, Floride sells cassava flour and charcoal.

This business has allowed her to contribute to providing for the needs of the family without great difficulty.  Floride buys her stock in a region of Benin.   In order to satisfy her clientele and improve her turnover as well as profits, Floride is asking for her fifth loan from Alidé in conjunction with the other members of the Jesugnon 6 Group.  The four previous loans have been properly repaid.

loans.use: Acheter des produits divers (savons, biscuits, charbon de bois, etc.)

loans.name: La Fe 2, 5 & 6 Group

texts.en:
Marie is the coordinator of her group La Fe 2,5 & 6 (The Faith). She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and three children. She says that her most important challenges are to educate her children and to support all of their needs. She is selling miscellaneous products;  she sells most of the basic products like clothing, shoes, cosmetics and others. 

Marie is excited to be taking out her sixth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loans and grown her business. She has had her business for three years. She plans to use this loan to purchase some clothing like blue jeans, shirts, some women's shoes, and cosmetics products. She will use the profits to reinvest in the business, because she wants to increase her sales, and she will have the opportunity to have good sales for all the Christmas season and to sells toys in January (In Dominican Republic, the kids receive toys in January).

This group is compounded by Haitian citizen who have been living in the Dominican Republic for years and working in the sugarcane fields from La Romana, where the sugarcane harvest and tourist industry dominates the economy. She thanks all of you for your support.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, clothes, shoes, etc.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Abena cooks plain rice and serves it with tomato sauce, macaroni, and fried fish; she has done this for six years. She is married to a driver and has five dependents. Abena uses her earnings to support her husband in paying their children's school fees and other household expenses. Abena will use the loan to purchase rice, tomatoes, cooking oil, and so on. She anticipates reinvesting the new profit.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes, cooking oil, and other food items to prepare her food for sale

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth sells sweet potatoes at Efufu. She has been selling sweet potatoes for the past 20 years. Elizabeth is a single parent and has two children. As a single parent she uses her income for the general upkeep of her family. Elizabeth will use her loan to purchase more sweet potatoes for sale. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more sweet potatoes for sale

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama produces kenkey (fermented corn dough wrapped in corn or banana leaves) in large quantities and distributes it for sale at Efutu. In front of her are the dough and leaves. She is preparing the kenkey. Ama has done this for 15 years.

She is married and has five children. She uses her income to assist her husband in paying their accomodation bills. Ama will use her loan to purchase maize in bulk for the kenkey. With the new profit, Ama plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize in bulk for making kenkey

loans.name: Nuestra Pasión Por El Trabajo Group

texts.es:
El grupo "Nuestra pasión por el trabajo" es de la ciudad de Ybycui, son 12 mujeres muy unidas, trabajadoras y emprendedoras. Ellas tienen como objetivo principal ayudar a sus familias por medio del trabajo del comité. Comentan que vieron una gran oportunidad en el programa de comité de mujeres de la fundación paraguaya.
Una de las miembros es la señora Liz, quien se dedica a la venta de cosméticos. Comenta que le va muy bien en las ventas ya que siempre tiene muy buenos productos, además de eso la simpatía con que trata a las clientas. Una de sus metas es poder seguir creciendo y de esa forma poder seguir ayudando a su familia.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de varios cosméticos, con lo cual podrá abastecerse y cumplir con el pedido de sus clientes. Ella al igual que sus amigas del grupo está muy agradecidas con la fundación.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Nuestra pasión por el trabajo" is located in the city of Ybycui and comprised of 12 women who are very united, hard-working and enterprising.  Their main goal is to help their families through their work group.  They saw what a great opportunity it was to participate in the women's program at the Fundación Paraguaya.

One of the members is Liz who sells cosmetics.  She says sales volume is high because she always has good products, and treats her customers with kindness.  One of her goals is to continue growing her business so she can help her family.

She is requesting a loan to buy various cosmetics to be able to fill customer orders.  She, and all her friends in the group, are very grateful to the Fundación.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Ana Julieta

texts.es: Ana Julia tiene 50 años, su actividad es una pulpería. Desde hace mas de 10 años que tiene este medio de vida. Su negocio está ubicado en su vivienda, siempre está esforzándose por lograr los objetivos que se propone. El motivo del crédito que solicita es para la compra granos básicos, pan, refrescos, bolsas, pajillas, azúcar entre otros. Ella tiene una gran variedad de clientes que siempre están solicitándoles diferentes productos
texts.en: Ana Julia, 50, has a grocery store business that she has been in for ten years.  Her store is set up in her house and she is always making every effort to meet the goals she sets.  She is requesting a loan to buy basic grains, bread, softdrinks, bags, straws, and sugar, among other items.  She has many customers who are always requesting different products.

loans.use: To buy basic grains, bread, softdrinks, bags, straws, and sugar, among other items.

loans.name: Maame

texts.en: Maame is a petty trader. She sells cooking utensils, shoes, and children's wear at Efutu. She has been selling cooking utensils for the past six years now. She is married to a mason and has one child. She uses her income to assist her husband in paying their accomodation bills. Maame will use her loan to purchase more cooking utensils, shoes, and children's wear for sale. With the new profit she plans reinvest to increase her capital.

loans.use: to purchase more cooking utensils, shoes and children's wear for sale.

loans.name: Maame Elizabeth

texts.en:
Maame Elizabeth  is a fishmonger at Efutu. In front of her in the photo are some of the smoke fish she sells. 

She has been into this business for the past 10 years now. 

She is married to a farmer and has five children. Maame helps her husband to provide for their family. She will use her loan to purchase more fish for sale. With the new profit, Maame will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish for sale.

loans.name: Ayishatu

texts.en:
Ayishatu is a petty trader. She trades in food such as kako (salted fish), perrer, salt, etc.  

Ayishatu is married to a farmer and has six children. She assists her husband in paying utility bills and with the upkeep of their children  

Ayishatu will uses this loan to purchase more food items for sale. With the new profit, Ayishatu will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase food items for sale.

loans.name: Blas

texts.es:
El Sr. Blas es de la ciudad de Carapeguá, tiene 39 años de edad, vive en pareja con la Sra. Liduvina hace más de 8 años, tienen 2 hijos juntos, todos van a la escuela aun. El nos comenta que se dedica a la venta ambulante de todo tipo de productos, en lo cual le va bien.
Blás cuenta que como proviene de una familia humilde y con ganas de salir adelante decidió trabajar en agricultura, y luego de juntar para su capital empezó en la venta de artesanía por zonas de la capital. Sus recorridos primeramente los hacía a pie y gracias a su trabajo y esfuerzo pudo comprarse una motocicleta  la cual lo utiliza para realizar sus ventas y mantener la buena clientela. Blás es un señor muy sacrificado pues tiene que recorrer casa por casa y varios kilómetros en su motocicleta.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de hamacas, fajas y sábanas puesto que tiene muchos pedidos de estos productos.
texts.en:
Mr. Blas, 39, lives in the city of Carapeguá with his common-law wife of eight years, Liduvina, and their two children who are in school.  He is a street vendor and sells all kinds of products, and business is going well.

Blas says he comes from a modest family and because he wanted to get ahead began working in agriculture.  Once he made enough money he began selling crafts in different areas of the city.  He used to have to walk to sell but through his work and effort was able to buy a motorcycle that he uses for sales and to keep his best customers.  Blas is a very self-sacrificing man who must travel many kilometers on his motorcycle to go door to door.

He plans to use the loan to buy hammocks, waistbands and sheets because he has many orders for these products.

loans.use: To buy hammocks, waistbands and sheets.

loans.name: Sol Radiante De Huaycan Group

texts.es: La Sra. Gloria  es conviviente, tiene 2 hijos en edad escolar, actualmente es integrante en la alcancía comunal “Sol Radiante de Huaycan” grupo  conformado por 10  socios que se dedican a diversas actividades de comercio. Gloria  trabaja desde hace 10 años en la venta de prendas de vestir en su domicilio este negocio surge a raiz de que sus hijos comenzaron a ir al colegio y gloria veia que el sueldo de su esposo no alcanzaba para cubrir las necesidades basicas del hogar y de sus hijos, es asi que consiguio un capital y empezo a vender polos, short, con el tiempo cuenta con clientes fidelizados y su negocio ha crecido gloria  nos cuenta que todo lo consiguió con mucho trabajo y perseverancia ya que su motivación eran sus hijos y sus deseos de superación eran más grandes que sus problemas,  gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación a logrado mejores ingresos económicos,sus hijos cuentan con una mejor calidad de vida , con el fin de seguir creciendo a solicitado un nuevo préstamo para comprar mercadería polos, pantalones, short, blusas, vestidos. Sabemos que Gloria  cumplirá sus metas con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo y que los préstamos de Edaprospo le ayudaran.
texts.en:
Gloria has a common-law husband and 2 school age children. Currently she is a member of the communal bank Radiant Sun of Huaycan group formed by 10 members who work in different areas. 

Gloria has worked for 10 years selling clothing in her home. This business came about because her children began to go to school and Gloria saw that her husband’s salary was not enough to cover the expenses for the household and the children. She was able to get some polo shirts and shorts to sell and over time she has built a loyal client base and the business has grown.

Gloria tells us that everything she has was achieved through hard work and perseverance and that her motivation were her children and her desire to overcome was bigger than her problems. Thanks to her struggle and attention she has obtained higher earnings, her children have a better quality of life, and she continues growing.

She is asking for a new loan in order to buy merchandise including polo shirts, pants, shorts, blouses, and dresses. We know that Gloria will meet her goals with a lot of work and effort and that the loans from Edaprospo help her.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her clothing business

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es:
El Señor Santiago tiene 41 años de edad, es casado, y tiene 2 hijos, su esposa es la Sra. Juana, viven en casa propia en la ciudad de Carapeguá.
Se dedica a la fabricación y venta de pelotas, negocio que tiene en su casa, cuenta que le ayudan sus 2 hijos y su esposa y a la vez dos de sus sobrinos a quienes les enseña la profesión y también les paga.
Realiza sus ventas en las localidades de Quiindy, Encarnación, Fernando de la Mora y Villarrica, cuenta que tiene muy buena venta y que su negocio va creciendo de a poco y con mucho esfuerzo.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de cueros ya que cuenta con una buena cantidad de pedidos que desea cubrir, lo cual le generará más ingresos y por ende le ayudará a hacer crecer aún más su micro empresa.
texts.en:
Santiago is 41 years old, married, and has 2 children. His wife is called Juana. They live in their own house in the city of Carapeguá.

He makes and sells balls. The business that he has is in his own house. His 2 children and his wife help him and at the same time he is teaching his two nephews the business and also pays them.

He makes sales in Quiindy, Encarnación, Fernando de la Mora  and Villarrica. He has very good sales and his business is growing progressively with a lot of effort.

He is asking for a loan in order to buy leather as he already has many orders that he wants to meet which will generate more income and therefore it will help the micro business to grow even more.

loans.use: to buy leather to use making balls

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
Mujeres luchadoras nace mediante la gestión de una de las miembros del grupo, quien motivaba en la idea de un bien para sus vecinas al incentivo y de allí surge el comité. Actualmente está integrado por 17 mujeres, todas ellas amigas y vecinas de esa ciudad, se encuentran en el octavo ciclo del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación paraguaya.
Una de las miembros es la señora Maria, quien se dedica a la venta de prendas de todo tipo. Ella comenta que con mucho sacrificio empezó, pero que  gracias a su esfuerzo y su trabajo, además de la ayuda de fundación pudo crecer y seguir adelante. Una de sus metas es tener una gran tienda donde vender sus prendas.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas de verano, con lo cual podrá surtirse y de esa forma ofrecer más variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
These fighting women formed a group at the suggestion of one of the members who put forth the idea for the good of her neighbors, and this was their encouragement, and from there this communal bank came about. There are currently 17 women, all of them friends and neighbors, who are in the 8th cycle of the program for women entrepreneurs of the Fundación Paraguaya (Paraguayan Foundation).

One of the members is Maria, who works selling all kinds of clothing. She comments that she began with a lot of sacrifice, but thanks to her efforts and work and the help of the foundation she could grow and get ahead.

One of her goals is to have a big store where she can sell her garments.

She is asking for a loan in order to buy summer clothing, with which she can stock up and be able to offer a greater variety to her customers.

loans.use: to buy clothing for resale

loans.name: Kuña Oñondivepa Group

texts.es:
Las mujeres del comité Kuña Oñondivepa decidieron embarcarse a este provechoso proyecto que ofrece la  Fundacion Paraguaya de otorgarles un crédito y sobre todo acceder a las capacitaciones que son de mucha ayuda para que sepan utilizar esos recursos.Todas ellas cuentan con sus emprendimientos, pero también hacen actividades juntas para poder fomentar su compañerismo.
Una de las miembros es la señora Cecilia, quien nos cuenta que se dedica a la venta de frutas de todo tipo, es un trabajo muy sacrificado según cuenta ella, pero dice a la vez que le gusta mucho y que está orgullosa de lo que hace ya que es un trabajo honesto y digno.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de frutas de estación, como ser bananas, manzanas, sandias, melones y demás, con lo cual podrá surtirse y tener variedad para ofrecer a sus clientes, pues esta es la época donde más demanda tiene.
texts.en:
The women in the communal bank Kuña Oñondivepa decided to begin this valuable project offered by Fundacion Paraguaya which grants them loans and above all to receive the training that helps them very much to know how to use these resources.

All of them have their own pledges, but also they have activities together to foster their camaraderie.

One of the members is Cecilia, who says that she works selling all kinds of fruit. It is self-sacrificing work according to what she tells us, but she says that at the same time she likes it very much and is proud of what she does as is it honest and dignified work.

She is asking for a loan in order to buy seasonal fruit, such as bananas, apples, watermelons, melons and other fruit, so she can stock up and have a variety to offer her customers because this is the season when the demand is highest.

loans.use: to buy seasonal fruit for resale

loans.name: Jehová Jiré Group

texts.es:
Este Banco comunal se llama “Jehová Jiré” está conformado por 19 emprendedores, quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran pastelería, productos de amasandería, venta de ropa y la confección de cortinas para camiones. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la comuna de San Vicente de Tagua-Tagua.
Rosa delegada de educación del grupo del Banco comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra en la segunda fila de pié, ubicada en el segundo lugar de derecha a izquierda, vistiendo una polera color negro, su cabello es corto (melena).
Se dedica al rubro de la peluquería, desde hace 10 años. Trabaja desde su casa, ahí habilitó una pequeña pieza, para utilizarla como peluquería. Preferentemente los servicios que entrega desde su casa son cortar el cabello. Y depilación la realiza en los domicilios de sus clientes particulares.
Su horario es relativo, debido a la demanda de sus clientes por lo que tiene disponibilidad para atenderlos cualquier día y en cualquier horario. Comenta que recibe mucha demanda de trabajo, situación favorable para su negocio. 
Los productos que necesita para su negocio los compra en diferentes distribuidoras y casas comerciales cosmetológicas. Además comenta que recibe beneficios y descuentos por compra debido a la antigüedad como clienta frecuente.
Una de sus metas para su negocio, son ampliar el espacio físico de su taller, para esto debe ampliar su casa, lo cual le facilitará su negocio en comodidad.
Con el crédito comprará artículos y materiales para construir su nuevo taller. 
Rosa vive junto a su marido y sus tres hijos. Todos ellos estudian en diferentes niveles educacionales, entre universidad, educación media y básica.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad que le ha brindado Fondo Esperanza para invertir en su negocio. Respecto al grupo comenta que ha sido muy buena la convivencia con los demás emprendedores. 
San Vicente de Tagua Tagua es una comuna de la zona central de Chile, perteneciente a la región del Libertador General Bernardo O´Higgins, emplazada a orillas del río Estero Zamorano. Su principal fuente económica se basa en la producción de limones, naranjas y paltas. La ciudad ha sido destino de muchos inmigrantes que fueron acogidos y se desarrollaron en ella, principalmente de las colonias palestina, española (especialmente Asturiana) e italiana, que han dejado su legado en la comuna, Casa García, Tienda España, El Portalón, ferretería Covadonga, población Bathich y el reloj ubicado en la plaza de armas son una muestra de los proyectos desarrollados.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called Jehová Jiré.  It is comprised of 19 enterprising members who devote themselves to different types of work.  Among them you will find a pastry shop, a bakery, clothing sales, and making upholstery for trucks.  All of them live in the city of San Vicente de Tagua-Tagua.

Rosa is the education delegate of the communal bank.  She is standing in the second row, and she is the second one going from right to left.  She is wearing a black top, and she has short hair.

She has been a hairdresser for ten years.  She works at home; this is where she set up a small area to use as a beauty shop.  The service she chooses to provide at her house is cutting hair.  She provides the service of depilation in the homes of her private customers.

Her schedule is flexible according to her customers’ demand.  She has to be available to provide them with her services at any hour on any day.  She says that there is a lot of demand for her work, which is a favorable situation for her business.

She buys the products that she needs for her business from different distributors and from cosmetic commercial houses.  She also says that she gets benefits and discounts when she buys because she is a frequent and longtime customer. 

One of her goals for her business is to expand the physical space of her shop.  In order to do so she needs to expand her house.  That will make her business setting comfortable.

She will use the loan to buy articles and materials to build her new shop.

Rosa lives with her husband and their three children.  All of them go to different levels of school; the university, high school, and elementary school.

She is very happy and grateful for the opportunity that the Fondo Esperanza has given her to invest in her business.  In regards to the group, she says that it has been very good to be with the other enterprising members.

San Vicente de Tagua Tagua is a city in the central area of Chile in the Libertador General Bernardo O'Higgins region on the banks of the river Estero Zamorano. The area's main source of income is the production of lemons, oranges and avocados.  The city has been the destination of many immigrants who have been welcomed and established  themselves there.  They have come from the settlements in Palestine, Spain (especially Asturian), and Italy.  They have left their legacy in the commune; Casa García, Tienda España, El Portalón, Covadonga hardware, the Bathich population, and the clock in the Plaza de Armas are examples of the pojects they have developed.

loans.use: to buy items and materials to build a new shop.

loans.name: Lisbed Marinze

texts.es: A sus 25 años, la señora Lisbed se dedica a la venta de productos alimenticios en un pequeño local ubicado en el centro de la ciudad de Medellín, el cual le ha permitido generar los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de ella y de su hija de 4 años a quien su padre abandonó cuando era tan solo una bebé, por esta razón, la señora Lisbed es padre y madre al mismo tiempo. Debido a la ola invernal, las ventas aun disminuido considerablemente, por lo que la señora Lisbed desea comprar surtido de licor y cerveza con el ánimo de diversificar su negocio y tratar de recuperar sus ventas y mejorar los ingresos. El sueño de la señora Lisbed es ver crecer a su hija y ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Lisbed, age 25, sells food products in a small place located in the center of the city of Medellín.  This has allowed her to generate the needed income to support herself and her four year old daughter.  Her daughter’s father abandoned her when she was only a baby.  This is the reason the Lisbed is both father and mother at the same time.

Due to the harsh winter, sales have diminished considerably.  That is why Lisbed wishes to buy liquor and beer for her stock. Her thought is to diversify her business, to try to recuperate her sales, and to improve her income.  

Lisbed’s dream is to see her daughter grow and to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy stock of liquor and beer.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María, de 64 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora, así como alegre y amable, esta separada de su pareja, vive en compañía de su madre, su hija de 38 años de edad, su yerno y su nieto de 9 años de edad, instalada cómodamente en su propia casa.
El negocio que tiene María es la venta de mercaderías que trae desde la ciudad de Lima como sabanas, edredones, colchas, cubrecamas, y otros, para eso cuenta co una sobria que vive en la ciudad de Lima quien le realiza las compras para que luego María pueda venderlo entre sus amistades, vecinos y familiares, vendiendo de forma ambulatoria y desde su casa, dejando a crédito de hasta 2 meses gracias a que se hizo conocida a logrado tener una regular clientela, durante estos 06 años que viene desempeñando ese negocio ella sola.
Le gusta su negocio pues le permite tener un oficio, así como tener un ingreso económico para pagar sus gastos personales y de su hogar. Por lo contario lo que le incomoda es que algunos de sus clientes se demoran en el pago de sus créditos, pero aun así logra tener buenas ganancias, por eso tiene planes de mantenerse en su negocio. Este será el préstamo número 4 con la institución MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos. Además comenta sentirse bien con su banco comunal pues considera a sus integrantes ser personas tranquilas y responsables.
Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles los invertirá en la compra de mas mercaderías de su negocio al por mayor para ésta campaña navideña.
texts.en:
María, age 64, is a hard-working, enterprising, happy, and kind woman.  She is separated from her life partner.  She lives comfortably in her own house with her mother, her 38 year old daughter, her son-in-law, and her nine year old grandson. 

Maria’s business is selling merchandise that she gets in the city of Lima.  She sells things like sheets, comforters, quilts, bedspreads, and others.  To do this she has a niece who lives in the city of Lima.  Her niece makes the purchases so that later María is able to sell them to her friends, neighbors and relatives.  She sells in an itinerant manner and from her house.  

She gives credit for up to two months.  Thanks to becoming well-known she has managed to have a regular clientele.  She has been carrying out this work in her business by herself for six years.  She likes her business as it allows her to have an occupation.  It also allows her to have income to pay for her personal and household expenses.  What annoys her is that some customers delay paying off their credit.  However, she still manages to have good income.  That is why she plans to maintain her business.

This will be her fourth loan with MFP.  She hopes for your collaboration in order to continue with her objectives.  She says that she feels good with her communal bank as she considers the members to be calm and responsible people.

She will use the requested 1,000 soles to buy more wholesale merchandise for her business during this Chrismas season. 
.

loans.use: to buy more wholesale merchandise like sheets, comforters, quilts, bedspreads, and others.

loans.name: Carla

texts.es: Carla, de 31 años de edad, es una mujer decidida y trabajadora, además de alegre y muy cordial, esta separada de su pareja hace 2 años, vive en compañía de sus dos hijos de 9 y 6 años de edad a los quiere mucho y son su motivación, habitando cómodamente en su propia casa. La actividad que tiene Carla es la repostería, preparando pasteles, tortas y buffet para todo acontecimiento social como fiestas de cumpleaños, promociones escolares, matrimonios y otros. Y para ésta campaña navideña tiene pedidos de elaborar panetones, contando para eso con un horno a gas que compró hace 2 años atrás con un crédito de MFP, instalándolo en su propia casa, donde elabora sus productos. Desde hace 5 años que viene realizando ese oficio con la ayuda de una amiga a la que paga por trabajo entregado. Le gusta su oficio pues le gusta mucho la repostería, actividad que aprendió en un centro de educación ocupacional, además de los ingresos económicos que le ayudan a pagar los gastos de alimentación y educación de sus hijos, ya que con la pensión que le da el padre de sus hijos no les alcanza. Por otro lado, comenta que tiene deseos de abrir un local e instalar vitrinas donde pueda exhibir sus productos, en alguna zona comercial de la ciudad. Este será el préstamo número 11 con la institución MFP.  Está muy contenta de  saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su negocio. Por otro lado comenta sentirse bien con banco comunal, pues considera a sus miembros ser personas responsables. Con el monto solicitado de 2500 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en la compra de materiales para la preparación de panetones como harina, levadura, pasas, frutas y demás.
texts.en:
Carla is 31 years old. She is a determined working woman, but also happy and very friendly. She has been separated from her partner for 2 years. She lives with her 2 children who are 9 and 6 years old who she loves so much and who are her motivation. They live comfortably in her own house.

Carla is a baker, making pastries, cakes and buffet meals for all social occasions such as birthday parties, school graduations, weddings and so forth. And for this Christmas season she has an order to make panettones on her gas stove that she bought 2 years ago with a loan from MFP, installing it in her own house, where she makes her products.

She has been doing this for 5 years with the help of a friend that she pays for the work she delivers. She likes her work because she loves to bake. This is work she learned at a vocational education center. It brings in the financial earnings that helps to pay for food and educational expenses for her children, which are more than the alimony she receives from the father of her children.

In addition, she says that she hopes to open a facility and install display cases where she can show off her products, in a commercial area of the city. 

This will be her 11th loan through MFP. She is very happy to know that she will have financial help, as she will feel secure going forward with the business. She also tells us that she feels good about the communal bank, and she considers the members to be trustworthy people. With the 2500 soles from the loan, she will buy supplies for making the panettones such as flour, yeast, raisins, fruit, and other items.

loans.use: to buy flour, yeast, raisins and fruit

loans.name: Bernardina

texts.es:
La Sra  Bernardina es de la ciudad de Mariano Roque Alonso, tiene 49 años, tiene tres hijos, dos varones en edad escolar y una niña que esta en el colegio. Su marido trabaja como chófer en una empresa de transporte.
Ella cuenta que tiene una mercería bien surtida en su casa, allí vende todo tipo de cosas, como ser zapatos, ropas, artículos de librería, etc. Dice que le va muy bien en las ventas puesto que tiene de todo y eso le trae muy buenos ingresos. Ella desea poder seguir creciendo y es por ello que pide la ayuda de la fundación y de kiva.
Solicita el credito para la compra de remeras, bermudas y zapatillas y agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que le da en el crédito, ya que para ella es un apoyo importantísimo.
texts.en:
Bernardina is from Mariano Roque Alonso.  She is 49 and has three children - two boys of school age and a girl at primary school.  Her husband is a chauffeur for a transport firm. 

She tells us that she has a well stocked haberdashery store at her home, where she sells all kinds of things, such as shoes, clothes, books and magazines etc.  She says that she makes very good sales as she sells a bit of everything, which brings her a good income.  She hopes to continue to grow her business and it is for this reason that she is asking for support from Kiva.

She is asking for the loan to buy t-shirts, Bermuda shorts, trainers and is grateful to the Foundation for the opportunity that the loan gives her, as it is of great help to her business.

loans.use: to buy t-shirts, Bermuda shorts, trainers and other items.

loans.name: Sela

texts.en:
Sela is married and she's 47 years of age. She has two children.

Sela owns and operates a business venture, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. She has three years of experience in this business.    

Sela  needs a loan of WST 2,000 to purchase snacks, soft drinks, flour, sugar, salt, tin fish, mosquito coils and chicken leg quarters. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be WST 450 or US $188 per week) to improve and expand the business.

Sela  joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Sela 's third loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase snacks, soft drinks, flour, sugar, salt , tin fish, mosquito coils and chicken.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Miguel Ángel  tiene 54 años es casado vive con la esposa y con los 3 hijos. Vive en el Recinto  Aguas frías de Mocache, Cantón Mocache.

Ventanilla EL PROGRESO  se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Aguas Frías de Mocache, perteneciente al cantón Mocache, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, frejol hace 22 años.
Miguel Ángel  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz en terrenos propios. Compra sus productos en Mocache y las vende en el mercado de Mocache.

El crédito solicito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos para los cultivos. El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos para el consumo de la familia y para invertir en la siembra. Su sueño es comprar un terreno.

Disfruta mucho en sus tiempos libres haciendo deporte.
texts.en:
Miguel Ángel is 54 years old, married and lives with his wife and 3 children. He lives in the Aguas Frías area of Mocache, in the Mocache Canton.

The Communal Bank El Progreso (Progress) is located in the area of Aguas Frías of Mocache, belonging to the canton of Mocache, and in this area are farmers of short-cycle crops such as corn, rice, and beans.

Miguel Ángel has been working for 22 years in agriculture planting corn and rice in his own lot. He buys his products in Mocache and sells them in the Mocache market place. 

He is asking for a loan to buy seed, fertilizer and compost for his crops. The loan money has helped him to expand his income for the use of his family and to invest in seed. His dream is to buy land. He likes to play sports in his free time.

loans.use: to buy seed, fertilizer, and compost for the crops

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es:
La señora Catalina es de la ciudad de Caaguazú, tiene 48 años de edad, está casada hace 32 años con el señor Pedro de 50 años, tiene seis hijos de los cuales dos fallecieron, dos están casadas y viven en forma independiente y los otros viven con su padre.
Cuenta que desde hace mucho tiempo se dedica a la venta ambulante de todo tipo de productos, como ser prendas de vestir, calzados, ropas interiores y demás. Ella junto con su marido salen por las ciudades aledañas y otros mas distante a llevar sus productos de mercerías, roperías y artículos de bazar, realizando su recorrido en una camioneta que el matrimonio cuenta, ya tiene su clientela formada  y semanalmente les visita para llevar los pedidos que tiene.                                                                          Solicita este préstamo para la compra de championes, remeras, blusas, calzas, ropa interior, toallas, toallas, vaquero para damas y caballeros, edredón y  otros artículos que le permitirá ofrecer variedad a sus clientes y poder mejorar su ingreso mensual.-
texts.en:
Catalina is from the city of Caaguazú. She is 48 years old and had been married for 32 years to Pedro who is 50 years old. She has six children of which two have died. Two are married and live independently while the others live with their father.

She says that for a long time she has made a living selling all kinds of products door to door, like clothing, shoes, underwear and more. Together with her husband they go out to the neighboring cities and others that are further away. They bring their sewing materials, clothing and stationery products and make their rounds in a truck that the couple has. They have a steady clientele and make their visits weekly to deliver the orders they have.

She is requesting this loan to buy sneakers, t-shirts, blouses, nylons, underwear, towels, jeans for men and women, quilts and other items that will allow her to offer variety to her customers and be able to improve her monthly income.

loans.use: to buy sewing items, shoes, and more to supply her stock of products.

loans.name: Eugenia Mercedes

texts.es:
Eugenia de 22 años, es una mujer trabajadora ya que es vendedora ambulante de ropa y bisutería. Comenzó su trabajo vendiendo por revista y catálogos ahora tiene un grupo de clientes estables ya que vende la ropa en el mercado de Milagro. 

En la actualidad trabaja desde muy temprano vendiendo la ropa. Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su familia por eso quiere continuar trabajando vendiendo.  El préstamo lo quiere comprar ropa y así poder tener más ingresos para ayudar con los pagos de la casa ya que es madre soltera.
texts.en:
Eugenia is 22 years old. She is a hardworking woman who is a street vendor. She sells clothing and jewelry. She started her job selling via catalogues and now she has a group of regular customers, since she sells clothes in the Milagro market.  

At present, she starts work very early selling the clothes. She has a lot of dreams with her family and that's why she wants to keep selling. She wants the loan to help with house payments, since she is a single mother.

loans.use: to buy clothes

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es:
El señor Pablo tiene 38 años de edad, está casado hace 16 años con la señora Victorina de 37 años, tienen dos hijos, uno de 15 y 10 años respectivamente, el mayor está cursando el primer años de la media y la menor está en el 4to. Grado.
El sr. Pablo se dedica a la carpintería desde hace 5 años, trabajo mucho tiempo como empleado, luego salió de su trabajo y de su liquidación monto para su propio negocio, su señora tambien trabaja y juntos se ayudan a llevar adelante los gastos de la familia. Pablo tiene como prioridad mantener una familia estable y que sus hijos tenga la posibilidad de terminar una carrera universitaria.                                                                         Solicita este préstamo para la compra de madera, terciadas, clavos que lo utilizará en su carpineria ya que llega fin de año y cuenta con varios pedidos y asi cumplir con su clientela.-
texts.en:
Pablo is 38 years old. He has ben married for 16 years to Victorina, who is 37. They have two children, aged 15 and 10. The oldest is in the first years of high school and the youngest is in 4th grade.
  
Pablo has been a carpenter for 5 years. He worked as an employee for many years, and later left his job. With his severance he started his own business. His wife also works and together they help each other to pay for the family expenses. Pablo's priority is keeping his family stable and giving his children the chance to finish college. 
                                                                         
He is asking for this loan to buy wood, plywood and nails which he will use in his carpentry. The end of the year is approaching and he has several orders and this way he can satisfy his customers.

loans.use: Comprar madera, plywood, nails, etc.

loans.name: Cruz Mercedes

texts.es:
Cruz Mercedes tiene 22 años es soltera, vive con los papás. Vive en el Recinto  Aguas frías de Mocache, Cantón Mocache.

Ventanilla EL PROGRESO  se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Aguas Frías de Mocache, perteneciente al cantón Mocache, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz.

Cruz Mercedes se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz en terrenos propios. Compra sus productos en Mocache y las vende en el mercado de Mocache.

El crédito solicito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos para los cultivos. El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos para el consumo de la familia y para invertir en la siembra. Su sueño es comprar una casa.

Disfruta mucho en sus tiempos libres haciendo deporte.
texts.en:
Cruz Mercedes is 22 years old. She is single and lives with her parents in Aguas frías de Mocache, in Mocache province.

The 'El Progreso' community bank is also located here. The members of this bank work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn and rice.

Cruz Mercedes grows corn and rice on her own land.  She buys her products in Mocache and sells them at the Mocache market. 

She is requesting the loan to buy seed, fertilizers and manure for her crops.  The loan will help her to increase her income for her family and to invest in her crops.  Her dream is to buy a house.  

She enjoys practising sports in her free time.

loans.use: to buy seed, fertilizers and manure for her crops.

loans.name: Faatuai

texts.en:
Faatuai is 23 years of age and married. She has three children.

Faatuai owns and operates a business venture, selling general handicrafts to tourists and local community members. She has one year of experience in this business.    

Faatuai needs a loan of WST 1,000 to purchase wood for carving and varnishing paint. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be WST 450 or US $188 per week) to improve and expand the business.

Faatuai joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Faatuai's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase wood for carving and varnishing paint.

loans.name: Lucita

texts.es: Lucita, de 29 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, además de ser alegre y amable, es soltera, vive en compañía de sus 04 hermanos, su padre y su madre, instalados cómodamente en casa de sus padres. El negocio familia que  tiene Lucita es la venta de lubricantes para motocicletas y motocarros, para eso cuenta con una tienda en un local alquilado en una avenida comercial de su ciudad. Además que ella es de profesión técnica agroveterinaria y está laborando en una agroveterinaria, de esa manera tiene varios ingresos económicos. Tiene más de 02 años dedicándose al negocio familiar. Le gusta su negocio pues le permite ver su capital crecer, y con las ganancias obtenidas compraron en sociedad con sus padres un bote de pesca artesanal para incursionar en éste negocio. Ahora se siente como una prospera empresaria, deseando en un futuro adquirir más botes para ampliar  y hacer crecer su negocio y así tener más ganancias. Este será el primer préstamo con la institución MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos. Por otro lado se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Con el monto solicitado de 800 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la implementación de su bote de pesca comprando tramperas y redes de pesca.
texts.en:
Lucita is 29 years old.  She is a very hard-working, happy and friendly lady.  She is single and lives comfortably with her 4 brothers and her parents in her parents’ house.

The family business sells lubricant for motorbikes and three-wheeler vans and they rent a shop space on a commercial road in her city.  In addition to this she is also an agrovetinary physician and work in an agrovetinary surgery, so she has various sources of income.  She has spent more than 2 years working for the family business.  She likes having the business as she can watch her money grow.  With her earnings, she and her parents bought a handcrafted fishing boat to add to the business. She now feels like an accomplished businesswoman and hopes to buy more boats in the future so as to expand and grow her business, thus making more money.

This will be her first loan with the MFP Field Partner.  She hopes that they will help her so that she can move forward with her plans and she promises to make her repayments.  She will invest the 800 new Soles that she has asked for in her fishing boat, buying fish traps and nets.

loans.use: to buy fish traps and nets

loans.name: Rosalba

texts.es: La señora Rosalba gracias a las ventas por catálogo de productos cosméticos y para la belleza ha podido sacar adelante a sus 6 hijos, aunque es un trabajo muy duro puesto que le toca caminar muchas horas en busca de clientes y entregando pedidos, es una gran trabajadora y hace su trabajo siempre con el ánimo de lograr generar bienestar a su familia y suplir las necesidades básicas. Para poder cumplir con varios pedidos que tiene la señora Rosalba pendientes, necesita de la compra de surtido con el cual pueda cumplirle a sus clientes y continuar generando los ingresos para el sustento de su hogar.
texts.en:
Thanks to selling catalogue cosmetics and beauty products, Rosalba has been able to raise her six children, although it is a very tough job as she has to walk for many hours in search of customers and delivering orders.  

She is very hard working and her motivation is always to provide for her family's well-being and to cover their basic needs.  

To be able to complete a number of outstanding orders she needs to buy supplies, so that she can meet her customers' demands and continue earning an income to maintain her home.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and beauty products

loans.name: Los Tulipanes Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Cynthia Jazmin tiene 26 años, tiene un hijo pequeño. Ella forma parte del grupo "Los Tulipanes" integrado por 7 socias residentes de la zona de Raul Porras Barrenechea.
Desde hace 10 años se dedica a la administración de su pequeña imprenta, gracias a su negocio ella ha logrado mentener a su hijo y equipar su casa con los artefactos necesarios.
El prestamo recibido lo invertirá en la compra de insumos para su imprenta y poder atender sus pedidos de almanaques por la campaña de nuevo año.
texts.en:
Cynthia Jazmin is 26 and she has a young son.  She belongs to the "Tulipanes" group, comprising seven members living in the Raul Porras Barrenechea area.

She has spent ten years running her small printing works.  Thanks to her business she has been able to look after her son and buy everything necessary to run her home.

She will use the loan to buy supplies for her printing works and to be able to manage her calendar orders for the New Year sales push.

loans.use: INVERTIRÁ EN LA COMPRA DE MATERIALES PARA SU IMPRENTA

loans.name: Dolly

texts.es:
La Sra. Dolly es de la ciudad de Coronel Oviedo, tiene 43 años de edad, esta casada con el Sr. Alberto hace 26 años, tienen 6 hijos juntos: Mariela, Luis, Nancy, Victor, Natalia y Vitoria.
La Sra. Dolly es una mujer luchadora, ya que su marido el Sr. Alberto trabaja lejos de la ciudad y ella se encarga de cuidar y criar a sus seis hijos, tiene una despensa y venta de minutas hace 5 años, comenta que con el trabajo de su marido no es suficiente para sacar adelante una familia numerosa por eso se pusieron  montar su despensa. Comenzó  poco a poco su negocio y fue creciendo con la ayuda de sus hijos. Su sueño es tener un minimercado para ofrecer mejor servicios a sus clientes.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de bebidas, harina, azúcar y demás insumos necesarios para poder surtir su local. Agradece a la fundación por la oportunidad que esta le da.
texts.en:
Dolly is from the city Coronel de Oviedo. She is 43 and has been married to Alberto for 26 years. They have 6 children: Mariela, Luis, Nancy, Victor, Natalia and Vitoria. Dolly is a fighter. Her husband works far from the city, so she takes charge of the caring and raising of their six children. 

She has run a small grocery store and has sold cell-phone minutes for 5 years. She says her husband’s work was not enough to get such a large family ahead in life, which is why she opened the store. She started the business one step at a time, and slowly grew it with the help of her kids. Her dream is to have a mini market to offer better services to her customers. 

She is requesting the loan to purchase drinks, flour, sugar, and other staples necessary to stock her store. She is thankful to the foundation for the opportunity that it gives her.

loans.use: purchase drinks, flour, sugar, and other staples

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Miguel Ángel  tiene 25 años es soltero tiene un hijo, vive con la mamá . Vive en el Recinto Aguas frías de Mocache, Cantón Mocache.

Ventanilla EL PROGRESO  se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Aguas Frías de Mocache, perteneciente al cantón Mocache, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz.

Miguel Ángel  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz . Compra sus productos en Mocache y las vende en el mercado de Mocache.

El crédito solicito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos para los cultivos. El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos para el consumo de la familia y para invertir en la siembra. Su sueño es comprar un terreno.

Disfruta mucho en sus tiempos libres haciendo deporte.
texts.en:
Miguel Ángel is 25 years old, single, and has one child who lives with the child's mother.  Miguel Ángel lives in the precinct of Aguas Frías de Mocache, which is part of the administrative division of Mocache.  

The organization El Progreso is located in the precinct of Aguas Frías de Mocache, which is part of the administrative division of Mocache.  This organization works in short term agricultural labor and plants corn and rice.

Miguel Ángel works planting corn and rice.  He buys his products in Mocache and sells them in the market of Mocache.

He is asking for credit in order to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and organic compounds for his fields.  The loan will help him increase his income for family consumption and to invest in planting.  His dream is to buy his own land.

In his free time he very much enjoys playing sports.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and organic compounds for his fields.

loans.name: Gloria Orlinda

texts.es: La señora Gloria Orlinda a sus 44 años de edad se dedica en su propio taller ubicado en su casa a la confección de ropa de mujer, con una experiencia de mas de 10 años en esta actividad ha logrado sacar adelante a sus dos hijos y apoyado económicamente a sus padres. La señora Gloria desea sacar una producción de camisas para dama para ofrecer a sus clientes, pero no cuenta con los insumos necesarios para tal fin, por lo que necesita de la compra de telas e hilos con lo cual pueda hacer sus prendas y así generar los recursos necesarios para su sustento y el de sus padres.
texts.en: 44-year-old Gloria Orlinda makes women's clothes, and has her own workshop at home. She has more than 10 years experience of more than 10 years in this business and has raised her two children and financially supported her parents. Gloria want to produce blouses to offer her customers, but does not have the supplies needed for this product. She needs to purchase fabric and thread with which to make the garments and generate the income to support herself and her family.

loans.use: to purchase fabric and thread for producing blouses.

loans.name: Esther

texts.es:
Esther 
Comercio 
500000



	Mujer joven, tiene 28 años,  se presenta como una persona trabajadora, responsable y honesta, según las referencias suministradas. Se caso en el 2003 y desde entonces ha apoyado a su pareja en los gastos del hogar, tiene una hija de 5 años y sueña con establecer su propio negocio en un local (una zapatería). Maneja productos de 2 catálogos y compra en tiendas ofertas y promociones para revender, obteniendo su ganancia, aportando al hogar y al cuido de su hija.

	Vende cosméticos y ropa interior inició después de su matrimonio en el 2003 con C 30.000 colones obtenidos por la venta de varios libros que tenía su esposo, compró mercadería y la revendió, hasta la fecha mantiene este mismo ritmo ya que sus facturas se pagan respetando los plazos de las empresas, prefiere trabajar de contado. Mantiene una cartera activa de 25 clientes y un inventario en su casa para cubrir pedidos ocasionales.

	Ella se levanta y atiende a su esposo que sale al trabajo deja a su hija con un familiar y sale después de medio día, esta rutina la realiza 3 veces por semana. La limitante mayor es el transporte y el capital, por esta razón solicita este préstamo para cubrir los pedidos de fin y principio de año que es una buena época para el comercio.

	 Es una actividad estable, manteniendo un ritmo de compras y ventas durante todo el año, sus ingresos son constantes.  La actividad tiene 8 años de trabajo, presenta buenas referencias de compra y maneja una cartera de clientes fija y un período de recuperación estable. Vende mercadería de calidad y respaldada por una marca.
texts.en:
Esther is a young woman of 28 years old, and her references describe her as a hard worker who is responsible and honest. She married in 2003 and has since supported her partner in the household expenses, they have a 5 year old daughter and Esther hopes to establish her own business in her own premises (a shoe store). She handles products from 2 catalogs and buys items from stores which have offers and promotions, which she then resells for a profit so that she can contribute to the household and caring for her daughter.

Esther started selling cosmetics and lingerie after her marriage in 2003 with 30,000 colones she made from the sale of several of her husband's books, she then bought goods to resell.  To date she has maintained the same system and pays her bills on time, and prefers to work in cash. She maintains an active portfolio of 25 clients and a home inventory to cover occasional orders.

Esther gets up and attends to her husband who goes to work, she then leaves her daughter with a relative and leaves the house at noon, a routine that she performs 3 times per week. Her main challenge is transportation and capital, and she requires this loan to cover the orders for the end and beginning of the year as it's the busiest time to trade.

This is a stable occupation, and Esther maintains the pace of purchases and sales throughout the year, providing a constant income. She has had her business for 8 years, has good references and manages a portfolio of fixed customers and a period of steady recovery. She sells ​​quality merchandise and is endorsed by a good brand.

loans.use: Sell products from catalogues, mainly cosmetics and lingerie.

loans.name: Blanca Hortencia

texts.es:
Blanca Hortensia  tiene 21 años es soltera, vive con sus padres. Vive en el Recinto  Aguas frías de Mocache, Cantón Mocache.

Ventanilla EL PROGRESO  se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Aguas Frías de Mocahe, perteneciente al cantón Mocache, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz.

Blanca Hortensia  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz en terrenos propios. Compra sus productos en Mocache y las vende en el mercado de Mocache.

El crédito solicito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos para los cultivos. El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos para el consumo de la familia y para invertir en la siembra. Su sueño es comprar un terreno.

Disfruta mucho en sus tiempos libres haciendo deporte.
texts.en:
21-year-old Blanca Hortensia is single and lives with her parents. She lives in Recinto Aguas de Mocache, in Cantón Mocache.

The communal bank 'El Progreso' is located in Recinto Aguas Frías de Mocahe, this bank supports agricultural work such as planting short-cycle maize, rice.

Blanca Hortensia grows corn and rice on her own land. She buys her goods in Mocache sells the crops in Mocache market. She has requested the loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and manure for her crops. The loan will help to increase her family's income and allow her to invest in planting crops. Her dream is to buy a plot of land.

In her free time, Blanca enjoys playing sports.

loans.use: para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos para los cultivos

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase cement, stone, sand, zinc, and brick to improve his home.

loans.name: Dionicio

texts.es:
El Sr. Dionicio es de la ciudad de Santaní, tiene 54 años de edad, esta casado con la Sra. Delsiveria de 52 años de edad. Tienen 3 hijos todos ya mayores de edad, que trabajan de forma independiente.
Dionicio comenta que tiene una despensa muy bien surtida en su propia casa, dice que le va muy bien debido a los buenos precios que tiene y sumado a eso la amabilidad con que atiende a los clientes. Respecto a su clientela dice que ya la tiene bien formada, lo que lo ayuda a tener un buen ingreso.
El solicita el crédito para poder abastecer su local, con todo tipo de insumos, como ser bebidas, comestibles, lácteos, panificados y demás tipo de productos. Agradece a la fundación por la oportunidad que esta le da.
texts.en:
54-year-old Dionicio is from Santaní city, and is married to Delsiveria (52). They have 3 adult children who work independently.

Dionicio has a well-stocked pantry at home, and says he is doing very well due to their good prices and friendly service they offer to their customers. He has already formed a good customer base, which helps him earn a good income.

This loan has been requested to enable Dionicio to stock his shop with all kinds of produce, such as drinks, food, dairy, baked goods and other products. 

Dionicio gives thanks to the foundation for this opportunity.

loans.use: to purchase drinks, perishable goods, dairy and baked produce and other items to sell in his store.

loans.name: Blanca Teresa

texts.es:
Blanca Teresa  tiene 42 años es casada, vive con el esposo   y los hijos. Vive en el Recinto Aguas frías de Mocache, Cantón Mocache.
