Ventanilla EL PROGRESO  se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Aguas Frías de Mocache, perteneciente al cantón Mocache, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, cacao hace 10 años.

Blanca Teresa  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz y cacao en terrenos propios. Compra sus productos en Mocache y las vende en el mercado de Mocache.

El crédito solicito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos para los cultivos. El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos para el consumo de la familia y para invertir en la siembra. Su sueño es comprar una casa y un carro.

Disfruta mucho en sus tiempos libres haciendo deporte, leer.
texts.en:
Blanca Teresa is 42 years old and married. She lives with her husband and children in Recinto Aguas Frías de Mocache, Cantón Mocache. 

The 'El Progreso' community bank is located in Aguas Frías de Mocache, in Mocache canton. The members of this bank work in short-cycle agriculture, and have been growing corn, rice and cacao for the past 10 years.

Blanca Teresa grows corn, rice and cocoa on her own land. She buys products from Mocache and sells them at Mocache market.

Blanca has requested this loan to purchase seeds, fertilizer and manure for her crops. The loan will help increase revenue for her family and allow her to invest in planting crops. Her dream is to buy a house and a car.

In her free time she enjoys playing sports and reading.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer and manure for her crops.

loans.name: Jose Manuel

texts.es:
José Manuel  tiene 23 años es soltero, vive con los padres. Vive en el Recinto Aguas frías de Mocache, Cantón Mocache,Tiene una hija.

Ventanilla EL PROGRESO  se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Aguas Frías de Mocache, perteneciente al cantón Mocache, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz.

José Manuel se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Compra sus productos en Mocache y las vende en el mercado de Mocache.

El crédito solicito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos para los cultivos. El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos para el consumo de la familia y para invertir en la siembra. Su sueño es comprar un terreno.

Disfruta mucho en sus tiempos libres haciendo deporte.
texts.en:
23-year-old José Manuel is single and lives with his parents. He lives in Recinto Aguas Frías de Mocache, in Cantón Mocache, and he has one daughter.

The community bank 'El Progreso' is located in Recinto Aguas Frías de Mocache, and the members work with short cycle agriculture, growing corn and rice.

José Manuel farms corn and rice. He purchases his products in Mocache and sells his crops at Mocache market. 

He has requested this loan to purchase seeds, fertilizer and manure for his crops. The loan will help him to increase his family's income and invest in growing his crops. His dream is to buy land.

In his spare time, José Manuel enjoys playing sports.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer and manure for growing crops.

loans.name: Oketi

texts.en:
Oketi is 31 years of age and married. She has four children.

Oketi owns and operates a business venture, selling pancakes in her village. She has three years of experience in this business.    

Oketi needs a loan of WST 1,500 to purchase flour, baking powder, another frying pan and sugar. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be WST 320 or US $133 per week) to improve and expand the business.

In 2000, Oketi joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Oketi's second loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase flour, baking powder, another frying pan and sugar.

loans.name: Mary

texts.es: Mary, de 27 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, así como también es alegre y amable, es conviviente con Robin quien es docente, vive en compañía de su suegra, cuñada, su pareja y sus hijos de 2 años y 2 meses de edad, habitando en la casa de su suegra. El negocio que Mary es la venta de comida en el frontis de la casa de su suegra, para eso cuenta con una mesa y utensilios necesarios para atender muy bien a sus clientes, ya que viendo que  su zona es transitada considera que tiene demanda y viendo la necesidad económica que tenía en su hogar se decidió por empezar en éste negocio. Espera en el futuro crecer y tener algunas personas que le ayuden. Le gusta ese negocio pues comenta le gusta mucho cocinar, pues aprendió de su madre quien le enseñó los secretos de una buena sazón, con eso espera poder ganarse la preferencia y aceptación de sus clientes. Además tiene planes de abrir un restaurante en alguna zona comercial de la ciudad de Pucallpa, logrando así obtener mayores ingresos. Este será el primer préstamo con la institución MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos. Además comenta estar a gusto con su banco comunal pues considera a sus integrantes ser buenas personas. Con el monto solicitado de nuevos soles lo invertirá en la compra de ingredientes para la preparación de comida.
texts.en:
Mary (27) is hardworking and earnest, with a cheerful and friendly personality.  She lives with her partner Robin who is a teacher, in his mothers house. They live together with his mother, sister, her partner and their children aged 2 years and 2 months. 

Mary has a business selling food outside the front of the house. She has a stall and the utensils needed to take good care of her customers. Mary saw that the area was busy and that there was a need for more financial support in their household, so she decided to start the business. She expects the business to grow in the future, and that she will employ people to help. 

Mary loves cooking and enjoys her work. Her mother taught her all her secrets of good flavors, and hopes that this will help her gain popularity and acceptance from her customers. Mary also has plans to open a restaurant in a commercial area of ​Pucallpa city, which would generate a higher income. 

This is Mary's first loan with MFP, and she hopes to continue the collaboration to achieve her goals. She says that she is happy with her ​​communal bank and considers its members to be good people. With the loan amount requested, Mary will for invest in the purchase of ingredients to prepare food for her stall.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to prepare food for her stall.

loans.name: Mariana De Jesus

texts.es:
Mariana de Jesus tiene 40 años es casada, vive con el esposo  y los  hijos. Vive en el Recinto Aguas frías de Mocache, Cantón Mocache.

Ventanilla EL PROGRESO  se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Aguas Frías de Mocahe, perteneciente al cantón Mocache, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz hace 15 años.

Mariana  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz en terrenos propios. Compra sus productos en Mocache y las vende en el mercado de Mocache.

El crédito solicito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos para los cultivos. El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos para el consumo de la familia y para invertir en la siembra. Su sueño es comprar una casa.

Disfruta mucho en sus tiempos libres estudia la Biblia.
texts.en:
Mariana de Jesús is 40 years old. She’s married and lives with her husband and children in Agua Frías de Mocache, which belongs to the Mocacha Cantón.

The “El Progreso” (Progress) communal bank is located in Aguas Frías de Mocache in the Mocache Canton. The members of this bank have been short cycle corn and rice farmers for 15 years.

Mariana grows rice and corn on her own land. She buys her supplies in Mocache and sells at the Mocache market.

She requested the loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, and manure for her crops.  The loan has helped her increase her income for her family’s use and to invest in planting.

Her dream is to buy a house.

She really enjoys studying the Bible in her free time.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, and manure for her crops.

loans.name: Rosa Laura

texts.es: La señora Rosa desde muy joven tuvo el espíritu emprendedor para iniciar con el servicio de arreglo de uñas de manos y píes, por tal motivo comenzó a realizar cursos para adquirir conocimientos sobre esta actividad. Continuamente se ha ido actualizando en tendencias de belleza y es reconocida por su trabajo creativo y calidad en su servicio. Con el ánimo de ofrecer un valor agregado a su servicio, la señora Rosa necesita de la compra de una maquina relajante para los pies con la cual pueda mejorar su servicio y diferenciarse de la competencia. A sus 34 años de edad, sueña con tener su propio centro atención integral en tratamientos de belleza y relajación.
texts.en:
Ever since she was very young Rosa has had the enterprising spirit to start a manicure and pedicure business.  That is why she started taking courses to gain the knowledge about this business activity.

She continually updates her services to reflect beauty trends, and she is known for her creative work and the quality of her service.

In the spirit of offering added value to her service, Rosa needs to buy a relaxing foot massage machine.  With the machine she will be able to improve her service and stand out from the competition.

At her 34 years of age she dreams of having a comprehensive center for beauty treatments and relaxation.

loans.use: to buy a foot massage machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy products like rice, oil, sugar, tomato sauce, shredded and ground meat, pasta, ribs, chicken, beans, condiments, and more to make her delicious food.

loans.name: Maletile

texts.en:
Maletile is 40 years of age, married, and has five children.

Maletile owns and operates a business venture, planting and harvesting taro for sale.  She has one year of experience in this business. Maletile needs a loan of WST $1,000 to purchase harvesting equipment, such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 250 talas or US $104 per week) to improve/expand her business.

Maletile joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Because they lack collateral, most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks. This is Maletile's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase harvesting equipment, such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives.

loans.name: Mirian Margoth

texts.es:
Marian MargotH tiene 29 años es casada, vive con la esposa  e  hijos. Vive en el Recinto  Aguas frías de Mocache, Cantón Mocache.

Ventanilla EL PROGRESO  se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Aguas Frías de Mocache, perteneciente al cantón Mocache, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz hace cuatro años.

Mirian Margot  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Compra sus productos en Mocache y las vende en el mercado de Mocache.

El crédito solicito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos para los cultivos. El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos para el consumo de la familia y para invertir en la siembra. Su sueño es comprar un terreno.
Disfruta mucho en sus tiempos libres vender productos naturales.
texts.en:
Marian Margoth is twenty-nine, married, and lives with her husband and children in Recinto Aguas Frías de Mocache in Mocache Canton. 

The El Progresso communal bank is located in Recinto Aguas Frías de Mocache in the Mocache canton and has supported short-season crop farming like corn and rice for four years.

Mirian Margoth earns her living farming rice and corn. She buys supplies in Mocache and sells her product in the Mocache market. 

She requested a loan to buy seeds and fertilizers. The loan has helped her bring in more income for her family and for investment in her crops. Her dream is to buy a plot of land. She really enjoys selling natural products in her spare time.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers for her crops.

loans.name: De Confianza Los Cerritos Group

texts.es: El Banco De Confianza Los Cerritos está conformado por 8 integrantes en el cual formaron este grupo de  emprendedores que luchan por seguir sus metas y objetivos de crecer con el negocio y en lo personal. La actividad económica de estos integrantes  de grupo son diferente. La señora Juana Francisca es una emprendedora exitosa, ella se dedica a la venta de pan, tortas y cosa de horno toda la vida ha luchado para salir adelante y brindarle a sus hijos una vida mejor. Juana Francisca desde hace tiempo está trabajando con Fundación León 2000, ahora está nuevamente solicitando financimiento para invertir en el negocio para esta temporada navideña que las ventas son buenas lo cual comprara materia prima y poder realizar las elaboración de la cosa de horno.
texts.en: The De Confianza Los Cerritos Communal Bank has 8 members. This group of entrepreneurs are fighting to reach their goals and grow, both personally and as businesspeople. Each member has a different business. Señora Juana Francisca is a successful entrepreneur. She sells bread, pies, and cosa de horno [buns, empanada and rosquilla]. She has worked hard all her life to succeed and offer her children a better life. Juana Francisca has worked with the Fundacion Leon 2000 for some time now. She is now requesting a loan to invest in her business for the Christmas season while sales are good. She will use this loan to buy basic ingredients for making cosa de horno.

loans.use: to buy basic materials to make cosa de horno.

loans.name: Luz Natividad

texts.es:
Luz Natividad tiene 48 años Unión Libre, vive con su Esposo  y sus  hijos de 22,25,24,18,12.años de edad  Vive en el Recinto  Aguas frías de Mocache, Cantón Mocache.

Ventanilla EL PROGRESO  se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Aguas Frías de Mocache, perteneciente al cantón Mocache, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz hace 25 años.
Luz Natividad  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Compra sus productos en Mocache y las vende en el mercado de Mocache.

El crédito solicito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos para los cultivos. El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos para el consumo de la familia y para invertir en la siembra. Su sueño es comprar una casa y un terreno.

Disfruta mucho en sus tiempos libres descanso.
texts.en:
Luz Natividad is 48. She is in a common-law marriage and lives with her husband and children, ages 12, 18, 22, 24 and 25. They live in the district of Aguas Frías de Mocache, in the Mocache Canton.
The El Progreso Communal Bank is located in the Aguas Frías de Mocache district. The members of this group have worked in short-cycle agriculture, sowing corn and rice, for 25 years.
Luz Natividad works in agriculture sowing corn and rice. She buys in Mocache and sells in the Mocache market.
She requested this loan for the purchase of seeds, fertilizer and manure for her crops. This loan will help her to increase her family's income and invest in her crops. Her dream is to buy a home and a plot of land.
She quite enjoys relaxing during her free time.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and manure for her crops.

loans.name: Los Soñadores Group

texts.es:
Este Banco comunal se llama “Los Soñadores” está conformado por 17 emprendedores, quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros entre los cuales se encuentran confección de ropa, venta de cosméticos por catalogo, preparación de productos de amasandería y chocolatería, entre otros negocios. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Valparaíso.
Claudio presidente del grupo del Banco comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra de pié en el primer lugar de derecha a izquierda, sosteniendo a su hijo de 4 meses de edad.
Se dedica al rubro del comercio vendiendo frutos secos en un puesto que instala en diferentes ferias libres. Tiene su negocio desde hace 10 años. Su horario de trabajo es a partir de las 8ºº de la mañana hasta las 15ºº de la tarde, durante todos los días de la semana.
Usualmente compra aceitunas, picles, cebolla escabeche, almendras y otros productos en el mercado de la ciudad. Durante la temporada de verano agrega a su negocio la venta de frutas de estación como las frutillas.
Con el crédito comprará frutos secos y aceitunas para abastecer su negocio.
Una de sus metas para su negocio es tener un local establecido que cuente con todos los permisos legales para comercializar.
Claudio vive junto a su esposa y sus tres hijos de 8, 3 y 4 meses de edad. Uno de sus sueños es prosperar con su negocio para brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
Su esposa también se dedica a vender frutos secos, sin embargo ella vende desde su casa, para su entorno más cercano.
Claudio está agradecido de la oportunidad que le ha brindado Fondo Esperanza para invertir en su negocio. Respecto a la convivencia con el grupo del Banco comunal, ha sido muy grata, por lo que Claudio se siente cómodo en seguir participando de la institución.
Valparaíso está situado a 120 kilómetros al noroeste de Santiago. Es la capital regional y además sede del poder legislativo del país. Es el primer puerto de la nación y ofrece gran variedad de lugares hermosos y pintorescos, como por ejemplo la casa del poeta Pablo Neruda, ganador del Premio Nobel.
texts.en:
This communal bank, called “Los Soñadores”, is made up of 17 entrepreneurs who have various jobs including: making clothing, selling cosmetics through a catalogue, a bakery, and chocolate making. They all live in the city of Valparaíso.
Claudio is the group president and appears in the photo, standing, first on the right, holding his four-month-old son.
He is a merchant and sells nuts and dried fruit in a stall in various markets. He has had this business for ten years, and works from 8:00 am to 3:00 pm every day of the week.
He normally buys pickles, olives, pickled onions, almonds, and other products in the city market. During the summer season he also sells seasonal fruits such as strawberries.
With this loan, he will buy nuts, dried fruit, and olives to stock his business.
One of his goals for his business is to have an established storefront and all of the legal permits to sell in it.
Claudio lives with his wife and three children, ages 3 and 8 years, and four months old. One of his dreams is for his business to prosper in order to provide his family with a better quality of life
His wife also sells nuts and dried fruit, but she sells from home in order to be nearby.
Claudio is grateful for the opportunity that Fondo Esperanza has given him to invest in his business. He has been a very pleasant member of his communal bank, and he feels comfortable continuing to participate in the Institution.
Valparaíso is located 120 kilometers north-east of Santiago. It is the regional capital and the seat of legislative power in the country. It is the gateway of the nation and offers a large variety of beautiful, picturesque locations; for example, the house of Nobel Prize-winning poet Pablo Neruda.

loans.use: to buy nuts, dried fruit and olives to stock his business.

loans.name: Roxana Elizabeth

texts.es:
Roxana Elizabeth  tiene 24 años es Divorciada, vive con la mamá papá  y el  hijo. Vive en el Recinto  Aguas frías de Mocache, Cantón Mocache.

Ventanilla EL PROGRESO  se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Aguas Frías de Mocache, perteneciente al cantón Mocache, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz cacao hace 10 años.

Roxana Elisabeth  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz, cacao  en terrenos propios. Compra sus productos en Mocache y las vende en el mercado de Mocache.

El crédito solicito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos para los cultivos. El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos para el consumo de la familia y para invertir en la siembra. Su sueño es comprar un Carro.

Disfruta mucho en sus tiempos libres paso con mi hija.
texts.en:
Roxana Elizabeth is twenty-four, divorced, and lives with her mother, father, and child in Recinto  Aguas Frías de Mocache, Cantón Mocache. 

For ten years she has been a member of the El Progresso communal bank, which is located in Recinto Aguas Frías de Mocache, Cantón Mocache and supports cultivation of short-season crops like rice, corn, and cacao. 

Roxana Elizabeth earns her living farming rice, corn and cacao on her own land. She purchases supplies in Mocache and sells her products in the Mocache market. 

She asked for a loan so she could buy seed and fertilizer for her crops. It has helped her increase income for her family and for investment in the crops. Her dream is to buy a car. 

Roxana Elizabeth likes spending her spare time with her child.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers for her crops.

loans.name: Inés

texts.es: La señora Inés vive en un sector de Costa Rica llamado Coronado, el clima ahí es muy frío , ventoso y muchas veces nublado. Doña Inés trabajo mucho tiempo como servidora doméstica, con lo que contribuyo en la crianza y educación de sus hijos. Hace tres años se retiro de esa labor, y con el dinero de prestaciones decidio cumplir su sueño de poner un negocio en su propia casa:un bazar, donde ofrecer a sus vecinos algunos productos , pero sobre todo seguir obteniendo ingresos por la labor que desarrolla , pues a pesar que doña Inés es una mujer de más de 60 años , es una persona muy activa , organizada y esforzada. En este momento sus ingresos han disminuido pues ella tiene que cuidar a su mamá que tiene más de 90 años , y le ayuda supliendo algunas de sus necesidades, por lo que necesita el préstamo para poder comprar nueva mercadería para el proximo año escolar , y hacer algunos arreglos en su local.
texts.en:
Inés lives in the Coronado area of Costa Rica where the climate is very cold, windy and often overcast. She spent a long time working as a housekeeper so she could contribute to her children's education; she's been retired for three years now. She decided to use her loan money to realize her dream of having a business of her own in her house, a store where she offers a variety of products to her neighbors. Above all, though, she continues to earn income in her business because even though she's a sixty-year-old woman, she's very active, organized, and hard-working. 

Inés's income has decreased lately because she has to take care of her mother, who is in her nineties. She helps out with some of her mother's necessities, so she needs the loan to be able to buy new merchandise for the next school year and to make some repairs to her locale.

loans.use: to buy cleaning products, school supplies, and to replace ceiling panels in her shop.

loans.name: Ana Felisa

texts.es: A sus 51 años de edad, la señora Ana Felisa debe velar por la salud y bienestar de su madre y hermana quienes tienen percances de salud y son adultas mayores, además de las obligaciones de su hogar, es por esto, que la señora Ana Felisa se dedica a la elaboración y venta de comidas rápidas y típicas de la región antioqueña desde un pequeño lugar adecuado en el patio de su casa, pero el cual cuando llueve se inunda impidiendo que la señora Ana Felisa trabaje, por tal motivo la señora Ana Felisa requiere de la adecuación de su lugar de trabajo para tener mayor comodidad. El sueño de la señora Ana Felisa es tener su propio restaurante y ver mejor de salud a su madre y hermana.
texts.en: Sra. Ana Felisa, 51, has to care for her mother and sister, both of whom suffer from long-term illnesses.  She is the head of the household, a big responsibility that led her to start her own business making and selling the kind of food that is typical in this part of Colombia.  She prepares the meals on the patio of her house but she can't work when it rains and, consequently, she wants to improve her kitchen space so she can work in any weather.  Her goal is to own her own restaurant and what she would most like in the world is to see her mother and sister get better.

loans.use: to improve the kitchen space for her food business.

loans.name: Edwin Alexander

texts.es:
Edwin tiene 29 años de edad, vive con sus padres y con su compañera de vida.

Él es una persona muy trabajadora que los últimos dos años de ha dedicado a la compra y venta de ganado. Esta actividad la aprendió de un amigo quien negociaba con ganado y Edwin trabajo con él. Antes de dedicarse a esta actividad él realizaba actividades agrícolas con sus padres que le enseñaron a trabajar y ha ganarse la vida.

Edwin compra los animales en la zona donde vive. Luego viaja a la plaza que esta a cuarenta y cinco minutos en vehiculo para comprar y vender el ganado.

Él esta solicitando un préstamo a Fundación Campo, para comprar ocho ganados y engordarlos para luego venderlos a mejor precio. Edwin a identificado que este negocio le esta siendo rentable, por eso decidió solicitar el préstamo he invertir en el.

Con los ingreso él desea ahorrar, para obtener su propia casa y vivir junto con su esposa y los hijos que tenga en un futuro. Además planea adquirir más ganado, mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y tener más oportunidades.
texts.en:
Edwin is 29 and lives with his parents and his life partner.

He is a very hardworking person that in the last few years has been working on purchasing and selling cattle.  He learned this business activity from a friend that negotiated with cattle and Edwin worked with him.  Before working on this he worked in agriculture with his parents who taught him to work and earn a living.

Edwin buys the livestock in the area where he lives.  He then travels to the plaza that is a 45 minute drive to sell the cattle.

He is requesting a loan to Fundacion Campo to buy eight heads of cattle to grow them and sell them later at a good price.  Edwin says this business is profitable that is why he decided to get a loan to invest in it.

With the income he wants to save to buy his own house and move there with his wife and children that they will have in the future.  He also wants to buy more cattle, improve his quality of life and have more opportunities.

loans.use: to buy eight heads of cattle to grow them and sell them later at a good price.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
La señora Gloria tiene 65 años de edad, es casada con cinco hijos.

Ella es una mujer luchadora, se dedica a realizar los oficios domésticos en su casa. Sus padres fueron quienes le enseñaron a trabajar para ganarse la vida. Gracias a ellos aprendió a trabajar en la agricultura junto con su esposo y de ahí obtienen su fuente de ingresos.

Ella debe viajar durante veinticinco minutos en vehiculo, para llegar al lugar donde compra los insumos agrícolas como el maíz, abono, herbicidas, etc. La señora Gloria solicita un préstamo a Fundación Campo, para comprar tres sacos de abono, un saco de formula y una bolsa de semilla, para cultivar 14,000 metros cuadrados de maíz.

Con el préstamo ella suplirá su necesidad de cosechar el maíz, para obtener los ingresos necesarios para salir adelante con su familia. Ella espera sembrar más cantidad de maíz y comprar animales como cerdos y vacas para engordarlos y venderlos después generando otro ingreso para su familia.
texts.en:
Gloria is 65, married with five children.

She is a hardworking woman, she is a housewife.  Her parents taught her to work to earn a living.  Thanks to them she learned to work in agriculture with her husband and they earn their income from it.

She needs to make a 25 minute drive to get to the place where she buys the agri-products such as corn, fertilizer, herbicide, etc.  Gloria requests a loan from Fundacion Campo to buy three sacks of fertilizer and a bag of seed to plant 14,000 square meters of corn.

With the loan she will cover her need to grow corn to obtain the necessary income to get ahead with her family.  She hopes to grow more corn and buy livestock such as pigs, cows to grow them and sell them and generate another source of income for her family.

loans.use: to buy three sacks of fertilizer and a bag of seed to grow 14,000 square meters of corn.

loans.name: Morayma

texts.es: Morayma, de 22 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora, además de alegre y amable, esta separada de su pareja, pero vive en compañía de su madre y su hijo de 2 años de edad, instalados cómodamente en la casa de su madre. El negocio que tiene Morayma es la venta de golosinas la cual realiza en el frontis de su casa, instalando un tablero donde exhibe sus productos. Éste negocio se inició por iniciativa propia y con un préstamo de su hermana hace 01 año atrás. Paralelo a ello, también vende comida en sociedad con su madre, principalmente menú, para eso cuentan con un espacio acondicionado en el frontis de su casa junto con su venta de golosinas, y los domingos venden parrilla de pollo, realizando éste negocio ya hace 5 años. Le gusta lo que hace ya que la mantiene activa, y le permiten tener un ingreso económico para poder solventar los gastos de su hijo que es su mayor motivación. Al contario comenta que le incomoda de su negocio el tener que levantarse de madrugada para empezar con las actividades de su negocio, pero viendo el buen resultado que tienen y las buenas ganancias que les deja, desea continuar con su negocio y ampliar con la venta de bebida gaseosa, para eso ya cuenta con una refrigeradora. Este será el préstamo número 2 con la institución MFP, comenta sentirse agradecida con el apoyo financiero para avanzar con su negocio. Además de sentirse bien con su banco comunal pues considera a sus integrantes ser personas responsables y solidarias. Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la compra de bebidas gaseosas al por mayor, para ofrecer a sus clientes y acompañen aen la comida.
texts.en: Morayma, 22, is an enterprising woman, hard-working, happy and welcoming.  She is separated from her husband and lives with her mother and 2-year old son.  She operates a snacks business in a space just outside her mother's front door.  She started the business a year ago with money she borrowed from her sister.  She and her mother also sell prepared meals.  They have a purpose-built stand in front of the house from which they sell the meals and they set up a grill on Sundays to make and sell grilled chicken.  That business has been up and running for 5 years.  Morayma likes the business because it gives her something to do and brings in the income she needs to support her son.  The hardest thing about the business, she says, is getting up at dawn to organize the day's work.  She's not complaining, though, because she sees that her income has grown along with her efforts and she wants to continue the business and grow it.  She wants to sell soft drinks with the snacks she sells and she needs a refrigerator to start.  This will be her second MFP loan and she tells us that she is grateful for the help she's received to grow her business.  She likes her community bank, too, and says that its members are responsible and supportive.  Morayma will use this 1000 new soles loan to buy wholesale supplies of soft drinks for her food business.

loans.use: to stock her food business.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es: La señora Luz Marina luego de quedar viuda hace dos años decidió iniciar con una actividad con la cual pudiera superar este gran duelo y generar sus propios ingresos para su sostenimiento, es así como decide iniciar desde su casa la venta a crédito de ropa para dama y caballero a familiares, conocidos y amigos. Actualmente pasa por dificultades económicas por lo que requiere de capital con el cual pueda comprar surtido y así mejor sus ventas y poder incrementar su calidad de vida y cumplir con las obligaciones pendientes que tiene. El sueño de la señora Luz Marina es tener su propio almacén de ropa.
texts.en: Luz Marina after being left a widow two years ago decided to start a business that would help her overcome her great sorrow and generate her own income to support herself.  This is why she decided to start selling men's and women's clothing on credit to family, acquaintances, and friends from her home.  She is currently experiencing economic hardship and is in need of capital to be able to buy merchandise.  This will improve her sales and in that way improve her quality of life and help her meet outstanding obligations that she has.  Luz Marina's dream is to have her own clothing store.

loans.use: to buy men's and women's clothing and a showcase to display products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bales of used clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy men's and ladies pants, blouses, men's collared shirts, bath towels, blankets, and baby outfits.

loans.name: Myrian Azucena

texts.es: Miriam Azucena tiene 37 años, su actividad es la venta de ropa. Desde hace mas de 12 años que tiene este medio de vida. Ella es una persona muy responsable por lo que disfruta de tener un trabajo estable que le genere ganancias diariamente. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de pantalones, camisas, faldas, vestidos, trajes entre otros productos. Miriam siempre está pendiente de lo que sus clientes le solicitan y así poder ofrecerles.
texts.en:
Miriam Azucena is 37 years old.  She sells clothes and has done so for more than twelve years. She is a very responsible lady and as such enjoys the benefits of a stable job, which provides her with a daily income.  

She has asked for a loan to buy trousers, shirts, skirts, dresses and suits, amongst other things. 

Miriam is always mindful of what her customers ask for so that she is able to provide these items for them

loans.use: to buy trousers, shirts, skirts, dresses and suits, amongst other items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy vegetables, potatoes, carrots, beetroot, bananas, lemons, oranges, malanga, wheat, onions, tomatoes etc.

loans.name: Peggy

texts.es: Peggy, de 29 años de edad, es una mujer empeñosa y decidida, además de alegre y cordial. Está separada de su pareja, vive en compañía de su madre y sus tres hijos de 9, 5 y 1 año de edad, instalados cómodamente en su propia casa. El negocio que tiene Peggy es la venta de bebida gaseosa, iniciándose con un capital propio  comprando en pequeñas cantidades, y contando con una refrigeradora que había comprado hace 8 años con su sueldo de docente. Ahora le sirve para su negocio, refrigerando las bebidas a temperatura que es del agrado de sus clientes. Tiene más de 01 año realizando éste negocio, le gusta su negocio pues le permite estar en casa y de esa manera poder cuidar y atender  a sus hijos a los que quiere mucho, además de las ganancias que le deja y que le ayuda a solventar sus gastos. Por ahora lo que desea es ampliar su negocio abriendo una bodega de venta de abarrotes y demás productos. Este será el préstamo número 3 con la institución MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos. Además de sentirse tranquila con su banco comunal pues considera a sus miembros ser personas amigables. Con el monto solicitado de 1500 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en la compra de abarrotes en general al por mayor y de esa manera incursionar en ese negocio.
texts.en:
29-year old Peggy is a hardworking determined woman as well as being cheerful and friendly. She is separated from her husband and lives with her mother and her three children aged 9, 5, and 1 in a comfortable house with she owns.

Peggy earns her living selling soft drinks, a business she started using her own money and buying in small quantities at the beginning. She has a refrigerator that she bought eight years ago with her income as a teacher. Now she uses it for her business, keeping the drinks at the cold temperature that her customers like.  She’s had this business for over a year and likes it as she can work from home and look after her much-loved children at the same time. Also she earns enough money to cover the family’s expenses. 

Now Peggy wants to expand the business and open a store selling groceries and other products. This will be her third loan with MFP; she expects to do well from this partnership and continue reaching her goals. She is happy with her community bank and finds the members friendly. With the S/.1500 she is seeking, Peggy will buy groceries at wholesale prices to stock her new store.

loans.use: buy groceries at wholesale prices to stock her new store

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es:
Ana es una mujer de 32 años y vive con su familia en la provincia de "Cotopaxi" en Latacunga, que es la capital de la provincia de Cotopaxi, ubicada a una hora y media de la ciudad de Quito. Es una acogedora ciudad, que con su catedral y la Iglesia de San Francisco muestra la belleza del arte religioso, ambientadas con estrechas calles adoquinadas, resaltadas por los vivos colores de las típicas fachadas de sus viviendas y el polvoriento paisaje circundante. Latacunga viene de dos voces quichuas llacata kunka que significa Dios de las Lagunas. Cuando llega noviembre sus empedradas calles se llenan de alegría por la celebración de la fiesta en honor a la Virgen de las Mercedes, se trata de la ceremonia de la “Mama Negra”, que simboliza la fertilidad y la productividad de la tierra.

Ana tiene un negocio de fabricación y venta de tejas de barro, las mismas que son usadas para cubrir los techos de las casas; además también realiza artesanías del mismo material. Traja diariamente un promedio de diez horas. Este negocio es muy duro y de alto riesgo ya que quien trabaja en ello está expuesto a la contaminación con plomo. Aprendió este oficio desde hace varios años por enseñanza de un familiar. Se considera una mujer trabajadora con ganas de crecer y por ello ha encontrado en el crédito una herramienta para poder cumplir sus metas y realizar sus sueños que son el ampliar su negocio y con ello percibir mayores ingresos y tener un mejor estilo de vida.
texts.en:
Ana is a 32-year-old woman who lives with her family in the province of Cotopaxi in Latacunga, the capital of the province, located an hour and a half from the city of Quito.  It is a friendly city that shows the beauty of religious art with its cathedral and the Iglesia de San Francisco, livened up with narrow cobbled streets highlighted by the vivid colors of the facades of the homes and the dusty surrounding landscape.

Latacunga comes from two Quechua words, "llacata" and "kunka," 'Dios de las Lagunas' [God of the Lagoons].  When November arrives, the paved streets fill with happiness for the celebration of the Virgen de las Mercedes, or the ceremony of the Mama Negra, who symbolizes fertility and the productivity of the land.

Ana has a business making and selling clay tiles, the same ones that are used to cover the roofs of houses.  She also makes crafts of the same material.  She works an average of 10 hours a day.  This is a very hard and high-risk business because anyone who works in it is exposed to lead poisoning.  She learned this job several years ago through the instruction of a relative.

She considers herself a hard-working woman who wants to grow, so she has found the loan to buy a tool to be able to achieve her goals and realize her dream.  She wants to expand her business and have a bigger income and a better lifestyle.

loans.use: para expandir su negocio

loans.name: Nidia Lucia

texts.es: Nidia Lucia se dedica  a la venta de mercadería en general, desde hace 4 años que tiene este medio de vida. Ella vende sus productos de manera ambulante siempre ha realizado un buen trabajo y se siente agradecida con el apoyo que le brinda. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de calzado, cosméticos, tratamiento, reloj, ropa en general y sabanas. Ha sido con el paso del tiempo que Nidia ha logrado salir adelante con todo el empeño necesario a su negocio. Ella agradece la oportunidad que le han brindado con el financiamiento.
texts.en: Nidia Lucia has been selling general merchandise for four years.  She sells her products in an itinerant manner always doing a good job and she feels grateful for the support it provides.  The reason for the loan is to buy shoes, cosmetics, treatments, clothes in general and sheets.  With the passage of time Nidia has managed to get ahead with all the effort needed by her business.  She is grateful for the opportunity the loan has provided her.

loans.use: to buy shoes, cosmetics, treatments, watches, clothing in general and sheets.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cosmetics, fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
Hilda es socia del Banco Comunal Orcasitas, tiene 39 años, es madre de 6 hijos, es casada, y es socia de Finca Peru desde hace 13 años.
Hilda es dueña de una Fábrica de ladrillos, recuerda que ella empezó con $ 10.00 dólares y desde la fecha se esforzó mucho para poder tener un buen capital y ahorrar. las capacitaciones le ayudaron mucho para poder progresar y en su vida personal, le enseñaron a hacer un buen presupuesto, ahora con el préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de ladrillos para quemar.
texts.en:
Hilda’s a member of the “Orcasitas” communal bank.  She’s 39 years old and the mother of six children.  She’s married and has been a member of Finca Perú for 13 years.

Hilda owns a brick factory.  She recalls that she started out with 10 dollars and since then has striven very much to have good capital and to save.  Training helped her very much to make progress and in her personal life.  It taught her how to make a good budget and will use the loan now to buy bricks to fire.

loans.use: to buy bricks to fire.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha es socia del Banco Comunal Tulipanes, es socia de Finca Perú desde hace 4 años.
Martha tiene una tienda de venta de auto partes de carros, la estancia en Finca le ayudo a poder incrementar su mercadería, ahora ya tiene mas capital, y esta muy bien con todo lo que pudo aprender, ella cambio en su forma de ser, agradece a Finca todas las capacitaciones que pudo recibir, ahora con el préstamo que sacara lo invertirá en la compra de repuestos.
texts.en: Martha is a member of the “Tulipanes” (Tulips) communal bank and has been a member of Finca Perú for four years.  Martha has an automobile spare parts store.  Her stay in Finca helped her increase her stock merchandise and now she has more capital.  She is very good with everything she managed to learn; she changes her way of being.  She thanks Finca for all the training she was able to get.  She will use the loan she’s taking out now to buy spare parts.

loans.use: to buy different types of spare parts.

loans.name: José Augusto

texts.es:
José es un padre soltero de 49 años que vive en Latacunga que es la capital de la Provincia de Cotopaxi. Es un importante centro comercial y turístico de la región centro-norte del Ecuador.  El paisaje urbano de la ciudad cautiva con sus calles estrechas, casas bajas, muchas de ellas con patios interiores que le confieren un sabor en que se une lo español con lo aborigen, lo antiguo con lo moderno. 

José vende legumbres y hortalizas en los mercados de Latacunga. Aprendió este oficio hace muchos años por un amigo. Su jornada diaria es dura ya que sale a vender su mercancía desde las 4 de la madrugada hasta las 4 de la tarde. La separación de su esposa ha sido muy difícil de superar ya que José debe mantener a sus hijos; ha pensado en invertir en la compra de un lote de legumbres y hortalizas, de esta manera su proveedor podrá darle un mejor precio y así el podrá tener mayores ingresos.

El ha tenido varios obstáculos; ha sufrido varios asaltos y en una ocasión le robaron toda su mercancía pero este tipo de cosas no desaniman a José y como todo buen padre, trabaja muy duro para ver a sus hijos tener una buena educación y calidad de vida.
texts.en:
José, 49, is a single father living in Latacunga which is the capital of Cotopaxi Province.  It is an important commercial and tourism center in Ecuador’s north-central region.  The city’s urban scape charms with its narrow streets and low houses many of which have interior patios that combine the Spanish with the Native, the ancient with the modern.

José sells vegetables and legumes in Latacunga’s markets.  He learned this occupation many years ago from a friend.  His work day is very demanding because he goes out to sell his merchandise from 4am until 4pm.  The separation from his wife has been very hard to overcome because José must support his children.  He’s thought of purchasing an entire lot of vegetables and legumes because that way his supplier can give him a better price and he’ll earn better income.

He has faced several obstacles. He’s been assaulted several times and on one occasion all of his merchandise was stolen.  But these types of things don’t discourage José and like all good fathers he works hard to see his children have a good education and quality of life.

loans.use: to buy an entire lot of fruit and vegetables to take advantage of the price.

loans.name: Monica

texts.es: Mónica, de 22 años de edad es una mujer dinámica y emprendedora, además de sociable y amable, es conviviente con Luis quien es empleado en una empresa privada, pero vive en compañía de su pareja, su hijo de 5 meses de edad, sus dos cuñadas, y su suegra, instalados cómodamente en casa de su suegra. El negocio que tiene Mónica es la venta de comida, para eso instala todos los días una mesa en el frontis de su casa donde atiende muy amablemente a sus clientes con la ayuda de su suegra. Este negocio lo emprendió hace 01 año y paralelo a ello también se ha dedicado a dar en alquiler su mototaxi, por 25 nuevos soles diarios. Dicho vehículo lo tiene desde hace 3 años y lo compró en conjunto con su pareja. Le gusta ambos negocios, pues le permiten tener varios ingresos y de esa manera apoyar a su pareja en los gastos del hogar, deseando de esa manera progresar y brindarles a su hijo una mejor calidad de vida, así como también la mantienen ocupada y la distrae. Contario a eso, lo que no le gusta es que su negocio es que aún es pequeño y desea poder hacerlo crecer e incrementar sus ingresos, para eso tiene planes de abrir un tienda de venta de zapatos en una zona céntrica de la ciudad de Pucallpa. Este será el primer préstamo con la institución MFP, se siente agradecida por la oportunidad de contar con una línea de crédito, y por lo mismo se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de sus cuotas y así tener un buen record crediticio. Con el monto solicitado de 800 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la compra de ingredientes al por mayor para la preparación de comida como arroz, aceites, fideos y demás.
texts.en:
Mónica, 22, is a dynamic, enterprising woman.  Besides, she’s sociable and kind.  Her spouse is Luis who works for a private firm and she lives with him, with their 5-month-old son, her two sisters-in-law and her mother-in-law comfortably installed in her mother-in-law’s house.

Mónica’s business is selling food.  To do so she sets up a table in front of her house every day where she kindly takes care of her customers with help from her mother-in-law.  She started this business a year ago and also has a parallel business leasing out a mototaxi for 25 new soles a day.  She’s had this vehicle for three years and she bought it with her spouse.  She likes both businesses because they allow her to have several incomes and be able to help her spouse with household expenses.  She hopes this way to make progress and provide her son with a better quality of life as well as to keep herself busy and occupied.  On the contrary, though, what she dislikes about the business is that it’s still small and she’d like to make it grow and to increase her income.  To do so, she plans to open a shoe store in a centrally located spot in the city of Pucallpa.

This will be her first MFP loan.  She is grateful for the opportunity to have a line of credit and commits to make her installment payments to establish a good credit history.  She will use the requested 800 new soles to buy ingredients at wholesale like rice, oil, noodles and others, at wholesale.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil and noodles at wholesale.

loans.name: Enma Rita

texts.es: Emma es socia del Banco Comunal Tulipanes, se dedica a la compra y venta de cereales, es socia de Finca Perú desde hace 6 años, da gracias por el apoyo que le dieron con respecto a los préstamo que solo de esa manera pudo salir adelante, y tener buen capital, las capacitaciones le ayudaron a ser mejor mamá, y negociante, si no fuera por Finca ella no tendría este negocio, todo lo que pudo lograr es gracias a su esfuerzo y a Finca con sus préstamos. Ahora con el préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de cereales.
texts.en: Emma is a member of the “Tulipanes” (Tulips) communal bank.  She’s a cereals merchant and has been a member of Finca Perú for six years.  Thanks to the support she got from them with the loans she’s been able to get ahead and have good capital.  The training helped her to be a better mother and a better businesswoman.  If it weren’t for Finca she wouldn’t have this business.  Everything she’s managed to attain has been thanks to her effort and to Finca loans.  She will use the loan to buy cereals.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Marina

texts.es: Marina es socia del Banco Comunal Los Sauces, tiene 35 años, es dueña de una cabina de Internet y venta de juguetes, es madre de un hijo, es socia de Finca Perú desde hace 4 años, ella estudio Informática y siempre tuvo el deseo de tener su propia empresa, hace 4 años ella empezó con este gran sueño, a pesar de todas las adversidades que pudo tener elle salió adelante, y Finca ayudó mucho para poder tener todo lo que logró, las capacitaciones le ayudaron a poder tener mas claras sus ideas, se pudo comprar una fotocopiadora, ahora con el préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de útiles escolares.
texts.en: Marina is a member of the “Los Sauces” (Willows) communal bank.  She’s 35 years old and owns an Internet access service; she also sells toys.  She is the mother of a son.  She’s been a member of Finca Perú for four years.  She studied computer sciences and always wanted to have a business of her own.  Four years ago she began this great dream and despite all the adversities she had she was able to get ahead and Finca helped her quite a bit to attain what she has.  The training helped her to focus her ideas; she bought a photocopier and will use the present loan to buy school supplies.

loans.use: to buy school supplies.

loans.name: Pedro Jose

texts.es: Don Pedro, habita en la ciudad de León tiene 38 años de edad, es casado tiene tres hijos todos están están estudiando el es carpintero lleva 8 años dedicándose a este negocio. Este a sido su primer negocio, lo inicio con capital propio antes trabajo en una empresa de fabricación de muebles de ahí adquirió experiencia e inicio la idea de poner su propio negocio de carpintería. El requiere el préstamo para compra de materia prima como pegamento, madera renovable, clavos, limas para elaborar muebles. Pues tiene varios pedidos y con la compra de este inventario de materia prima podrá culminar con sus pedidos y mejorar sus ingresos. En lo futuro le gustaría comprar maquinas y equipos que le ayuden a fabricar en menos tiempo muebles de fina calidad para dar a conocer sus trabajos humildes pero de muy buena calidad pues su objetivo principal son darle estudios universitarios a sus hijos para que ellos sean profesionales.
texts.en: Pedro lives in the city of Leon, he is 38, married and has three children that are in school, he is a carpenter, has done this for eight years.  This is his first business, he started it with his own capital, before this he worked for a company making furniture where he gained experience and thought of opening his own carpentry shop.  He needs the loan to purchase raw materials such as glue, plywood, nails and sandpaper to make furniture, because he has several orders and by purchasing these raw materials he can complete the orders and have more income.  In the future he would like to buy machines and equipment that will save him time when making good quality furniture and this way get people talking about his simple but good quality furniture, his main goal is to put his children through university so they can become professionals.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials such as glue, plywood, nails and sandpaper to make furniture

loans.name: Sorayda Elizabeth

texts.es:
Sorayda es una joven mujer de 29 años; es madre soltera de un niño de 11 años a quien ha criado sola. Juntos viven en Latacunga que es una ciudad situada en el centro de Ecuador, constituye un punto de enlace entre la Costa, los Andes y la Amazonia. Posee un clima templado, a veces ventoso y frío. Desde allí se puede llegar a toda la provincia que ofrece a sus visitantes la belleza de sus lagunas, aire puro y una hermosa vegetación. 

Sorayda a pesar de ser maestra graduada en "belleza" no ejerce su profesión y en cambio tiene un puesto de venta de cañas y jugo de caña; la caña es un tallo de donde se fabrica el azúcar. En Ecuador es consumido en su estado natural y su jugo es muy apetecido por su sabor. Aprendió este oficio de su madre y trabaja 8 horas al día cerca de un terminal terrestre de buses. Ella desea invertir comprando un lote de caña y de esta manera obtener un mejor precio y por ende mejores ganancias.

Ella se preocupa por el futuro de su hijo y cada día lucha y trabaja muy duro. Para que nunca le falte nada...
texts.en:
Sorayda is a 29-year-old woman; she’s a single mother of an 11-year-old son who she has raised alone.  They live together in Latacunga which is a city located in central Ecuador and is a meeting point between the coast, the Andes and Amazonia.  It has a temperate climate which is sometimes windy and cold.  From there one can reach the entire province which offers visitors the beauty of its lagoons, pure air and beautiful vegetation.

Even though Sorayda is a graduate in “beauty” she does not practice her profession but rather has a stand where she sells sugar cane and sugar cane juice; sugar cane is a stalk that sugar is made from and in Ecuador it’s consumed in its natural state and its juice is very much enjoyed for its flavor.  She learned this occupation from her mother and works 8 hours a day near a bus terminal.  

She wants to invest buying an entire lot of sugar cane to get a better price and as a result better profits.  She’s concerned for her son’s future so she works hard every day so that he’ll never lack anything.

loans.use: to buy sugar cane.

loans.name: Eliana

texts.es: Eliana, de 53 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora, así como también es amable y social, está separada de su pareja hace 6 años, pero vive en compañía de su hija de 19 años y un niño que es hijo de su amiga a quien le apoya en su educación. Todos instalados cómodamente en su casa propia. El negocio que tiene Eliana es el alquiler de su vehiculo trimóvil, conocido como mototaxi el cual compró con un préstamo particular y lo alquila a un vecino al que considera responsable, generándole un ingreso diario de 20 nuevos soles. Paralelo a ello también se dedica en la venta de ropa de diversos modelos y para todo los géneros, los cuales le envía de la ciudad de Lima una hermana suya, para luego venderlo de manera ambulante a sus amigos y familiares. Lleva más de 9 años realizando ambos negocios. Le gusta su negocio, ya que le permiten tener una tranquilad y estabilidad económica, así como también la entretiene y le permite ganarse más amistades. Por lo contrario lo que no le gusta es cuando llueve muy seguido hace que se malogre más rápidamente su mototaxi y también dificulta su venta de ropa, pero viendo el buen resultado que tiene en su negocios desea continuar y mantenerlos. Este será el préstamo número 10 con la institución MFP. Está muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su negocio. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más de cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores crédito que tuvo. Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la compra de ropas al por mayor en la ciudad de Lima de todos los modelos y muy variada para todos los generaos pensando en  ésta campaña navideña
texts.en:
Eliana is 53 years old and is a hard-working and entrepreneurial woman. She is also very kind and social. She has been separated from her husband for 6 years, but lives with her 19 year old daughter and friend's son, as she is helping with his education. They all are very comfortable in their own home. Eliana's business is to rent her moto-taxi that she bought with a personal loan. She rents it to a responsible neighbor and earns 20 nuevos soles every day. In addition, she works selling a variety of clothing for men and women. The clothing is sent to her from her sister in Lima, and she then sells it door to door to her friends and family. She has had both of these jobs for more than 9 years.

She likes her work, since it allows her financial stability and calm, and it also entertains her and lets her make more friends. However, she dislikes it when it rains a lot because it is hard on the moto-taxi and also makes selling clothing more difficult. But, seeing the good results of her jobs, she desires to continue with them. This will be her tenth loan with MFP. She is happy to have financial assistance, as it allows her to feel secure in advancing her business. She promises to once more repay the loan on time, as she has with her previous loans. She will use the requested 1,000 soles to invest in the purchase of a variety of all types clothing in bulk from the city of Lima with the plan of selling it this Christmas season.

loans.use: buy a variety of clothing

loans.name: Betty

texts.es: Betty, de 36 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, además de servicial y amable, es conviviente con Kiker quien es mototaxista. Vive en compañía de su pareja y sus hijos de 12 y 5 años de edad, instalados cómodamente en su propia casa. El negocio que tiene Betty es la venta de bebidas gaseosas e hielo en pequeñas barras, para eso cuenta con una refrigeradora la cual compraron con ayuda de su pareja. Y ante la necesidad económica decidio emprender éste negocio. Ahora tiene mucha demanda por el clima caluroso de la zona, continuó a lo largo de estos 6 años que viene funcionando su negocio donde ella sola atiende a sus clientes. Le gusta su negocio pues le permite tener un ingreso económico para apoyar a su pareja con los gastos del hogar, así como también le permite estar en casa para cuidar y atender a sus hijos a los quiere mucho y desea sacar adelante. Por eso tiene planes de ampliar su negocio y abrir un local de venta de comida en su casa ya que ha visto que es una buena zona para esta venta. Este será el préstamo número 3 con la institución MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos. Además comenta sentirse bien con su banco comunal pues los considera un grupo unido. Con el monto solicitado de 2000 nuevos soles lo invertirá en su negocio, comprando más gaseosas al por mayor para así tener mayor margen de ganancias.
texts.en: Betty is 36 years old and is a hard-working woman who is very helpful and kind.  She lives with her partner, Kiker, who drives a moto-taxi.  They live in their own home with their children who are 12 and 5 years old.  Betty works selling soft drinks and ice in small bars.  She has a refrigerator for this business that she and her husband bought.  A need for more money led them to start this business.  There is now a lot of demand because the climate is very hot.  She has worked alone attending to the customers for six years.  She likes the work because it gives her an income to help her husband with the expenses of the home, and it also lets her be home to care for her children, whom she loves a lot and wishes to help succeed.  For this reason she has plans to expand her business and open a business selling food from her home, because she has seen that she lives in a good area for this type of sales.  This will be her third loan with MFP, and she is hopeful that with their help, she can continue meeting her goals.  She comments that she enjoys her community bank because she considers it to be a united group.  She will invest the requested 2,000 nuevos soles in her business, buying more soft drinks in bulk in order to have a greater profit margin.

loans.use: buy cases of soft drinks in bulk

loans.name: Elizabeth Del Carmen

texts.es:
Elizabeth, de 32 años de edad, de oficio comerciante atiende una pulpería la cual tiene ubicada en su casa de habitación, es casada, madre de un hijo de 10 años de edad. Inicio con esta actividad hace dos años su esposo la ha apoyado desde un inicio pues este tipo de negocio es rentable si se sabe administrar. Ella divide su tiempo entre su pulpería y sus  labores como madre y ama de casa. 
Ella realizo el crédito para comprar coca cola, granos básicos, pollo para surtir de inventario de mucha demanda en su pulpería. Además esta emprendiendo un negocio de venta de hamburguesas. Hot dog, sándwich pues sus expectativas es poner un puesto pequeño bien acondicionado que resulte atractivo para los clientes que genere buenos ingresos. Pues es una mujer que le gusta el trabajo y desarrollarse como mujer de negocios.
texts.en: Elizabeth is 32, she is a merchant and works at the convenience store located in her house, she is married and has a 10 year old son.  She began with this activity two years ago, her husband has supported her since the beginning because it's a profitable business if it's managed properly.  She manages her time between her convenience store, and her work as a mother and housewife.  The loan is for buying coca cola, basic grains and chicken to stock her store.  In addition she is starting a business to sell burgers, hot dogs and sandwiches, her plan is to start with a well equipped but small cart that attracts clients and generates good income.  She is a woman that likes to work and to develop as an entrepreneur.

loans.use: to buy coca cola, basic grains and chicken to stock her convenience store

loans.name: Maria Edith

texts.es:
Doña María Edith tiene 57 años de edad, casada desde hace 30 años, es madre de 9 hijos, actualmente vive solo con los dos menores de 16 y 18 años de edad, los otros siete ya se independizaron no viven con ella y son mayores de entre 20 a 30 años, vive en  la colonia Gracias a Dios de San Pedro Sula, su esposo se dedica a la construcción.

Es una señora muy trabajadora, anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de verduras y hace 5 años estableció el negocio de venta de ropa interior para mujer, para hombres, zapatos  y trajes de niña, en el mercado centarl de la ciudad. Atiende este negocio desde muy temprano dedicándole 10 horas diarias. Comenzó esta actividad con un pequeño ahorro que tenia y con disciplina lo hizo crecer. También con la ayuda de ODEF quien le a otorgado tres prestamos para surtir mas de mercadería, con ello han mejorado sus ingresos. 
Este prestamo actual es de L.20,000.00 y es para la compra de ropa interior para  damas, caballeros y trajes de niña. Su meta siempre es seguir obteniendo más ingresos para arreglar el local del negocio.
texts.en:
María Edith, 57, has been married for 30 years.  She’s the mother of nine children but currently only lives with the two youngest who are 16 and 18 years of age; the other seven are already independent and no longer live with her, their ages range between 20 and 30 years.  She lives in San Pedro Sula’s Gracias a Dios neighborhood; her husband works in construction.

She is a very hardworking woman.  She used to be a vegetable merchant but five years ago she established her business selling women’s and men’s underwear, shoes and outfits for little girls in the city’s central market.  She starts working very early and spends 10 hours daily at work.  She started the business with a small amount of savings she had and with discipline she made it grow; also with help form ODEF which has granted her three other loans to stock up on merchandise and which helped her improve income.

This current loan is for L.20,000.00 which is to buy women’s and men’s underwear and outfits for little girls.  Her goal is to always earn more income in order to improve her business’ locale.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her business.

location.town: Colonia Gracias a Dios, San Pedro Sula

loans.name: Juan Manuel

texts.es:
Originario de Leo, es Juan un humilde comerciante de 38 años de edad que se dedica a la venta de mariscos, su nivel de estudios es bien básico llego hasta sexto grado de primaria, el tiene 2 hijos de 16 y 7 años de edad ambos están en la escuela.
El inicio con su negocio con capital propio con la liquidación que le dieron de su anterior trabajo también vendía raspados pero noto que a venta de mariscos le generaba buenos ingresos por eso hoy en día solo se dedica a la venta de mariscos. Sus punto de ventas es en los mercados donde Se desplaza a lo largo del día para vender sus fresco pescados. El requiere el préstamo para compra de mariscos. Además en su casa tiene un pequeño negocio de crianza y venta de pollo el cual también quiere sacar adelante pues el dice que necesita darle un mejor nivel de vida a sus hijos y su esposa.
texts.en:
Born in Leo, Juan is a humble businessman, 38 years old, who dedicates himself to selling seafood. His level of education is quite basic: he reached the sixth grade of primary school. He has two children, aged 16 and 7, and both of them are in school. 

He started his business with his own capital, with the severance payment he received from his previous job. He also sold raspados [shaved ice with syrup], but he noticed that selling seafood generated a good income, and therefore he now dedicates himself only to selling seafood. He makes his sales at the markets, to which he travels throughout the day to sell his fresh fish. He needs the loan to buy seafood. In his home, he also has a small business raising and selling chickens, which he would also like to expand, since he says that he needs to provide a better standard of living for his children and his wife.

loans.use: to buy seafood to sell.

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester, 31, is married and has two children. She lives in the Philippines.

Ester is operating a business providing transportation services to local community members to earn a living. She has been doing this for seven years and she earns 2,500 a month from this work. She has requested a loan of PHP 25,000 to repair her existing vehicle so she can provide better service.

In 2010, Ester joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Ester hopes to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to repair her existing vehicle for better service.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 32 years old, married, and has four children. She is from Calabayan, Ozamiz City.
 
Mary Jane plants, harvests, and sells bananas to earn a living. She has been in this business for six years and earns 4,000 PHP a month. 

In 2007, Mary Jane joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. 

Mary Jane is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve her business and to support her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 36 years old, married and has 4 children. She is from Calabayan, Ozamis City. 

Susan plants, harvests and sells bananas to earn a living. Susan has been in this business for 10 years and earns 4,000 PHP a month. 

In 2011, Susan joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Susan is requesting a loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve her business and to support her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Claudia Raquel

texts.es: La señora Claudia de 37 años es casada tiene tres hijos y vive en una casa de interés social desde hace cinco años, ella cuenta con un pequeño negocio en el cual vende abarrotes en general, golosinas, frituras, galletas, refrescos, productos lácteos y mas; su negocio le permite contribuir al gasto familiar del hogar y al mismo tiempo atender las labores del hogar como lo es; lavar, planchar, cocinar, limpiar la casa y lo mas importante el cuidado de sus niños. Claudia tiene una necesidad en su hogar la casa en la que ella vive no cuenta con vitro piso y ella solicita el apoyo para colocar el vitro piso en su vivienda.
texts.en: Claudia is 37 years old, married, and has three children.  She has lived in government-assisted housing for five years.  She has a small business selling groceries, sweets, chips, cookies, soda, dairy products, and more.  Her business lets her contribute to the expenses of the home and also allows her to maintain the home (washing, ironing, cooking, cleaning the home, and most importantly, caring for her children).  Claudia's home needs improvement, as the floor is not finished.  She is asking for help to install a tiled floor in her home.

loans.use: buy supplies to fix up her floor

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es: La señora Maria Cristina es una mujer muy trabajadora que le gusta ofrecer a su hijo una mejor calidad de vida. Hace años compro su terreno y poco a poco construyo su casa para comenzar habitarla ya que para ella es una buena inversión a futuro y un patrimonio para su hijo. En este momento solicita un préstamo para enjarrarla dentro-fuera y pintarla para que se vea bien este fin de año ya que es cuando recibe más visitas y quiere ofrecerles un lugar acogedor donde se puedan hospedar. Para realizar su proyecto necesita comprar cemento, arena, pintura y pagar mano de obra.
texts.en:
María Cristina is a very hardworking woman who likes to offer her child a better quality of life.  Years ago she bought her land and little by little built her house to begin living in it because it is a good investment in the future and a legacy for her son.

Now she is requesting a loan to plaster the house inside and out, and paint it so it looks good at the end of this year, because this is when she gets more visits and she wants to offer them a welcoming place to stay.

To realize her project she needs to buy cement, sand, and paint, and pay for labor.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita, 57 is widow with four children residing at Pan-ay Diot, Clarin, Misamis Occidental: Philippines. She  operates a family member's business venture, planting & harvesting banana for sale to earn a living. She has been in this business for 6 years. Each month, she earns 3,000 PHP. 

Conchita has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. In 2011, Conchita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Conchita wants to make improvements on her house and to help her her children finish their education.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Rodrigo

texts.es: El señor Rodrigo es un hombre muy trabajador que está dispuesto ofrecer a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. Hace 13 años compro su casa con el fin de tener un techo digno para vivir. El poco a poco le fue haciendo variedad de mejoras ya que la casa era pequeña y no tenía el espacio necesario para vivir cómodamente  que logro gracias a los ahorros de toda su vida, en este momento ya no cuenta con el capital necesario para terminar los acabados de los barandales que tienen en su barda ya que solo pudo completar instalarlos pero le falta poner algunos detalles y pintar para que se vean bien al igual que pintar la fachada de su casa para que en esta Navidad tenga la satisfacción que ha realizado todo lo que algún día soñó ofrecer a su familia.
texts.en: Rodrigo is a very hard-working man who is ready to offer his family a better quality of life.  Thirteen years ago he bought his home in order to have a dignified place to live.  Little by little, he has been making improvements to his home, since it was small and did not have enough space to live comfortably.  He was able to fix it up using his life's savings.  Right now he does not have the needed capital to finish the railing on the wall outside his house.  He was able to install it, but it still needs some work and needs to be painted to match the house.  He wants to finish this work in time for Christmas, to have the satisfaction of having completed something he dreamed of offering his family.

loans.use: finish a railing and paint his house

loans.name: Ana Luisa

texts.es: Ana es casada tiene 3 hijos y desde hace siete años vive en una casa de interés social; ella trabaja en una maquiladora de la localidad de lunes a viernes diez horas diarias con descansos de 15, 30, 10  esto para que tome sus alimentos  de esto hace 1 año ya que ella se vio en la necesidad de buscar un empleo para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar; su esposo se dedica a realizar trabajos de plomería, electricidad y albañilería en general y hace un año el no contaba con un ingreso fijo y ese fue el motivo por el cual Ana tuvo que trabajar ellos cuentan con una necesidad en su vivienda ya que la losa que tiene su casa está dañada y requiere de reparación se le trasmina el agua y  siempre hay desechos de la losa tirados en su casa, ella requiere el apoyo para reparar la losa y así poder brindar a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Ana is married and has three children.  She has been living in government-assisted housing for seven years.  She works at a local factory from Monday to Friday for 10 hours a day and with 15, 30, and 10 minute breaks, which allow her to eat her meals.  She started working there a year ago when she saw she needed to look for a job to help her husband with the expenses of the home.  Her husband does plumbing, electrical, and mason work, and for a year he has not had a steady source of income.  This is why Ana had to work.  Their home's ceiling is damaged and needs to be repaired, because it leaks water, and there is always broken plaster that has fallen down.  She needs the support of a loan to repair the ceiling and provide her children with a better quality of life.

loans.use: buy construction supplies to fix her ceiling

loans.name: Miralyn

texts.en: Miralyn, age 40, is married and has two children. She resides in Ozamis, Misamis Occidental: Philippines. Miralyn owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products to earn a living. She's been 5 years in this business. Each month, she earns 6,000 PHP doing this type of business. She has requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. Miralyn has been a member of GDMPC for three years. In the future, Miralyn wants to improve her house and educate her children well.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Kimyas

texts.en: Kimyas, 30, is married and resides in Kampong Chnang Province. Kimyas sells clothes, and her husband is a blacksmith. Kimyas is requesting a loan of US $1000 to purchase more clothes to resell. In the future, Kimyas would like to use additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to resell

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 44 years old and lives in Kolambugan, Lanao Del Norte. She is married with 7 children. 
Alma has a boarding house business and earns approximately PHP 3,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 50,000 to purchase a material to be used for house repair. 
Alma has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, Alma hopes to improve her living situation and to be able to support her family especially in their daily basic needs.

loans.use: To purchase materials to be used for house repair

loans.name: Maria Liza

texts.en:
Maria Liza is 41 years old and lives in Antonino, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married and has four children.

Maria Liza works in the fish industry and sells/catches fish for living. She has been doing this for twenty-four years. She has requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to purchase three boxes of fish to sell.

Maria Liza has been a member of PMPC for more than one year. In the future, Maria Liza hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase three boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Jenny-Vi

texts.en:
Jenny-vi is 38 years old and has three children. Unluckily, she and her spouse separated due to personal reasons. Jenny-vi needs to be strong and acquire an income so that she can provide sustenance for her family, especially a good education for her children. She established a business selling clothes, accessories, gift items and bags for almost two years. She operates her business everyday from 8 am to 7 pm.

Jenny-vi would like to further expand her business so that she can continuously provide a good education for her children. In this matter, she would like to ask for a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy more items to sell such as t-shirts, bags, accessories, and other gift items.

In the future, Jenny-vi hopes to have good financial management so that someday she can upgrade her family's living condition.

loans.use: to buy t-shirts, bags, accessories, and other gift items to sell.

loans.name: Sareoun

texts.en:
Sareoun, 27, is married and resides in Kampong Chnang Province. She and her husband are employed at a factory. 

Sareoun is requesting a loan of US $500 to purchase a motorbike to commute to work. 

In the future, Sareoun would like to use additional income to run a tailor shop at home. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike to commute to work.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to prepare his sport court.

loans.name: Maylinda

texts.en:
Maylinda, 32, is a married woman with three children aged 9, 7 and 5. Her husband works as a carpenter.

Maylinda has had a sari-sari (variety) store business for three years. She sells items like canned goods, coffee, shampoo and soap. She also sells banana cue (deep-fried bananas covered with caramelized brown sugar) to her community. She earns 5,000 PHP per month with her business.

Maylinda has requested this loan to buy sugar and bananas and more items to sell, such as canned goods. Maylinda hopes her business will grow.

loans.use: to buy sugar and bananas and more items to sell, such as canned goods.

loans.name: Seoub

texts.en:
Seoub, 39, is married and resides in Kampong Chnang Province. She is employed at a garment factory and her husband is in the army. 

Seoub is requesting a loan of US $1,000 to purchase rice from local farmers to resell when it is profitable. In the future, Seoub would like to use additional income to purchase more rice stock. 

This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy rice to resell.

loans.name: Chanthorn

texts.en:
Chanthorn, 31, is married and resides in Kampong Chnang Province. She produces traditional baskets to sell and her husband is a construction worker.
