Chanthorn is requesting a loan of US $1,000 to purchase more materials to produce the baskets. In the future, she would like to use additional income to purchase baskets from the local producers to resell.
 
This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy more materials to produce the baskets for sale.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 56 years old and is married with three grown-up children. Together with her husband, she works in rice farming as her source of income. Her children only finished high school due to financial problems, and now they have their own families. 

Currently, Lolita has insufficient funds to make improvements to her crop production. She is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy rice seeds and pay for labor costs. Hiring laborers is an additional expense for her, but she badly needs their help for land preparation.

Someday, Lolita hopes to save funds to use in times of emergency because she and her husband are getting weak and old.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds and to pay for labor costs

loans.name: Angel

texts.en:
Angel is a hard-working farmer who lives at Furagui, Solana. He is married and has four children, all of whom attend school. 

He has been raising crops for almost 20 years, primarily planting and harvesting rice to sell.  According to him, the income generated from the business is just enough to sustain daily allowances for his children and meals for the family. 

He is asking for a loan so that he can improve his farming business. He needs PHP 10,000 to buy fertilizers and seeds to grow.

Hopefully, he will increase his earnings and further improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds.

loans.name: Nadija

texts.en:
Nadija is from Catadman, Ozamis City. She is 62 years old. Nadija is married having two children. To make a living, Nadija owns & operates a business venture, providing boarding house rental services to local community members. Nadija has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Nadija joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nadija is requesting a loan of 12,516.67 PHP which will be used to purchase additional raw materials for boarding house renovation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: to purchase additional raw materials for boarding house renovation

loans.name: Them

texts.en: Them is 38 years old with 2 children who are school age. She has a small grocery shop in the local market. This business started in 2008 and  she earns a stable income from this shop. Them joined the SEDA credit program in 2008 and she has used loans effectively in expanding  her shop. Currently, she wants to take out a loan of 8,736,000 VND  to buy more new products to meet the demand of customers on the Tet holiday.

loans.use: to buy more new products to meet the demand of customers on Tet holiday.

loans.name: Mayshell

texts.en:
Mayshell is a farmer working in Trinidad, Bohol. She is 21 years old and married. Mayshell primarily grows rice crops to sell. She does her best to keep her farm productive.

Mayshell has requested this loan to purchase fertilizers and tractor spare parts and to pay for labor. Mayshell hopes for her income to improve so she could save more.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and tractor spare parts and pay for labor

loans.name: Michel

texts.en:
Michel is a married woman with 2 children. She and her husband run a fishing business in Trinidad, Bohol. Michel's husband operates their fishing boat to catch fish. Michel sells his catch at the market. Michel does her best to improve their income and sustain their family.

Michel has requested this loan to purchase fishing nets, hooks and other materials. Michel hopes to be successful in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets, hooks and other materials

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
55-year-old Norma is a married woman with 6 children. She has been running a sari-sari store business in Trinidad, Bohol for 5 years. Norma sells items like rice, chips and eggs. She also sells gasoline to the people in her community. Norma earns 6000 PHP per month with her business.

Norma has requested this loan to buy more items to sell such as rice, soft drinks and gasoline. Norma hopes to expand her store in the future.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as rice, soft drinks and gasoline

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie is 34 years old, and she is married to Alfredo, a father who works out of the country. Julie is committed to providing for her children’s needs by running her family store in the village of Rizal in Cauayan city. Julie has been in business for three years.

At present, she is generating an average monthly income of PHP 3,000. She is grateful that her business is doing well, and she wants to expand it. To make this possible, she has applied for a PHP 10,000 loan from Kiva to buy more products such as canned goods, noodles, bakery bread, and other kitchen ingredients to sell at her store.

loans.use: to buy more grocery products to sell.

loans.name: Mai

texts.en: Mai is 48-years-old with 2 children who are in high school. She has a small grocery shop in the local market and also sells artificial  paper goods. This shop was opened 3 years ago and it creates  stable income  for her to manage family life. Currently, she wants to have a loan of 8,736,000 Vietnam dong to buy more new products for selling.

loans.use: to buy  more new products for selling.

loans.name: Rodrigo

texts.en:
Fifty-five-year-old Rodrigo is a farmer working in Trinidad, Bohol. He is married and has a 20-year-old child.

Rodrigo has been tilling his land for 8 years. He grows rice crops to sell. Rodrigo earns 4000 PHP per month doing this farming. Rodrigo works hard to earn a better income and sustain his family.

Rodrigo has requested this loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. Rodrigo hopes this loan will help to increase his harvest.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Van

texts.en: Van is 38-years-old with 2 children who are at school age. She sells bamboo for making artificial goods  and makes dry rice noodle. Her business started 2 years ago. Participating in our credit program in 2008, she used loans for the bamboo selling service  and she  wants to have a loan of 8,736,000 Vietnam dong to  buy more bamboo for sale.

loans.use: to  buy more bamboo for sale.

loans.name: Medela

texts.en:
Medela is from Labo, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 61-years-old. Medela is married and has two adult children. 

To make a living, Medela owns and operates a motor cab transport business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing motor cab transport to local community members. Medela is 20 years in this business and earns PHP 15,000 monthly. 

In 2004, Medela joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Medela is requesting a loan of 25,000 PHP, which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business and to improve her general living conditions.

loans.use: to repair a transport vehicle used in the business.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is a married woman with two children. Judith is 35-years-old and resides at Cabungaan Clarin, Misamis Occidental: Philippines. Judith owns and operates a business venture, selling wood and wood-related products in the local community to earn a living. She's been 5 years in this business. 

Each month, she earns PHP 10,000.00 doing this type of business. She requested a loan of PHP 13,500.00 to have an additional capital for lumber business. In 2010, Judith joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Judith wants to build a house and to finish the education of her children.

loans.use: to have additional capital for a lumber business.

loans.name: Hiep

texts.en: Hiep is 45-years-old with 3 children who are grown. She is  a dry rice noodle makers.  Her business started in 2008 and it  creates  main income for her family.  Joining in SEDA’credit program in 2010, she  finds that  it is very suitable for her family. This new loan cycle, she wants to have a loan of 8,736,000 Vietnam dong to buy rice and some other ingredients for her production.

loans.use: to buy rice and some other ingredients for her production.

loans.name: Melvin

texts.en: Melvin is 35 years old and married with two children. He lives with his family in the village of Rizal, Cauayan city. Melvin is engaged in a hog-raising business, primarily raising hogs for breeding. He has been in this business for many years. He wants to expand his business, so he is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase feed and vaccines for his hogs. He hopes that he can get the amount he requested to further grow his business.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vaccines for his hogs.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 43-years-old and is a married man with 2 children aged 14 and 6. Samuel is a fisherman working in Trinidad, Bohol. He has been engaged in fishing for 20 years. Now he owns his own fishing boat for his business. Samuel also opened a sari-sari store that his wife manages.

Samuel has requested this loan to buy gasoline for the fishing boat and more items to sell at the store. Samuel hopes for his businesses to grow. He also hopes to be able to sustain his children's education.

loans.use: to buy gasoline for the fishing boat and more items to sell at the store.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
This is Virginia, 59-years of age, resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Ricardo, a farmer. She is a mother to her four children. One takes care of their fruit stand, one has his own family. A daughter is already working in a factory while the youngest child is just staying at home. By the grace of God at this time, she is working hard to sustain their family needs everyday. 

Virginia operates a fruits and vegetables stand along the road side. She sells seasonal fruits that are native to the Philippines like pineapples, which are grown mostly in the south region of Luzon. She also sells coconut, root crop, papaya, and other Filipino fruit staples. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php 300 in sales every day. 

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 10,000 loans. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of fruits and products to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Virginia dreams to give her family a good life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stocks of fruits and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Merced

texts.en:
Merced is from Poblacion 2, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 66-years-old, married, and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Merced cooks and sells food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from preparing and selling cooked food for daily meals. Merced has been in her business for over 10 years and earns 10,000 PHP a month. 

In 2010, Merced joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Merced is requesting a loan of 14,500 PHP, which will be used to purchase new equipment and tools to expand her business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase new equipment and tools to expand her business

loans.name: Timoteo

texts.en:
Timoteo is a 27-year-old farmer working in Trinidad, Bohol. He has been growing and selling rice for 6 years. Timoteo earns 3000 PHP per month doing this farming. He requested this loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. Timoteo hopes this loan will help increase his harvest.

In the future, Timoteo hopes to have a stable income to sustain his family.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Thang

texts.en: Ms. Thang is 57 years old and has four grown children. Three years ago, she opened a small grocery store where she now earns a stable income. She joined our program in 2008 and has made good use of several loans to expand her shop. Ms. Thang is applying for a new loan, for 8,736,000 Vietnamese Dong, to buy more items to sell to her customers during the upcoming Tet holiday.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell to her customers during the upcoming Tet holiday

loans.name: Otgonjargal

texts.en: Otgonjargal is 72 years old and lives with his wife in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Arhangai province, Mongolia. His wife runs his business. He started his second hand garment retailing business in 2006. Over the years he has gained many customers and trusted suppliers. He is known for his quality garments which he sterilizes himself. He is also a part time driver. He is requesting 2,000,000 MNT to buy more used garments. He is a sharp and hardworking man who says "Now that holiday season is here, my products are not quite enough to run my business".

loans.use: To buy more used garments

loans.name: Rohat

texts.ru: Рохат замужем и любящая мать двоих детей. Муж работает охранником. Рохат занимается купле- продажей книг. Она сама занимается в бизнесе и помогает мужу. Продажа книг принесет ей радость, всегда она читает что-то новое и рассказывает внукам. Рохат хотела бы получить займ в размере 2000$ США для покупки новых книг. Рохат надеется на вашу помощь и заранее благодарна вам за вашу доброту и помощь.
texts.en: Rohat is married and a loving mother of two children.  Her husband works as a security guard.  Rohat is involved in buying and selling books.  She is involved in the business herself and helps her husband.  Selling books brings her happiness, and she always reads and narrates something new to her grandchildren.  Rohat wants to obtain a loan in the sum of $2000 to purchase new books.  She relies on your help and thanks you in advance for your kindness and help.

loans.use: to purchase new books

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Hog-raising is Melinda's primary source of income, and she has been in this business for three years. She is 31 years old, married, and has one child. According to Melinda, the most tiresome part of her work is cleaning the piggery house every day. But Melinda is willing to do anything just to lift her family out of poverty.

Melinda is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase feed and vaccines for her hogs. Melinda would like to avail herself of loans and hopes that KIVA lenders will extend their assistance to her in the future.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vaccines for her hogs.

loans.name: Umedjon

texts.ru: Умедджон успешный студент 3-го курса юридического факультета Славянского университета. Ему 20 лет. Он активный и целеустремленный парень. Отец и мать пенсионеры занимаются домохозяйством. Умедджон запрашивает займ для оплаты за обучение университета. Он надеется на вашу помощь и доброту. Он хочет чтобы вы помогли ему окончить университет с высокими баллами.
texts.en: Umedjon is a successful third-year judicial department student of the Slavic University.  He is 20 years old.  He is an active and goal-oriented young man.  His father and mother are retirees and involved in household work.  Umedjon is requesting this loan to pay for university education.  He relies on your help and kindness.  He wants you to help him to graduate from the university with high marks.

loans.use: to pay for university education

loans.name: Ganzorig

texts.en: Ganzorig is 47 years old and lives with his wife and two kids in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Hentii province, Mongolia. His wife helps with his business and his two children are college students. He started his carpentering business in 2002. Over the years, he has gained many customers and experience. His products are smooth and high quality. Now that his children are college students, Ganzorig has to work to his full capacity in order to support them. He is a sharp and hardworking man who is requesting 800,000 MNT to buy timber to make chairs, tables and doors. He already has several orders, but  due to lack of funds, he hasn't been able  to buy raw materials.

loans.use: To buy timber to make chairs, tables and doors

loans.name: Maripaz

texts.en: Maripaz is 39 years old, married, and has two children. She lives with her family in the village of Rizal in Cauayan city. She has been running her hog-raising business for over four years. She earns about PHP 7,000 per piglet. She wants to have more piglets to raise, but she lacks the necessary capital. Therefore, Maripaz is requesting a loan of PHP 12,000 to purchase feed and vaccines for her hogs. She hopes this will make them fit and nourish them so she can sell them at higher prices, and she hopes to grow her business to secure her family's living.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vaccines for her hogs.

loans.name: Chhoeun

texts.en:
Agriculture is Chhoeun's main business. It’s the kind of work that she, being a poorly educated woman, can do for her livelihood. She really loves and enjoys doing her jobs. Chhoeun is a rice farmer as well as a pig-raiser who has tried hard to generate income. She is blessed with 4 unmarried children, 3 of whom are living under her care. 

Chhoeun’s husband also strives to work hard to raise their children and to provide them with further education. He is in the business of cultivating rice and takes some free time to catch fish along the Tonle Sap River. But at present, some of his fishing materials are ruined, leading to difficulties. To solve the problem, Chhoeun is taking out a loan from HKL to purchase fishing materials and a new boat machine to support her husband’s business. This loan will help improve their living conditions. She is very grateful and confident that she will pay her loan back to our lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fishing materials and a new boat machine to support her husband’s business.

loans.name: Shahnaz's Group

texts.en:
Shahnaz has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her eldest son’s motorbike repair shop. With the loan investment, he will purchase spare parts and tools to provide better-quality repair services to his customers. He has good technical skills, and his clients trust his quality services.

Shahnaz is hopeful that a loan investment will help her son to earn more profits by improving his business. She is a housewife, who stays at home and does her household responsibilities. She has given birth to 3 sons and 3 daughters. Her second son is illiterate while the other four children are getting their education. Her husband is a driver and provides transport services to his passengers.

Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book (called the Asasah Passbook) is Shahnaz.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and tools for a motorcycle repair business.

loans.name: Yoeurn's Group

texts.en:
A widow from a village of the Tbaung Khmum district, Yoeurn is a 56-year-old mother of six children, two of whom are dependents working in the rice field and the others work for a fee. She has been farming a rice paddy and planting cassava as a primary business to earn a living for twenty years. Sometimes, she works for others to raise extra income. She earns more than US$10 per day to feed her big family and saves five U.S. dollars daily. 

This is Yoeurn's first group loan with Vision Fund. She leads a group of six female members applying for a loan. She will use her portion of the loan to buy rice seeds and fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to increase her crop yields and earn more income to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds and fertilizer for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Ith's Group

texts.en:
Ith is 28 years, married and has two dependent children living in a village in the Tbaung Khmum district where crop farming is common. She is a farmer who has been farming a rice paddy and also planting cassava as a primary business for six years. Sometimes, she works for others to earn extra income to feed her children. 

Ith and her group members namely Run and Heang have been with Vision Fund since 2010. The loan has helped her and other members in the group have regular income. Now she earns US$5 per day and saves around two U.S. dollars daily. Ith and her members are requesting a loan. She will use the loan to buy rice seeds and fertilizer her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to grow her crops healthily and increase crop yield so as to earn a larger income to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds and fertilizer for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Salima

texts.ru: Салима талантливая и добрая женщина. Она замужем и любящая мать двоих детей. Муж работает в местном хукумате. Она занимается производством сувениров и поделок в национальном стиле. Она шьет национальные костюмы, тюбетейки, сюзане, пишет  картины. Со школьных лет Салима занималась вышивкой сюзане, тюбетеек и национальных костюмов. На  прежние займы, которые она получила в «ИМОН Инершенл» приобрела сырье в городе Ташкенте.  На данный момент снимает в аренду магазин, где реализует свои поделки и открыт как швейный цех. Имеет 7 работников и 4 учеников. Салима запрашивает займ в размере 1500$ США для покупки двух швейных машинок и сырья.
texts.en: Salima is a talented and kind woman.  She is married and is a loving mother of two children.  Her husband works in the local government.  Salima is involved in making souvenirs and crafts according to the national style.  She sews national costumes, tubeteikas (caps), suzani (embroidered textiles) and paints pictures.  Salima has been embroidering suzani, tubeteikas and national costumes since childhood.  She used her previous loans, received from "Imon International," to purchase raw materials in the city of Tashkent.  Currently, she leases a store, where she sells her goods and opened a sewing factory.  She has seven employees and four apprentices.  Salima is requesting a loan in the sum of $1500 for the purchase of two sewing machines and raw materials.

loans.use: to buy two sewing machines and raw materials

loans.name: Allah Rakhi's Group

texts.en:
Allah Rakhi is 43 years old, married, and has 6 children. Her eldest son works while another of her four sons is studying in the 3rd grade. Her elder daughter sews clothes for her neighborhood clients and stays at home.

Allah Rakhi is a housewife who stays at home and does her household responsibilities. She is very active and works very hard to provide comfort to her family. Her husband sells cooking oil and chilies. 

Allah Rakhi has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her husband, who will buy chilies and cooking oil in bulk quantities that will allow him to sell in larger quantities and increase his profits. He has been operating his business for many years, and Allah Rakhi is confident that an investment will help him to make his business more profitable.

Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book (called the Asasah Passbook) is Allah Rakhi.

loans.use: to buy chilies and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Oimniso

texts.ru: Оимнисо замужем. Муж работает слесарем. Она очень трудолюбивая  и добросовестная женщина. Она занимается куле- продажей детской одежды и обуви на местном рынке «Панчшанбе». От продажи детской одежды  получает хорошую прибыль. Она хочет пополнить свой оборотный капитал. Оимнисо запрашивает займ в размере 9000 Сомони для покупки новой детской одежды и обуви. Она заранее благодарна вам за ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Oimniso is married, and her husband works as a mechanic.  She is a very hardworking and conscientious woman.  She is involved in buying and selling children's clothing and shoes at the local "Panchshanbe" market.  Oimniso makes a good profit from sales of children's clothing.  She wants to increase her working capital.  Oimniso is requesting a loan in the sum of 9000 Somoni to purchase new children's clothing and shoes.  She is grateful to you in advance for your mercy.

loans.use: to buy children’s clothing and shoes

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is from Migcanaway, Tangub City. She is 33 years old and married with four school-aged children. 

To make a living, Gina operates a fishing business, harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Gina has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 3,000 a month from these activities. 

In 2009, Gina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets

loans.name: Myrth Jane

texts.en:
Myrth Jane is 29 years old and married with two children. She is peacefully living with her husband and two children at the village of Oscariz Ramon. She established a water-refilling service in their village, which she has been operating for six months. She earns about P30,000 a month. Her earnings go to their daily needs, school fees and payment for the monthly electric bill. 

Myrth Jane is asking for financial assistance amounting to P50,000, which will be used to buy more plastic gallon containers for her water refilling service. She is hoping that her business will be more profitable so that she could save some for the future of her children as well as improve their living conditions. In addition, she also aims to provide her customers with quality service to obtain greater profit.

loans.use: to purchase more plastic gallon containers for her water refilling business.

loans.name: Yorn

texts.en:
Originally from a village located in the Tbaung Khmum district, Yorn is 38 years old and has four dependent children who help her with rice farming and sometimes work for others to earn income. Yorn is a rice farmer and she has worked in this field for 12 years. She supplements her income by raising pigs and sometimes works for others in the village. With her current business, she earns US $10 per day and saves US $5 daily.

Due to a lack of capital for her business, Yorn is requesting her first loan from VisionFund in the amount of $500. She wants to use the loan to buy fertilizer for her rice farm and feed for her pig raising business. She hopes to grow her rice healthily and feed her pigs to be fat and also hopes to earn more income to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy rice fertilizer and pig feed for her business.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Zamira

texts.ru: Замире 47 лет, замужем. После окончания пищевого техникума, Замира проработала 5 лет на заводе в отделе вино-водочных изделий, расположенном в городе Карабалта. Там она  познакомилась со своим будущим супругом и в 1991 году вышла замуж.  В настоящее время Замира - мать троих сыновей, старший сын Эркин  - ее главный помощник во всем, младшие учатся в школе.  5 лет назад, в поисках источника дохода для своей семьи, Замира начала свой бизнес в торговле продуктами питания, открыв небольшой магазин «БЕК», который расположен  в центральной части села Беловодское. Пройдя через многие испытания, Замира смогла развить свой бизнес с ежемесячным доходом в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду, Замира смогла приобрести автомашину для своей семьи. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Замира обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение  товарооборота и установку новых витрин. Доходы она планирует вложить  в дальнейшее расширение магазина.
texts.en: Zamira is 47 years old and married. After getting her degree in food services from a junior college, Zamira worked for five years at a wine and spirits distillery located in the town of Karabalta. This is where she met the man who would later become her husband. She got married in 1991. Now Zamira is the mother of three sons; the eldest son, Erkin, is her main helper in everything, and the younger sons are in schools. Five years ago, searching for a source of income for her family, Zamira launched her own business, opening a small grocery store named “Bek,” which is located in the central part of the village of Belovodskoe. After overcoming many challenges, Zamira was able to grow her business, which now brings a monthly income of 20,000 KGS. Thanks to her hard work, Zamira was able to  purchase a car for her family. In order to grow her business further, Zamira turned to “Bai Tushum and Partners” for a loan in the amount of 100,000 in order to increase her sales volume and install new display cases. She plans to reinvest her income in further development of her business.

loans.use: to broaden her assortment of goods

loans.name: Delsa

texts.en:
Delsa is from Mayor's Village in Lapasan. She is 31 years old. Delsa is married and has two school-aged children. 

To make a living, Delsa operates a general store where she sells daily-use products, such as shampoo, soap, and toothpaste to the local community. Delsa has been engaged in this business for five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. 

In 2008, Delsa joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Delsa is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

location.town: Mayor's Village Lapasan, Clarin Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Vuth's Group

texts.en:
Vuth is a 48-year-old mother of two children, one of whom works at a factory at the Thai border. Rice farming is her primary source of income and growing seedlings for sale is an additional source of income. She has been in this business for 10 years. 

Vuth took her first loan with VisionFund four years ago. The previous loans have helped her afford sufficient food and a decent accommodation. She currently earns less than US $5 per day and is only able to save less than US $2 daily. 

Now she is requesting another loan with her two other female group members who each have been with VisionFund from one to four years. She will use this loan to buy more seedlings for resale. She hopes to increase her business and also to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy young trees to grow and resell.

loans.name: Aurora

texts.en:
This is Aurora, 59, resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Arnulfo, a farmer, and is a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating her business. She works hard to provide income for their everyday expenses. 

Aurora grows pineapples and some bananas on her farm located in Cavite.  Her farm is in the highlands, where it is suitable to grow pineapple and bananas. She regularly sells her products to markets and fruit stores, as well as to the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 6,000 each month.

To help continue operation of her business, she is requesting a PHP 14,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy fertilizer and farm inputs for her business. Part of the loan will also go to the maintenance of her farm. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Aurora dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all her hard work. She faithfully meets each week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God, which she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and farm inputs needed in her business.

loans.name: Bashiraan's Group

texts.en:
Bashiraan is 40 years old. She is married and a mother of 5 children, 3 daughters and 2 sons. 2 of them work with their father, who operates a CD and DVD selling business, while the others are studying. Her husband’s shop is in the market where he sells CDs and DVDs of the latest songs and movies. He is an experienced person and has been operating his business for some time now.

Bashiraan is a housewife who stays at home and does her household responsibilities. She has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for further improvement of her husband’s business. With the loan investment, he will buy the latest collections of movie DVDs and song CDs for selling to his customers. Bashiraan is hopeful that an investment will help her husband in further expanding his business and increase his profits.

Her eldest daughter is 22 years old and she is hopeful that she will be able to marry her soon as a result of the increased profits of her husband.

loans.use: to buy more movie DVDs and song CDs to sell.

loans.name: Renante

texts.en:
Renante is from Dalapang, Ozamiz City. He is 32 years old. Renante is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, he grows corn and rice for sale. He has been engaged in this business for over 12 years and earns approximately 2000 PHP each month. 

In 2008, Renante joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Renante is requesting a loan of 3000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Ma. Victoria

texts.en: Ma. Victoria is 39 years old and lives in Curvada, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur with her husband and three children, all of whom are currently in school. For the last five years, she has earned a living by owning and running a specialized store where she sells various kinds of fruit. She earns about 3,000 PHP a month. In 2010, she joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. She is applying for a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy more items to sell to her customers. She plans to use the additional income made possible by this loan to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is 35 years old and lives in Silang, Cavite City, Philippines with her husband and children. She works hard at her tailoring business to support her family. She makes curtains, bed sheets, blankets and other items for the home as well as doing repairs and alterations. She earns about PHP 400 a day. She is applying for a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy more of the materials she needs to run her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share work stories and study religion. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners and meet weekly.

loans.use: buy more supplies for a tailoring business.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is a responsible mother of three children, who lives in the village of Rizal in Cauayan city. She is now 44 years old and is married to Benjamin. She has been engaged in a hog-raising business for many years. She received P6,000 with her last disbursement. 

She dreams to lift her family from poor living, and that is why she works hard through her hog-raising. She wants to provide the necessities needed by her pigs; therefore, she requested a loan amount P10,000 to buy feed, vaccine and vitamins for her pigs. 

She hopes this will make them fit and nourished to provide higher sales at disposing time, and she hopes to grow her business to secure her family's living.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccine and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Mom's Group

texts.en: Mom, 47, has four children, three of whom are grown and living on their own. For the last 10 years, she has earned a living as a farmer in the village of the Ratanak Mondul. Her main crops are rice and maize. She has been a member of VisionFund for three years and now leads a group of four women who have been with VisionFund for from one to three years. The loans Mom has received from VisionFund have helped her improve her life and send her children to school. She is applying for a new loan for $350 to buy seeds and fertilizer for her farm. She hopes to improve her family's lifestyle and keep her child in school.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: Marat

texts.ru: Марату 51 год, вдовец, воспитывает двух детей. Марат работает водителем в местной компании и в качестве дополнительного источника дохода для своей семьи, занимается  животноводством. Благодаря упорству и настойчивости Марата, начатое с суммы 16,000 сом (KGS) хозяйство, на сегодняшний день приносит около 10,000 сом (KGS) в месяц от продажи молочных  и мясных продуктов. В целях дальнейшего увеличения поголовья скота, Марат обратился в компанию «Бай - Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 130,000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычков для откорма и перепродажи. В планах Марата- вложить доходы в дальнейшее увеличение количества домашней скотины, а в будущем – купить дом для старшего сына.
texts.en: Marat is a 51-year-old widower with two children.  He works as a driver in a local company.  Cattle breeding is an additional source of income for Marat and his family.  Marat's persistence and firmness helped him to expand his business, start-up costs for which totaled KGS 16,000. As of today, he gets KGS 10,000/month from the sale of meat and dairy products.  In order to further increase the cattle numbers, Marat sought help from Bai Tushum & Partners and asked for a loan in the amount of KGS 130,000.  Marat will use the money from the loan to buy bull-calves for fattening and reselling.  He is planning to invest the income from the loan into the cattle raising.  In the future, Marat is also planning to buy a house for his eldest son.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is 43 years old and married to a farmer. She helps her spouse transplant rice seedlings on their one-hectare rice field. They have been in the farming business for 20 years. The couple had nine children, and they could not afford to educate them all due to financial instability. Five of them got married at an early age. Two finished high school and two are still in elementary education.  

She is now asking for a loan to make improvements on their crop production. She is asking for P10,000 to buy seeds, fertilizers and insecticides to use in farming. Someday, Imelda would like to keep earning a good income so that she can achieve financial stability for her family and earn enough for the college education of her two children.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and insecticides to use in farming.

loans.name: Avan

texts.en:
Avan is a smiling, upbeat person. She is an Iraqi woman who tries to see the positive in life, giving her the strength to tackle each day, one step at a time. 

Her strength is most needed, as she is a widow taking care of a young son who needs special medical care. Every three months, he has to be taken to the hospital for a blood dialysis. 

Avan, with 40 years life experience and no education, does what she can: going strong, focusing on what she can do to make her family's life easier and better. Four years ago, she started to bring some additional income into her family by doing sewing and tailoring work from home. It is a small, but sufficient business that keeps her busy.

Avan successfully applied for, received and repaid a loan already with Relief International-Iraq, and she now took a loan of $1,500 USD.

The loan will allow her to buy an embroidery machine and raw materials for meeting her customers' needs, and she hopes to generate a steadily growing income to support her growing son.

loans.use: to buy an embroidery machine and raw materials

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose, 54, lives in Silang, Cavite City, Philippines with her husband and three children. She earns a living by running a small convenience store where she sells groceries, toiletries and beverages to people who live in her area. She earns about PHP 800 a day and is applying for a loan for PHP 23,000 to buy more items to sell to her customers. Her goal is to expand her business and provide her children with a good future. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and study religion. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 partners.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Burhon

texts.ru: Бурхон более 30 лет занимается скотоводством. Он разводит скот у себя дома. Ему 44 года. Он женат. У них четверо детей. Бурхон берет кредит для закупа коровы и телят.
texts.en: Burhon has worked with animal husbandry for more than 30 years. He raises cattle at his home. He is 44 years old and married. They have four children. Burhon takes a loan for the purchase of a cow and calves

loans.use: to purchase a cow and calves

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a hardworking mother who aims to become successful someday. She is 52 years old and has four adult-age children. She is engaged in a vegetable vending business to help her husband in generating income. Despite the hardship of living, they continued to work and strive until they educated all their children. They are proud to say that it is their biggest accomplishment in life. 

In relevance to this, they planned to continue and improve the business to earn and save more income to satisfy their necessities and save for their future. To work out their plan, Teresita is requesting additional capital of P18,000 to buy more stock of vegetables, like cabbages, tomatoes, eggplants, beans and potatoes to sell. She believes that when she works harder, she will improve the business and make it a viable source of income in the future.

loans.use: to buy more stock of vegetables, like cabbages, tomatoes, eggplants, beans and potatoes to sell.

loans.name: Maiyum

texts.en: Maiyum, 45, is married and resides in Kampong Chnang Province. Maiyum and her husband sell Chinese noodles and coffee. Maiyum is requesting a loan of US $1000 to purchase clothes for her daughter to sell and expand her business. In the future, Maiyum would like to use her additional income to send her children to a good school. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy clothes for her daughter to sell.

loans.name: Porn's Group

texts.en:
The head of a big family in a village in the Ratanak Mondul district, Porn is the father of nine children, two of whom are married and the rest of whom work on the farm to support the family. Porn is a farmer who grows maize and beans as his primary business. He has been in this business for 10 years.

This is Porn's sixth loan from VisionFund. He took his first loan five years ago. The loans have helped him better support his family and afford sufficient food. He and his group member, who has been with VisionFund for six years, are applying for another loan. He will use his portion of the loan, US $250, to buy maize seeds and fertilizer for his farmland. He hopes that he will earn more income from his business so as to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy maize seeds and fertilizer for his farmland.

loans.name: Ameeran's Group

texts.en:
Ameeran is requesting a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her livestock business. With the loan investment, she will purchase buffalo that will allow her to get a larger quantity of milk and increase her milk sales and profits. Milk selling is Ameeran’s family business, and she took over this business after the death of her husband few years ago.

She is a very efficient and active lady. She has a great business sense and deals with her clients in a very professional manner. Due to the good quality milk she provides, she has a good number of clients who purchase milk from her everyday. She is very experienced and confident that a loan investment will be a productive one for her.

Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Ameeran.

loans.use: To buy a buffalo for her business.

loans.name: Samol

texts.en: Samol, 48, is married and resides in Kampong Chnang Province. She produces and buys traditional baskets to sell, and her husband is an electrician. Samol is requesting a loan of US $1000 to purchase more baskets from local producers to resell. In the future, Samol would like to use her additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy more baskets to resell.

loans.name: Florenda

texts.en:
Florenda is now 58 years old and has five adult-age children. She is engaged in selling detergent soaps and dish-washing soaps in their village to earn additional income. She has been a farmer for almost 38 years, planting and harvesting rice and vegetables for sale. Due to financial difficulty, Florenda aimed to improve her small business to earn a higher income and satisfy their necessities. 

She planned to increase her product offerings to satisfy her customers' demands, but due to insufficient capital, she is asking for an additional P15,000 to buy additional stocks of detergent soaps, dish-washing soaps and vegetables to sell in the village. She mentioned that this loan will help her to make an improvement in her business and she is hoping that she will be successful someday.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of detergent soaps, dish-washing soaps and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 34 years old, married, and has three children. She ventured herself into livestock raising to receive income. From this business, she is able to earn about P8,000 per head after fattening them. She is grateful that her income allows her to help sustain the financial needs of her children and their daily needs.

She dreams to lift her family from poor living; that is why she works hard through her hog raising business. She wants also to provide the necessities needed for her pigs; therefore, she asks for a loan amount of P20,000 to buy feeds, vaccine and vitamins for her pigs. 

She hopes this will make them fit and nourished to provide higher sales at disposing time, and she hopes to grow her business to secure her family living.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vaccine and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Karen

texts.en:
Karen is 33 years old and married to Vincent. She has been blessed with two children, ages four and ten years. She has operated a saloon for the past four years providing manicure, pedicure and hair care services to her customers earning a monthly income of KES 10,220.

 She is borrowing her first loan of KES 30,000, which she plans to use to add more stocks of beauty care products for her saloon business. Her hope is to expand the saloon and open another branch away from her locality.

loans.use: To purchase  stocks of beauty products for her business.

loans.name: Mahmud

texts.en:
Mahmud is a supportive father of four and the owner of a great little store that carries just about everything: fruits and vegetables, household items, cleaning supplies, personal care products, cosmetics, paper supplies - basically everything one might need in his Iraqi town's neighborhood.   

In the past, Mahmud applied for, received and successfully repaid two loans from Relief International-Iraq. With the previous loans, he was able to purchase a freezer and a refrigerator, enabling him to carry fresh and frozen food items. 

Mahmud now took a loan of $1,400 USD from RI-Iraq to keep up the status of his store and keep providing more to his customers. The loan will enable him to carry more items and ensure a steady income for him and his family.

Based on the political and social challenges of lending in Iraq, personally identifiable information about this borrower has been altered for their protection. RI-Iraq appreciates Kiva lenders' consideration of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Iraqi borrowers.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell

loans.name: Hayitali

texts.ru: Хайитали проживает в районе Шахритус. Ему 39 лет. Он женат. У него пятеро детей. Его сын находится в Российской Федерации. Сам Хайитали занимается животноводством. Он откармливает и продает скот. Кредит берет для закупа крупнорогатого скота. В этой области Хайитали уже шесть лет.
texts.en:
Hayitali lives in the region Shahrituz. He is 39 years old and married. He has five children. His son lives in the Russian Federation. Hayitali himself works with animal husbandry. He fattens and sells cattle. 

He takes a loan for the purchase of cattle. Hayitali has already worked in this area for six years.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Alfreda's Group

texts.en:
Alfreda is a housewife and performs her household duties by staying at home. She has given birth to 2 daughters who have studied till 10th level. She also supports her husband who is an animal seller. He purchases goats and sheep at their younger age, grows them up and sells at a profit to butchers. Alfreda, in her spare time, gives food to the animals and keeps their living place clean.

She has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for further expansion of her brother’s business, who is also an animal seller. With the loan investment, he will buy goats and sheep in larger numbers that will allow him to earn more profits after selling to butchers and on EID (a holiday in Pakistan). He has been operating his business for the past many years, and Alfreda is confident that an investment will be more profitable for him.

Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Alfreda.

loans.use: To buy goats and sheep for the animal selling business.

loans.name: Munira

texts.ru: Мунира трудолюбивая и честная женщина. Она замужем и любящая мать четверых детей. Муж пенсионер. Пенсия мужа не хватает на содержания семьи и поэтому Мунира начала заниматься бизнесом. Более 4 года она занимается купле- продажей продуктов питания. В бизнесе помогают дети. Мунира хотела бы получить займ в размере 5000 Сомони для покупки продуктов питания с целью пополнения оборотного капитала. Она надеется на вашу помощь и доброту. Спасибо!
texts.en: Munira is a hardworking and honest woman.  She is married and is a loving mother of four children.  Her husband is a retiree, whose pension is not enough to support the family.  This is why Munira started her own business.  She has been involved in buying and selling food products for over four years.  Her children help her with the business.  Munira wants to obtain a loan in the sum of 5000 Somoni to purchase food products in order to increase her working capital.  She relies on your help and kindness.  Thank you!

loans.use: to purchase food products

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is 56 years old and married to Eunice. They are blessed with two children aged 23 and 20 years respectively. He has been in the farming business for the past 10 years with a monthly income of 5,000 KES which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his first loan with KADET after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. Ali will use the loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm. With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to venture into pig rearing which will increase his income and improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: Melissa

texts.en: Melissa is a 20-year-old single Lebanese woman. She’s living with her parents and two siblings. Her parents are taking care of the family and trying their best to cover all their needs. As for her, she started to work as a hair dresser and beautician from her home in 2009. She has loyal customers who believe in her fashionable and stylish haircuts and beauty designs. Today, she’s asking for a loan of $800 from Kiva partner Ameen S.A.L. to buy new cosmetics products such as nail polish, cotton balls, polish remover, and many other items. This will increase her sales by 30%. In the future, she plans to take more Kiva loans and open her own beauty salon.

loans.use: to buy new cosmetics products such as nail polish, cotton balls, polish remover, and many other items.

loans.name: Amos

texts.en:
Amos is a 54-year-old businessman s married to Rose. He has been running a restaurant for the past 11 years with the monthly income of 15,000 KES which he uses to support his children.

He is applying for his fifth loan with KADET after repaying the previous loans successfully. Amos will use the loan to buy more stock of sugar and rice for his restaurant with the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his children. 

He hopes to open another restaurant which will increase his income and improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: To buy stocks for his restaurant (sugar and rice)

loans.name: Pardaboy

texts.ru: Пардабой житель района Яван. Возраст, 37 лет. Женат. У него четверо детей. Его жена домохозяйка. Сам он занимается растениеводством и скотоводством. Пардабой выращивает овощи для продажи. Кроме того он разводит мелко - рогатый скот у себя дома. Кредит берет для покупки семян и закупа бычков.
texts.en:
Pardaboy lives in the region Yavan. He is 37 years old and married. He has four children. His wife is a housewife. He works with crop production and livestock. 

Pardaboy grows vegetables for sale. In addition he breeds sheep and goats at his home. He takes a loan for the purchase of seeds and bulls.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and bulls

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a variety of groceries to sell and food stuffs for her chop bar.

loans.name: Eterna

texts.en:
Eterna is married with three school-aged children. She is 57 years old and lives in Looc, Maria Siquijor.

To earn a living, Eterna has a general store business. She has had this business for 20 years. Each month, she earns approximately 3,000 PHP to purchase more stock for her General Store business. Eterna has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for one month. In the future, Eterna hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more stock for her general store.

loans.name: Chhun

texts.en: Chhun, 35, is married and resides in the Kampong Chnang Province. Chhun is employed at the factory, and her husband is employed at a Non-Government Organization. Chhun is requesting a loan of $800 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to commute to work. In the future, Chhun would like to use additional income to purchase a plot of farmland to grow more rice. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her husband to commute to work.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en: The grocery shop upstairs is owned by Hawa. She is a widow and has three children. Some of the items in the grocery shop are canned tomatoes, canned fish, diapers, and others. Her business is 22 years old. Hawa uses her income to feed, clothe, and pay the fees of her children. Hawa will use the loan to purchase other types of groceries to bring variety to the shop. She plans to reinvest the new profits.

loans.use: to purchase other types of groceries.

loans.name: Zeinab

texts.en: Zeinab is a 30-year-old Lebanese woman. She’s single, living with her only parent and three working siblings. Her brother contributes to all of the family expenses. As for her, she started to work as a hairdresser from her home in 2010. She knows chic and stylish haircuts which help attract more customers. Today, she’s looking for a loan of $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to buy new hairdressing supplies. She notes that this will increase her job productivity by 10%. In the future, she plans to open her own salon and hire people to work with her.

loans.use: to buy new hairdressing supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy clothing materials for sale to tailors.

loans.name: Petronila

texts.en:
Petronila is married and has eight children. She is 66 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Petronila is a farmer and raises hogs to earn a living. She has been doing this for five years. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase pig feed and piglets for her hog raising business.

Petronila has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, Petronila hopes to send her children to school and to continue to provide for their needs.

loans.use: to purchase feed and piglets for her hog raising business.

loans.name: Clemencia

texts.en:
Clemencia is from San Carlos, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 56 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. 

To earn a living, Clemencia prepares and sells cooked food for daily meals. She has been in her business for over 20 years and earns 10,000 PHP each month. 

In 2010, Clemencia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 25,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new equipment and tools to expand her business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase new equipment and tools to expand her business.

location.town: San Carlos, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Azra's Group

texts.en:
Azra has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her milk-selling business. With the loan investment, she will buy a buffalo that will help her get a larger quantity of milk and sell more for higher profits. She is very active and operates her business with great dedication and hard work. She gets up early in the morning, takes the milk from the buffalo and sells to her community clients to earn an income.

She has given birth to 3 sons and 2 daughters. Her eldest son operates a paint business, while the 2nd one operates a grocery selling business. Azra is very confident that an investment will help her add an asset to her business and will also increase her income.

Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Azra.

loans.use: To buy a buffalo for her milk-selling business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is 43 years old and lives in Antonino, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married and has five children.

Juliet works in the fish industry and sells/catches fish for living. She has been doing this for twenty years. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase more fish to sell.

Juliet has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi cooks plain rice and serves it with tomato sauce, macaroni, and fried fish. She has done this for thirty-five years. She is a widow and has nine dependents. 

Esi uses her earnings to pay her children’s school fees and other household expenses. Esi will use the loan to purchase rice, tomatoes, cooking oil, and so on. She anticipates reinvesting the new profit into her business.

loans.use: to purchase rice, tomatoes, and cooking oil for the preparation of food for sale.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace, a 30-year-old married mother of three children between the ages of five and eight, has sold fruits and vegetables for the past year. Operating a well-organized business, Grace works from 7 a.m. until 8 p.m. everyday. 

Grace has requested a loan from Kiva lender Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more pineapples, green bananas, mangoes, etc. to sell. She will reinvest her profits in her business and pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy more pineapples, green bananas, mangoes, etc.

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina is 38-year-old married woman with four children, two of whom are in school. She has had a business of selling from a food stall in Buluk, South Sudan for five years. 

Lina is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase onions and tomatoes. She will use her extra income from this loan pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase onions and tomatoes for sale.

loans.name: Phally

texts.en:
Phally, 47, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She is a rice farmer. Additionally, she sells soup at home. Her husband is a construction worker. One of her children is a garment worker. 

Phally is requesting a loan of USD 700 to purchase a motorbike for her son to run as a motor taxi. By doing so, her son can generate more income to support the family. 

In the future, she would like to renew her house and expand her business of selling soup.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for her son to run as a motor taxi.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 53 years old and is married to Margaret. They are blessed with two children. He has been in the farming business for the past ten years. He has a monthly income of KES 8,000, which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his first loan with KADET after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. John will use the loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm. With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his children.

His hopes and dreams are to venture into pig-rearing, which will improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase maize, fish, and rice for her food preparation.

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.en:
Bernadette is 47 years old and is married with seven children between the ages of 10 and 12 years old. She has a restaurant. Her business is open from 7 a.m. until 8 p.m. every day, and she has two years of experience. 

Bernadette has requested a loan from Kiva in order to increase her business by buying a greater quantity of food (beans, sweet potatoes, Irish potatoes, rice, etc.) to sell. With the profits, Bernadette will be able to reinvest in her business and to pay medical insurance for her family.

loans.use: To buy more food like beans, sweet potatoes, Irish potatoes, rice, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Speciose

texts.en:
Speciose is 37 years old and is married with five children between the ages of 5 and 10. Her husband is a driver. Speciose sells milk, bread, and tea. Her business is well organized. She is open from 7 a.m. until 8 p.m. every day and has one year of experience. 

Speciose has requested a loan from Kiva lender Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more drinks like Fanta, milk, and tea. With the profits from the loan, Speciose will reinvest in her business and pay medical insurance for her family.

loans.use: To purchase more milk, tea, and bread to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more eggs for sale

loans.name: Khursheed's Group

texts.en:
Khursheed is a mother of four sons. All of them are illiterate and do different kinds of work to financially contribute to the family. 

Her husband is a loader and provides loading services to his clients. He puts the loads on his donkey cart and delivers them to their destinations. 

Khursheed is a housewife; she stays at home and takes care of her household responsibilities. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband who wants to buy a new donkey cart because his current cart has become rough and is rotting. 

By purchasing a new cart, he will be able to put heavy loads on it and provide better quality service to his clients. 

He is very experienced in his business and has been operating it for many years. Khursheed is hopeful about her husband's business improvement after the loan investment. 

Note: in the photo, the lady holding a book (called an Asasah Passbook) is Khursheed.

loans.use: To buy a donkey cart for a hauling business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, cooking fat, and tea leaves

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy goats for resale

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia is 41 years old, married, and has five children, four of whom are in school. She has had a business of selling clothes in Buluk South Sudan for two years. 

Julia is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase clothes. She will use the extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for sale.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel, 27 yaers old and single, operates a service transporting people. In business for five years, he works from 6 a.m. until 10 p.m. everyday. Emmanuel has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase spare motorcycle parts (tires, engine, mirror, etc.) to help him in the business. With the profits, he will be able to save for his future and reinvest in his business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts (tire, mirror, and engine) for his motorcycle.

loans.name: Kenneth

texts.en:
Kenneth is a 27-year-old single man. He has been in the farming business for the past two years, earning a monthly income of Kes 5,000 which he uses to cater to his basic needs. 

Kenneth is applying for his first loan with KADET after being introduced by an existing KADET customer.  He will use the loan to buy a pig and pig feed.  With the anticipated profit from the business, he will buy seedlings for his farm. His hopes and dreams are to save and continue with his  education.

loans.use: buy a pig and pig feed

loans.name: Sok Rous

texts.en: Sok Rous, 30, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia.  She is a homemaker. Her husband is a fisherman. Additionally, he is a boatmaker.  Sok Rous is requesting a loan of USD 800 to purchase wood for her husband to produce more boats to sell.  In the future, she would like to build a new house.

loans.use: buy timber to build boats

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en: Lucia is a 22-year-old married woman with two children, both of whom are in school. She has had a food stall in Buluk, South Sudan, for one year. Lucia is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase beans and onions. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase beans and onions to sell.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is 49 years old and lives in Upper Langcangan, Oroquieta City. She is married and has 3 children. 

Daisy has a business that sells ready-to-wear clothing.  She earns approximately PHP 8,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 14,900 to purchase more clothes to sell. 

Daisy has been a member of PMPC for 4 years.  In the future, she hopes to own a general merchandise store to earn more money because she wants her children to finish their studies.  Daisy is a MIGS member of PMPC.  She is a hardworking mother, an honest person and has a happy family.

loans.use: buy clothese to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy plantains

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizer for her farm

loans.name: Gia

texts.en:
Gia is 31 years old and lives in Tuyabang Bajo, Oroquieta City. She is married and has one child.  Gia has a pig business and sells pigs for a living. She has been doing this for 3 years. 

She has requested a loan of PHP14,500 to purchase more pigs to sell.  Gia has been a member of PMPC for 6 years. In the future, Gia hopes to have capital savings in her business in order to take care of their daily needs and for the future of her child.  Gia is a hardworking mother and an honest person.  Gia is a MIGS member of PMPC.  She has a happy family and takes good care of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more pigs to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase retail stock such as baking flour, sugar, salt, and milk.

loans.name: Elisee

texts.en:
Elisee is 50 years old and married with two children between the ages of 20 and 25 years old. She sells charcoal. She works from from 7 am until 5 pm every day, and she has four years of experience. 

Elisee has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to increase her business by buying more sacks of charcoal to sell. With this profit, Elisee will be able to reinvest in her business and to save money for her future.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Channy

texts.en: Channy, 50, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She and her husband are rice farmers. Additionally, her husband buys cattle to sell to generate extra income to support the family. Three of her children are employed. Two are garment workers and one is a security guard. Channy is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase a motorbike for her children to commute to work. In the future, she plans to grow rice two times a year and send her children to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase motorbike for her children to commute to work

loans.name: Jamila's Group

texts.en:
Jamila has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her husband, who sells animals. He purchases young goats and sheep, grows them up, and then sells for them to butchers for a profit. With the loan he will buy some animals for the expansion of his business.

Jamila is hopeful that a loan investment will be good for her husband’s business and that he will be able to gain maximum profits from his business as a result. She is a housewife, but in her spare time she provides full support to her husband in his business. She gives the animals food and keeps their living place clean.

She has given birth to a son who is 1 year old. Jamila wants to provide a good-quality education to her son, and she is hopeful that, in the near future, her husband’s business will be good enough that she will be able to send her son to school once he is old enough.

loans.use: to buy sheep and goats for a livestock business

loans.name: Antony

texts.en: Antony used his previous loan to buy shoes.  He made a lot of sales, hence growing his business.  His desire is to fully establish his business in five years.  He has requested another loan of 30,000 Kenya shillings to add to his stock of shoes.

loans.use: To buy shoes for resale

loans.name: Sam Eng

texts.en:
Sam Eng, 37, is married and resides with her husband and five children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She and her husband are farmers who grow agricultural crops to generate income to support the family. Two of her children are employed at the garment factory. Farming is the main source of the family’s economy and that’s why Sam Eng needs more funds to improve her business. 

Sam Eng is requesting a loan of USD 700 to purchase farming land to grow more agricultural crops to generate extra income to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her farming business in order to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase farming land to grow more agricultural crops

loans.name: Rapiya

texts.ru:
Рапие 55 лет, вдова, воспитала пятерых детей.  В качестве  основного источника дохода для семьи Рапия развивает животноводство, начатое с закупа одного теленка. На сегодняшний день, в ее хозяйстве насчитывается две головы дойных коров,  один теленок и одна лошадь. Также, Рапия занимается пошивом подушек и национальных  изделий, доход от рукоделия является небольшим подспорьем для семейного бюджета. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Рапия обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы и баранов. Доходы Рапия планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота, в будущем мечтает открыть свой магазин.
texts.en:
Rapiya is 55 years old, a widow, and has raised five children. As a main source of income for the family, Rapiya breeds cattle, having started with the purchase of one calf. Currently her farm numbers two dairy cows, one calf and one horse. Rapiya also works with sewing bags and national products, and the income from her craft helps a little on the family budget. 

In order to further develop of her business, Rapiya turned to the organization "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 80,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of cows and sheep. Rapiya plans to invest the income in further increasing the number of cattle, and dreams of opening her own store in the future.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Rajab

texts.en:
Rajab is a resident of Changamwe, Kenya. She is married and has two children. She has run a detergent business for the past year. In addition, she is a tailor. 

Rajab joined Milango to access credit for her business. She is applying for a loan of 30,000 Kenyan shillings to purchase detergents to sell. Rajab hopes to open more detergent shops in the future. The extra income from the loan will be used to meet her family's needs.

loans.use: to purchase detergents to sell.

loans.name: Ly

texts.en: Ly, 56, is single and lives alone in Kampong Cham Province. She is a tailor. Ly is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to purchase cloth to sew more clothes to sell to her clients. By doing so, she would be able to earn more profit to support her daily living. In the future, she would like to run a sewing training center from her home and renovate her house.

loans.use: to purchase cloth in order to sew more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Kunthea

texts.en: Kunthea, 41, is married, resides with her husband and eight children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She is a rice farmer. Her husband is a baker in a bakery shop. One of her children is a sculpture. Kunthea is requesting a loan of USD 600 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to commute to work. In the future, she would like to renew her house and support her children to study harder.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for her husband to commute to work.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is 35 years old and is married with two children between the ages 1 and 5 years old. Patrick sells body lotion, cooking oil, rice, sugar etc. His business is well organized. He starts from 7 am until 8 pm every day and has four years in this business.

Patrick has requested a loan from Kiva lender Vision Finance Company in order to increase his business by buying more cooking oil, body lotion, soap, rice, sugar, Irish potaoes etc to sell. With this business, Patrick will be able to reinvest in his business and pay for his children's school fess.

loans.use: To purchase more cooking oil, body lotion, rice, soap, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Am

texts.en: Am, 61, is widowed and resides with three children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She is a rice farmer. All of her children are employed. Two children are chewing gum vendors and one is a garment worker. Am is requesting a loan of 1000 USD to run a new business by purchasing groceries to sell at home. In the future, she would like to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase groceries to sell at home.

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr:
Adjo est une femme âgée de 33 ans. Elle est mariée å un conducteur de taxi moto. Elle a 1 enfant de 2 ans qui ne va pas encore à l’école.
Adjo travaille comme coiffeuse depuis 2007. Elle coiffe, vend des crèmes défrisant et des mèches pour tous clients dans sa boutique. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, n’as pas de difficultés.
Adjo a requis son second crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des mèches et des défrisant. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Adjo voudrait agrandir l’activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit de prendre soin de sa famille.
texts.en:
Adjo is a 33-year-old woman. She is married to a motorcycle taxi driver. She has a 2-year-old child who doesn't go to school yet.

Adjo has been working as a hairdresser since 2007. She does hair, sells hair relaxer creams and hair extensions for all types of clients in her shop. She buys her products in Lomé. She works alone. At the moment, she has no difficulties.

Adjo has requested her second loan from WAGES in order to buy hair extensions and hair relaxers. She wants to reinvest in her business.

In the coming years, Adjo would like to expand her business. She says that with the profits, she plans to take care of her family.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions and hair relaxers.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a resident of Likoni, Kenya. He is married and has two school going children. He is a tailor, a business that he has run for the last fifteen years. He employs three other people. 
John is applying for a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to purchase new clothing materials for the business.
His main challenges are some customers do not pay on time. He looks forward to opening other shops. He will use the extra income to meet this family's needs.

loans.use: To purchase new clothes.

loans.name: Zoir

texts.ru: Зоир занимается животноводством. Он зарабатывает путем разведения крупнорогатого скота. Этим видом деятельности он занимается 15 лет. Он женат. Ему 44 года. У него четверо детей. Зоир берет кредит для закупа телят, чтобы увеличить количество скота.
texts.en:
Zoir works with livestock. He earns an income through breeding cattle. He has worked with this activity for 15 years. He is married and 44 years old. He has four children. 

Zoir takes a loan for the purchase of calves, in order to increase the number of cattle.

loans.use: to purchase calves

loans.name: Morris

texts.en: Morris used his previous loan to buy second-hand shoes. He made a lot of sale, hence growing his business. He has become more financially stable and he is grateful to Faulu Kenya for helping him access loans easily. He hopes to expand his business in the future. He needs a loan of 30, 000 Kenya shillings to buy shoes.

loans.use: to buy second-hand shoes.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
