Margaret is 34-years-old and married to Peter. They have four children.

She has been in business for the last 6 years from which she earns a monthly income of Kes 5,000. She is applying for her first loan of Kes 30,000. She was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer.

She hopes to use the funds to buy more stock of vegetables for selling and to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Melaria

texts.en:
Melaria is a 28 year old married woman with two children, all of whom are in school. She has had a business of selling tea in buluk south Sudan for one year.
Melaria is requesting this loan through BRAC south Sudan to purchase sugar and coffee. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase sugar and coffee for sale.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a resident of Likoni, Kenya. She owns a boutique, which has been running for two years. Florence is single and has one child.

She was introduced to Milango by her friends and joined to access credit for her business. Florence is applying for a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to purchase more second hand clothes.

Florence’s ambition is to purchase motorcycles for the transport business in the area she stays. She will use the extra income to purchase shelves for display.

loans.use: To purchase more second hand clothes.

loans.name: Ibrahem

texts.en: Ibrahem, who is a 21-year-old young man, is a university student majoring in Business Administration. He is also a worker with a decent salary to help him carry some of his daily expenses. Ibrahem wants to pay the university fees in order to complete his studies but the amount of money he has isn't enough to pay these fees so he needs to take a loan from FATEN. Taking this loan will enable Ibrahem to pay the necessary fees so he can continue his university studies and graduate to get his degree and get better work conditions in the future. Ibrahem is photographed in the picture.

loans.use: to pay the university fees.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana is 48-years-old and married to Edward. They have three children.

She has been in the business for the last 16 years from which she earns a monthly income of Kes 7,000. She is applying for her first loan of Kes 30,000. She was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer.

She hopes to use the funds to buy enough sugar for selling and to build another business premise.

loans.use: to buy enough stock of sugar for sale.

loans.name: Ghadir

texts.en:
Ghadir is a 25-year-old married woman and the mother of one child. She opened a gift shop in 2010, in order to help her husband earn their own living in a better way.

Ghadir is a hard working woman and she has an excellent reputation in her area.

She is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, in order to improve her business by buying special Christmas gifts and household items.

Ghadir is sure that this loan will help her a lot and will reflect positively on both social and financial situations.

She hopes to expand her business more and more in the future, and to expand the shop, in addition to the quality of products provided.

loans.use: to increase her business capital to buy special gifts and household items for the Christmas season.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 35 year old married woman with three children, all of whom are in school. She has had a business of selling clothes in buluk south Sudan for two years.
Mary is requesting this loan through BRAC south Sudan to purchase clothes. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for sale.

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en:
Faustina is 56 years old and is a married woman with 5 children. Her children are aged between 16 and 26.

Faustina sells seaweed to earn a living. She also supports her husband, who is a fisherman, in selling his catch at the market. Faustina works hard to improve their living. She requested this loan to buy more seaweed to sell. Faustina hopes to acquire an area where she can start seaweed farming.

loans.use: buy seaweed to sell

loans.name: Zeby

texts.ru:
Зеби 46 лет, замужем, воспитывает трех детей.  Основным источником дохода для семьи Зеби является животноводство, начатое ей в 2006 году. Стартовав с начальной суммы в 32,000 сом (KGS), на сегодняшний день,  ее хозяйство приносит около 14,000 сом в месяц.  Доходы от бизнес – деятельности позволили Зеби оплатить учебу  в университете для своего сына.  
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Зеби обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку трех бычков для откорма и перепродажи. Доходы Зеби планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота, в будущем мечтает видеть и младших детей – студентами университета.
texts.en:
Zeby is 46 years old, married and raising three children. The main source of income for Zeby's family is animal husbandry, started by her in 2006. Having started with a sum of 32,000 som (KGS), her farm today brings in around 14,000 som (KGS) per month. The income from the business allowed Zeby to pay for tuition at the university for her son. 

In order to further develop her business, Zeby turned to the organization "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of three calves for fattening and resale. Zeby plans to invest the income in further increasing the number of livestock, and dreams of seeing her younger children as university students in the future.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: El

texts.en: Mrs. El, 43, is a single mother who lives with two school aged kids in Reussey Keo commune, Phnom Penh. She always takes care of and pays attention to her children, especially their education, even though she is busy selling chickens in a local market of the city. El wants to improve her business and the way she works in order to increase her productivity. As usual, she buys chickens from her suppliers and she plucks the feathers herself at home before taking them to sell in the market. Thus, she spends a lot of time to make good process of her daily work. And at the present, she has found that there is a machine that can be used to pluck the feathers quickly and more easily than what she does. So she is taking out her second loan from HKL to purchase a type of machine as mentioned to support her business. And with the balance of the loan, she will stock chickens for a constant sale. Her business goal is to sustain and improve her business and provide her two children a standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a type of machine that can be used to pluck the feathers of chickens and to buy stock of chickens.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy plantains and cassavas

loans.name: Sila

texts.en:
Sila lives in Changamwe, Kenya. He deals in the taxi transport business which he has been running for three years. He also runs a clothes shop.
He is applying for a loan of 40,000 Kenya shillings to purchase clothes. The main challenge Sila faces is competition and few customers during the low seasons. That is why he wants to diversify into the clothes business.
His ambitions include supplying clothes to the area.  Sila will use the extra income obtained from the business to purchase more items for the business.

loans.use: To purchase clothes.

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en:
Edwin is 21 years old and is a married man with a 3-year-old child. He has had a "habal-habal" (motorcycle transport) business for 2 years. He earns 6000 PHP per month with this business. Edwin also tills a piece of land where he grows rice crops. He says his harvest is for family consumption.

Edwin requested this loan to buy motorcycle spare parts and fertilizers. Edwin hopes for his business to grow.

loans.use: buy motorcycle spare parts and fertilizers

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en:
Geoffrey is 51 years old, married and has two children.  He owns a posho mill where he sells maize flour.  He has been in the business for 11 years.  He has employed two people in the business.  Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to access financial resources easily.  This has helped him to improve his business. 

Geoffrey hopes to open other outlets of his business in five years.  He has requested a loan for 100,000 Kenyan shillings to buy sacks of maize.

loans.use: buy maize

loans.name: Riza

texts.en:
Riza is from the village of Mialen, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 36 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. 

Riza owns and operates a business, selling a variety of different products to the local community to earn a living. She has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns 10,000 PHP a month. 

In 2004, Riza joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Riza is requesting a new loan of 33,200 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: purchase products to sell

loans.name: Hatem

texts.en: Hatem, 56 years old, is the father of one son. He is a school teacher who earns a decent salary; to improve his income, he owns a grocery store. Hatem wants to purchase a larger selection of groceries to resell, but he doesn't have enough money to do so. He therefore needs to take out a loan from FATEN. Getting this loan will enable Hatem to purchase more and needed groceries for his store and to improve his selection of goods to resell. His income will increase and enable him to provide better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to resell

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 43 years old and lives in Butuay, Jimenez. She is married and has 2 children. To earn a living, Jocelyn has a business selling snacks. She earns about PHP 4000 each month doing this type of work. 

Jocelyn has requested a loan of 1,500 to purchase raw ingredients for her viand business.  Jocelyn has been a member of PMPC for 1 year.  In the future, Jocelyn would like to engage in another food business.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients for her viand business

loans.name: Romeo

texts.en:
Romeo is 31 years old and is married with two children between the ages of 2 and 12 years old. Romeo sell boutique items (rice, sugar, Irish potatoes, body lotion, cooking oil, etc). His business is well organized. He starts from 7am until 5pm every day and has two years of experience.

Romeo has requested a loan from Kiva lender Vision Finance Company in order to increase his business by buying more cooking oil, body lotion, rice, sugar and so on to sell. With this profit from the loan, he will reinvest in his business and save money for his future.

loans.use: To purchase more sugar, rice, cooking oil, body lotion, etc.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a 34-year-old married woman with no children. She has had a business of selling clothes in Buluk, South Sudan for three years.
Agnes is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase clothes. She will use the extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for sale.

loans.name: Fermina

texts.en:
58 year-old Fermina is a married woman with 5 children. Her youngest is 21 years old and still goes to school.

Fermina has been engaged in farming for 10 years. She primarily grows rice crops to sell. Fermina earns 5000 PHP per month doing this farming. She applied for this loan to purchase fertilizers and pay for labor. Fermina hopes for her business to grow and for her family's living conditions to improve.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pay for labor

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is married and has 2 children.  She is 39 years old and lives in Pan-ay, Clarin.  She is a farmer and sells crops to earn a living.  Lilian has been doing this for 10 years. 

Lilian has requested a loan of PHP15,000 to purchase seedlings for raising crops.  She has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, Lilian hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings for raising crops

loans.name: Kalbube

texts.ru:
Калбубе 56 лет, вдова, воспитала двух детей. Калбубе работает вахтером в университете и получает 2,500 сом (KGS) в месяц. В качестве дополнительного источника финансирования для своей семьи, в 2009 году Калбубе начала свой бизнес  в животноводстве. Стартовав с покупки одного теленка, на сегодняшний день,  в ее хозяйстве имеется одна дойная корова и теленок. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Калбубе обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS) на покупку одного теленка. Доходы Калбубе планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота, а в будущем оплатить учебу  в университете для своего сына.
texts.en: Kalbube is 56 years old, a widow raising two children. Kalbube works as a janitor at the university and receives 2,500 som a month. For an additional source of income for her family, in 2009 Kalbube started her own livestock business. Starting with the purchase of one calf, today she has one cow and one calf. In order to further develop her business, Kalbube approached Bai Tushim and Partners for a loan of 20,000 som to buy one calf. With the revenue, Kalbube plans to to invest in further increasing her livestock and in the future pay for her son's college education.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama makes and sells kenkey at Efutu. In front of her in the photo is the kenkey she sells. Ama has been selling kenkey for 10 years. She is married and has 2 children.  She uses her income to assist her husband to pay for their accommodation and bills. Ama will use her loan to purchase maize in bulk for the preparation of kenkey for sale. With the new profits, Ama plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize in bulk for the preparation of kenkey for sale.

loans.name: Lydiah

texts.en:
Lydia is a married lady who sells clothes and lives in Mombasa. The business has been in operation for three years. 
After being introduced to Milango by her friends, she is applying for a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to purchase new clothes for sale. 
Lydia looks forward to owning a free mark in the future despite the challenge of some customers not paying on time and high cost of materials.

loans.use: To purchase new clothes for sale.

loans.name: Bonifacio

texts.en:
Bonifacio is 49 years old and is a married man with eleven children between the ages of 11 and 30.

Bonifacio is a farmer working in Trinidad, Bohol. He has been growing and selling rice for ten years. He works hard to improve his income and support his big family. 

He plans to use his loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and other farm inputs. Bonifacio hopes his business will grow. He also hopes for his family to be in good health always.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Arnel

texts.en:
Arnel is 34 years old and single. He has been running a sari-sari store business in Trinidad, Bohol, for 6 years.  Arnel sells soft drinks, bread, eggs, cooking oil and various other items. Arnel earns 5000 PHP per month from his store. Arnel also tills a parcel of land where he grows rice crops.

Arnel has requested this loan to buy fertilizers and more items to sell, such as canned goods. Arnel hopes to expand his store in the future.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell, such as canned goods, and fertilizers for his rice crops.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 39-year-old married woman with four children, all of whom are in school. She's had a business of selling charcoal in bulk in South Sudan for four year.

Christine is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Asana

texts.en: Asana is a fishmonger at Efutu. In front of her in the photo is the fried fish she sells. She has been in this business for the past 4 years. She is married to a driver and has 4 children. Asana uses her income to assist her husband in providing for their family. She will use her loan to purchase more fresh fish  to fry for sale. With the new profits, Asana will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fresh fish  to fry  for sale.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is 20 years old and single. To earn a living, he does tailoring.  He has been in the business for two years. He has improved his business since he joined Faulu Kenya because he has been trained in business management skills.
Simon hopes to improve his business and employ people in the future.  He has requested 15,000 Kenya shillings to buy a sewing machine and fabric.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine and fabric

loans.name: Chik

texts.en:
As shown in the photo, Mrs. Chik is standing in her cabbage field, located in Pouk district, Siem Reap province. She has been in this business since 2000. She is able to yield an income of $2.50 per day. Her husband is the one who always helps and works alongside her in the field. Chik has been blessed with six children, two of whom are working to help support their living standard: Her first child is a civil servant who works for the government and her second child is a driver for a tour company. 

At this time, Chik has applied for a loan from Kiva to purchase a motorcycle for the two children to improve the way they commute to their workplaces and to avoid taking a motor-taxi service any longer. This loan will improve a part of her living condition. She hopes that our lenders won’t reject her first loan.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for her children.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia extracts palm oil for sale at Efutu. She has been doing this for the past 10 years now.  Her husband also extracts oil for sale.  They have 4 children. Cecilia assists her husband in paying utility bills.  She needs this loan to purchase more palm fruit to extract the oil for sale.  With the new profits, Cecilia plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more palm fruit to extract the oil for sale.

loans.name: Seterina

texts.en:
Seterina is a 30 year old married woman with five children, all of whom are in school. She has had a business of selling charcoal in buluk south Sudan for four years.
Seterina is requesting this loan through BRAC south Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Jamila Bibi's Group

texts.en:
Jamila bibi is 34 years old and she lives with her husband and five children who are 18, 17, 15, 12 and 10 respectively.  
Her husband is a very resourceful man who engages in a fruit selling business. This is an activity he has been engaged in for over 12 years.  
He is a very active person. In his working experience, he has obtained a good reputation among his customers. His customers come to him to buy delicious fruits.  
Jamila is a very responsible and honest lady. She stays at home and does her household responsibilities. She provides comfort to her family by fulfilling their needs.  
She has a great desire to see her husband’s business be in a more profitable position. Therefore, she has requested a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. 
He will use this loan to buy fresh seasonal fruits for reselling. 
Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Jamila bibi.

loans.use: To buy fresh seasonal fruits for reselling.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy, a  married 68-year-old mother of five children between the ages of 20 and 40, operates a salon to earn a living and has two employees.  She also does poultry farming to supplement her income.  Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to grow her two businesses because she has been trained in business management skills.

Lucy needs to supply water to her poultry farm and so is requesting a loan of 70,000 Kenya shillings to buy a water pump.

loans.use: to buy a water pump.

loans.name: Shagufta's Group

texts.en:
Shagufta is a housewife who stays at home and fulfills her household responsibilities. 
Her husband has a low-income job. She has a son and 2 daughters. Her daughters are studying at a nearby school.
Shagufta is very supportive and has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her eldest son who operates a grocery store in the market. 
With the loan investment, he will buy sugar, spices, and other grocery items in bulk quantity that will allow him to fulfill the needs of his clients and increase his profits.
He started his business recently and Shugafta is hopeful that an investment will help him take his business to a more profitable position.
Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Shagufta.

loans.use: To buy sugar, spices and other grocery items for her son's grocery store

loans.name: Maksuda

texts.ru:
Максуде 69 лет, замужем, воспитала восьмерых детей. Максуда- пенсионерка и в качестве дополнительного источника дохода, Максуда начала свой бизнес  в животноводстве. Стартовав с начальной суммы в 15,000 сом (KGS), Максуда смогла развить свое хозяйство с ежемесячной прибылью в 10,000 сом (KGS). Также, семья Максуды занимается полеводством, выращивая на 2 га орошаемой земли картошку, кукурузу и люцерну, получая сезонный доход от продажи урожая .  
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Максуда обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овцематок. Доходы Максуда планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота, а в будущем  - провести свадьбу младшего сына.
texts.en: Maksuda is 69 years old, married and raised eight children.  She is a retiree and started her animal husbandry business to provide a source of additional income.  Starting with an initial sum of 15,000 som (KGS), Maksuda was able to grow her business to yield a monthly profit of 10,000 som (KGS).  Also, Maksuda's family is involved in farming and grow potatoes, corn and alfalfa on two hectares of irrigated land; thus, earning a seasonal income from sales of the harvest.  In order to further develop her business, Maksuda requested a loan in the sum of 70,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to purchase ewes.  She plans to invest the profits into a further increase of livestock headcount and,in the future, to hold a wedding for her youngest son.

loans.use: to purchase sheep

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is a 40-year-old married woman with four children, all of whom are in school. She has had a food stall in Buluk, South Sudan for six years.

Lucia is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase beans & oil. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase beans & oil for sale.

loans.name: Nam

texts.en:
Mrs. Nam is a 57-year-old married woman who resides in the Pouk district. Besides farming, she is skilled in making bamboo baskets to generate additional income of $1.50 per day. She has been involved in her business for more than 10 years. She has 5 children, two of whom are still students and depend on her income. 

And now she is looking for a loan from HKL, one of Kiva's partners, to purchase a piece of farmland from her neighbor. She hopes that she’ll be able to increase her rice productivity next year to satisfy the basic necessities of the whole family.

loans.use: to purchase a piece of farmland.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles is 38 years old, married and has two children who are 5 and 7 years old. For the last 10 years, he has earned a living by providing computer maintenance services. His business has grown because he provides excellent service. He hopes to continue expanding his small company, and is applying for a loan for 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy a computer.

loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba is married to a farmer and earns a living by selling foot ware and food items such as sweet potatoes, onions, biscuits, toffees and salt. She uses her income to support her family and is applying for a loan to buy more items to sell to her customers. Her goal for the future is to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Kalsoom's Group

texts.en:
Kalsoom, 40 years of age, is a sewing and embroidery expert who works for her neighborhood clients. She is very skillful and receives a good number of orders every month. Her husband is a salesman by profession. Since his income is not enough for the family, Kalsoom started her business a few years ago. Kalsoom has one son and 6 daughters; her son is a welder and her eldest daughter is also a seamstress. Four of her 5 remaining children are enrolled in local schools and getting their education.

Kalsoom has applied for a loan from KIVA's partner, Asasah, for her embroidery business. She will use the loan to purchase clothes, embroidery thread and beads in larger quantities to allow her to offer better quality services to her clients and to increase her sales and profits. Kalsoom has been operating her business for some time now and is very confident that an investment will help her earn more profits.

Note: In the photo, Kalsoom is holding a book (called Asasah passbook).

loans.use: To buy beads and embroidery thread

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en: Flordeliza is 41 years old, married and has four children who range in age from 9 to 19 years old. She earns a living by selling dried fish, vegetables and various food items she cooks herself. She earns about PHP 8,000 a month and is applying for this loan to buy more items to sell to her customers and a scale that she can use to weigh her goods. She earns about PHP 8,000 a month and hopes to have enough money to allow her children to stay in school through college and have bright futures.

loans.use: to buy a scale and food items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy maize in bulk and fish to serve with her banku.

loans.name: Goran

texts.en:
Goran is a young Iraqi man who is helping to support his family and himself. He is 21 years old and a student who also works hard in a shop that uses raw materials and various metals to create window and doorframes.

With five years experience on the factory lot, he now took a loan of $500 USD from Relief International-Iraq to buy a new heavy-duty electronic cutter machine.

He hopes that with the numerous construction in town, the industry will continue to grow, providing him with a stable income as he continues his studies and supports his family.

loans.use: to purchase a new heavy duty cutter machine.

loans.name: Adzo Edem

texts.fr:
Adzo est une femme âgée de 29 ans. Elle est mariée å un revendeur. Elle a 1 enfant.
Adzo travaille comme coiffeuse revendeuse depuis 2009. Elle coiffe, vend des mèches, du savon défrisant et des sacs de sortie pour tous clients dans sa boutique. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, n’a pas de difficultés.
Adzo a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des sacs de sortie et des mèches. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Adzo voudrait agrandir la taille de son activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit d’assurer l’épanouissement de sa famille.
texts.en:
Adzo is a 29-year-old woman. She is married to a reseller. She has one child.

Adzo has been working as a hairdresser and reseller since 2009. She does hair, sells hair extensions, hair relaxing soap and handbags for all types of customers in her shop. She buys her products in Lomé. She works alone. At the moment, she has no difficulties.

Adzo has requested her first loan from WAGES in order to buy handbags and hair extensions. She wants to reinvest in her business.

In the coming years, Adzo would like to expand the size of her business. She says that with the profits, she plans to ensure her family's self-fulfillment.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions, hair relaxers, and handbags.

loans.name: Tursun

texts.ru:
Турсун 62 года, вдова. После распада Советского Союза , Турсун начала заниматься животноводством, ставшим основным источником финансирования ее семьи. Турсун начала свой бизнес  со стартовой суммы в 20,000 сом (KGS), и смогла развить свое хозяйство, насчитывающее 20 голов баранов, 9 коров и 1 лошадь,  с ежемесячной прибылью в 20,000 сом (KGS). Молочные продукты, такие как молоко, кефир, сметана, творог, а также мясо, Турсун продает на центральном рынке города Узген.  
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Турсун обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительных голов скота и кормов для них. Доходы Турсун планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота через покупку племенного жеребца, а в будущем  -построить дополнительный сарай.
texts.en: Tursun is 62 years old, a widow.  After the breakup of the Soviet Union, she became involved in animal husbandry, which grew into the primary source of financial support for her family.  Tursun started her business with an initial sum of 20,000 som (KGS) and was able to grow her business to currently have twenty heads of rams, nine cows and one horse, and yielding a monthly profit of 20,000 som (KGS).  Tursun sells dairy products, such as milk, kefir, sour-cream, cottage cheese, and meat at the central market in the town of Uzgen.  In order to further grow her business, she requested a loan in the sum of 100,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to purchase additional heads of livestock and fodder for them.  Tursun plans to invest the profits into further increasing livestock headcount through a purchase of a breeding stallion, and wants to build an additional barn in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock and fodder

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase stocks of dried fish

loans.name: Khalida's Group

texts.en:
Khalida is the mother of four sons and three daughters. Five are studying, while her eldest son is working. Her second son is illiterate and stays at home. Her husband is a building contractor and a mason by profession.

A very supportive and talented lady with much passion for her work, Khalida operates a decorative embroidery business, having learned the art of embroidery from her mother before marriage. Her skills enable her to contribute financially to the family, as she earns a reasonably good income every month.

Khalida is now requesting a loan from KIVA partner Asasah to purchase embroidery material such as beads, embroidery thread, etc. in bulk. These purchases will allow her to make better-looking embroidered clothes and increase her sales and income. Hoping that the loan will be productive, she aspires to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy beads and embroidery thread for embroidery business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more cosmetics to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Dopé

texts.fr:
Dopé est une femme âgée de 39 ans. Elle est mariée å un chauffeur. Elle a 4 enfants qui vont tous à l’école. Le premier a 19 ans et le dernier a 8 ans.
Dopé travaille comme restauratrice depuis 2004. Elle vend de la nourriture pour tous clients dans son restaurant. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, elle n’a pas de difficultés. 
Dopé a requis son troisième crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des poissons congelés, du maïs, du riz, du poulet et des boissons. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Dopé voudrait augmenter la taille de son activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit de prendre soin de sa famille.
texts.en:
Dopé is a 39-year-old woman. She is married to a driver. She has four children who all go to school. The first-born is 19 and the last-born 8 years old.

Dopé has been working as a restaurant owner since 2004. She sells food to all types of customers in her restaurant. She buys her products in Lomé. She works alone. At the moment, she has no difficulties.

Dopé has requested her third loan from WAGES in order to buy frozen fish, corn, rice, chicken and drinks. She wants to reinvest in her business.

In the coming years, Dopé would like to increase the size of her business. She says that with the profits, she plans to take care of her family.

loans.use: to buy frozen fish, corn, rice, chicken and drinks.

loans.name: Sitora

texts.ru: Ситора жительница Гиссарского района. Ей 25 лет. Она не замужем. Ситора занимается разведением крупнорогатого скота в дальнейшем для продажи. В этой области она пять лет. Она берет кредит для закупа несколько голов крупнорогатого скота.
texts.en: Sitora is a resident of the Gissar district.  She is 25 years old and not married.  Sitora is involved in breeding cattle for subsequent sale.  She has been in this business for five years.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of several heads of cattle.

loans.use: to purchase several heads of cattle

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more food items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Rajina

texts.en: Rajina, 35 years old, is married and has four children, one of whom is in school. She has operated a business selling charcoal in Buluk, South Sudan, for three years. Rajina is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua is married to a farmer, has six children and earns a living by selling peppers in a local market. She has been in this line of work for 10 years and uses her income to help support her family. She is applying for this loan to buy vegetables and more peppers to sell to her customers. She hopes to earn enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy peppers and vegetables to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Bayarbat

texts.en: Mr. Bayarbat is 21 years old and earns a living by selling wood that people use as fuel. He lives with his wife and his children in Kherlen, a town on the Mongolian border. Every winter his income increases because the weather is so cold, and he devotes his summers to cutting wood and preparing it for sale when the cold weather arrives. He is applying for a loan to buy a large amount of wood to sell to his customers.

loans.use: to buy wood to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Sajida's Group

texts.en:
Sajida only passed the fifth standard, but can read and write. She couldn’t study further due to poor financial conditions of her family. Now she stays at home and does her household responsibilities. She is the mother of five children. Two of them are studying while her eldest three left their education after the fifth standard and started operating different businesses.

Her eldest son runs a business selling gol gappay (a fast food item made with flour and served with yogurt, chili sauces and chickpeas). This is a very popular dish among people, and he makes a good profit with it. Her other two sons are involved in a fruit salad selling business.
 
Sajida has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the betterment of her eldest son's business. With the loan, her son will buy flour, spices and chickpeas in larger quantities for making gol gappay in larger quantities to meet the customers' demands while maximizing his revenue.

Sajida is very confident about the positive growth of her son’s business as a result of an investment.

Note: One of the members of Sajida's Group has a sewing business, which is why she is pictured with a sewing machine.

loans.use: to buy flour, spices and chickpeas for making gol gappay (a fast food item).

loans.name: Fyuduruva

texts.en: Fyuduruva is 28 years old, married and has two young children. Her husband is a fisherman and she earns a living by selling fish which she brines and salts.  She is applying for this loan to expand her business and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Akoua

texts.fr:
Akoua est une femme âgée de 49 ans. Elle est mariée å un géomètre. Elle a 5 enfants. Le premier a 33 ans et le dernier a 22 ans.
Akoua travaille comme revendeuse depuis 1981. Elle vend des poissons frits et des produits d’alimentation générale pour tous clients à domicile. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille seule.  Au moment, n’a pas de difficulté.
Akoua a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter de l’huile végétale et des poissons congelés. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Akoua voudrait agrandir la taille de son activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit d’assurer l’épanouissement de sa famille.
texts.en:
Akoua is a 49-year-old woman. She is married to a surveyor. She has five children. The first-born is 33 and the last-born is 22 years old.

Akoua has been working as a reseller since 1981. She sells fried fish and general food products to all types of customers from her home. She buys her products in Lomé. She works alone. At the moment, she has no difficulties.

Akoua has requested her first loan from WAGES in order to buy vegetable oil and frozen fish. She wants to reinvest in her business.

In the coming years, Akoua would like to increase the size of her business. She says that with the profits, she plans to ensure her family's self-fulfillment.

loans.use: to buy vegetable oil and frozen fish.

loans.name: Germana

texts.en: Germana, a 38-year-old mother of 7 children between the ages of 1 and 14, is married to a farmer. For the past four years, she has been raising pigs, and is now requesting a loan to purchase piglets, chickens and goats to raise. Germana, who works hard to improve her income and sustain her family, hopes for her children to finish their education and have bright futures.

loans.use: to purchase piglets, chickens and goats to raise.

loans.name: Hakika Group

texts.en:
In her late 30s Hamida, who is married with three children, has been selling vehicle oil for about ten years now. Working from 7 a.m. to 10 p.m. daily, she is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Hamida’s fourth loan from Tujijenge, Tanzania. She used the previous loan, since repaid, to purchase vehicle oil, and is now requesting a new loan for the same purpose. Hamida’s dream is to one day build her own house.

Hamida will share this loan with her loan group, "Hakika," which has 17 members. The group members will hold each other accountable in paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more vehicle oil for her  business.

loans.name: Levan

texts.en:
Levan is from the village of Giorgitsminda in the Kakheti region. He is 33 years old, married and lives with his family: his wife Tamar, two daughters (5 and 3 years old), mother, and 24-year-old sister. All adult family members are involved in the family agricultural business, which is the main source of income for them. The family has 2 milk cows and sells milk locally. The family also has a plot of land where various vegetables are grown. They sell harvested vegetables locally. The total average monthly income of the family is 800 Laris.

Levan requested credit for hiring a tractor for cultivation of the land. After properly completing seasonal work, Levan will count on good income for the next year. He will sell harvested vegetables for a good price and get the income which will be spent on the family's daily needs during the year.

loans.use: to pay the owner of a tractor for land cultivation service

loans.name: Saranchimeg

texts.en: Saranchimeg is a field supervisor in a construction company. She has been doing her job for three years and lives with her husband and her son in Darkhan, the second largest city in Mongolia. Her monthly salary usually does not meet her family's necessities. Therefore, she decided to run a new business, a table tennis club, which is not related to her current job. It will be located in the first floor of a common building. She already found a space and now she needs to make some adjustments to it. It needs some building materials for making internal decorations. The loan she is taking will be used to purchase the building materials to make renovations to her new space.

loans.use: to purchase building materials to renovate her new space.

loans.name: Azad

texts.en:
Azad has been the owner of a food market store for 14 years, selling fruits and vegetables, grains, canned goods and recently, dairy products. Located just meters from a busy road, with a few other small market stores besides his, for years the business has been generating sufficient income to support his family: his wife and two children.

Azad took a loan of $2,400 USD from Relief International-Iraq to renovate/freshen-up his little store and to purchase a few more items to sell, keeping up with the competition.

Azad hopes to continue providing great goods and fresh vegetables for his customers.

loans.use: to freshen-up the store and purchase more items to sell

loans.name: Gertrudes

texts.en:
Gertrudes is 41 years old and is a married woman with four children. The oldest child is 12 years old. Gertrudes's husband is a farmer.

Gertrudes has had a sari-sari store business for 5 years. She sells items like canned goods, noodles, shampoo and soap. Gertrudes earns 3000 PHP per month with her business.

Gertrudes requested this loan to buy more items to sell such as canned goods and coffee. She hopes that this loans helps her business grow.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as canned goods and coffee.

loans.name: Manana

texts.en:
Manana lives in the village of Sartichala, East Georgia, with her family: husband Michael, 10-year-old son, 8-year-old daughter and mother-in-law (retired). Manana and Michael operate the family's agricultural business, which is their main source of income. The children attend school. 

The family has 10 milk cows and produces cheese. Michael takes their homemade cheese to Tbilisi and sells it to grocery stores. The family's total average monthly income is 1,000 GEL. 

Manana has requested a loan to purchase feed for the cows. Since the cows will get high quality natural feed, their productivity will increase and the family will produce more cheese to sell in Tbilisi. Their income will increase and they will use it to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase natural feed for her cows for the winter months

loans.name: Divaajur

texts.en:
Mr. Diivaajur, 42 is a transportation driver of a private company. He started his job this year in this company and has been driving for many years. Diivaajur lives with his son and wife in the ger district, the nomadic Mongolian traditional tent in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. 
Last fall, he started building his own house beside his ger and still could not finish it due to lack of money. Specifically, he needed to purchase some necessary building materials to complete the building. He wants to finish it before this winter and now he just needs to complete some parts such as windows, doors and wall insulation. Therefore he will be using his loan to purchase the building materials necessary to finish building his new house.

loans.use: To purchase the building materials necessary for his new house.

loans.name: Batbold

texts.en:
Mr. Batbold is a photographer. Since 2008 he has been working as a photographer. He lives with his wife and his daughter in the slum district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. 
He uses a Japanese photo camera in his job and it is a main job tool for this job. He always cares for it. Half a month ago, his camera was damaged and there is no way to fix it. His job has stopped since it happened. 
The loan he is taking will be used to cover the cost of a new photo camera to get back to his job.

loans.use: To cover the cost of a new photo camera to get back to his job.

loans.name: San Cayetano Group

texts.es:
El comité “San Cayetano, se conformo con la iniciativa de una de las miembros, actualmente se encuentran  en el segundo ciclo de programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación paraguaya, con doce integrantes. Ellas demuestran unión y solidaridad las unas con las otras. Todas ellas son mujeres muy sacrificadas,y de escasos recursos.
Una de las miembros es la señora Antolina, quien nos cuenta que tiene una despensa pequeña pero bien surtida, donde acuden sus vecinos para poder surtirse. Comenta que tiene muy buena venta, lo cual la ayuda a poder tener los ingresos necesarios para mantener sus familias.
Antolina solicita el crédito para la compra la compra de bebidas, comestibles, panificados y demás insumos necesarios para poder surtir su local. Agradece por la oportunidad que se le esta dando.
texts.en: The San Cayetano Group was formed by one of its 12 members, and they are currently in their second loan cycle for women in business with the Fundación Paraguaya.  The have shown unity and solidarity amongst themselves.  They are all very giving women of humble means.  One of the members is Antolina, who shares with us that she has a small, but well-stocked, grocery store where her neighbors come to buy supplies.  She says that she has very good sales, which lets her have the needed income to provide for her family.  Antolina is asking for a loan to buy beverages, food, bread, and also fertilizer to stock her store.  She is thankful for the opportunity that has been provided.

loans.use: buy beverages, food, bread, and fertilizer.

loans.name: Amal

texts.en:
Amal is a 39-year-old woman from Al Hashmi, Amman, Jordan.

Amal is requesting a loan of 700 JD to purchase clothes for trading purposes.

Amal is looking to open a shop for her products so that she can increase her income and expand her customer base.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to sell

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 26 years old and is a married woman with three children ages 3, 8 and 9. Jocelyn's husband works as a farmer and as an ice cream vendor.

Jocelyn has been in the business of raising hogs for two years. Jocelyn works hard to support her husband in providing for their family's needs and sending her children to school. She plans to use her loan to purchase feeds, vitamins and school supplies.

In the future, Jocelyn hopes to have a progressive business. She also has hopes for her three children to finish college and have bright futures.

loans.use: to purchase feeds, vitamins and school supplies.

loans.name: Hosiyatmo

texts.ru: На сегодняшний день Хосиятмо продолжает свою деятельность. Она хочет расширить свою деятельность. Кредит берет для закупа бычков.
texts.en: Today, Hosiyatmo continues her business.  She also wants to expand her business.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of bulls.

loans.use: to purchase bulls

loans.name: Tsiuri

texts.en: Tsiuri is from the village of Patara Lilo, East Georgia. She is 63 years old and lives alone in her house. Tsiuri earns a living through dairy farming. She has 2 milk cows and produces yogurt. She sells milk and the yogurt she makes locally in the village. Her total average monthly income is 500 Laris. Tsiuri requested credit for purchasing new milk cows. The cows she currently owns are already old and their productivity is significantly lower in comparison with that of young cows. She will sell the old ones, add the loan funds to the proceeds, and purchase the younger cows. She will get more milk and sell more dairy products. It will impact Tsiuri’s income positively and she will be able to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase 2 milk cows

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
Jose is 49 years old and is a married man with 2 children aged 18 and 10. Jose is a farmer working in Trinidad, Bohol. He primarily grows rice crops to sell. Jose also sells fish and firewood to his community. He works hard to sustain his family.

Jose has requested this loan to purchase fertilizers and pay for labor. Jose hopes to achieve an abundant harvest.

In the future, Jose hopes "to have a concrete house and a 4-wheel car".

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pay for labor.

loans.name: Areej

texts.en:
Areej is a 29-year-old lady from Al Hashmi, Amman, Jordan.

Areej is requesting a loan of 500 JD to do home maintenance with an aspiration to improve her family life conditions and increase their standards.

loans.use: to do home maintenance

loans.name: Virgen De Guadalupe Group

texts.es:
Virgen de Guadalupe es de Villa ygatimi, esta integrado por 10 mujeres trabajadoras y luchadoras quienes por medio del trabajo en conjunto desean salir adelante y ayudar a sus familias. Ellas se encuentran en el primer ciclo del programa, pero comentan que desean llegar al máximo nivel.
María es una de estas mujeres, ella es muy trabajadora y emprendedora. Comenta que se dedica a la manicura, en lo cual le va muy bien puesto que le gusta lo que hace, y lo hace bien. Tiene buena clientela y eso la ayuda a tener buenos ingresos y a seguir creciendo. Una de sus metas es poder tener una peluquería donde pueda poder atender a las personas.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de quita esmalte, limas, esmalte para uñas y demás insumos que necesite para su trabajo. Agradece a la fundación y a kiva por la oportunidad que le dan.
texts.en:
The Virgen de Guadalupe [Communal Bank] is from Villa Ygatimi. It is composed of 10 hard-working, determined women who want to progress and to help their families through working together. They are in their first loan cycle, but say that they want to work at the highest level. 

María is one of these women. She is very hardworking and enterprising. She is dedicated to her work as a manicurist, and is doing well because she enjoys doing it and is good at her work. She has good customers, and that helps her bring in a good income and go on growing. One of her goals is to one day have a salon where she can serve her customers. She is seeking the loan to buy nail polish remover, nail files, nail polish and other materials she needs for her work. She is grateful to the field partner and to Kiva for the opportunities they offer.

loans.use: To buy nail-polish, nail-polish removers, nail files and other materials.

loans.name: Afiwa

texts.fr:
Afiwa est une femme âgée de 47 ans. Elle est marié å un promoteur de service. Elle a 4 enfants, dont 3 à l’école. Le premier a 28 ans et le dernier a 15 ans.
Afiwa travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2007. Elle vend des produits de mercerie pour tous clients dans sa boutique. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille avec une personne.  Au moment, n’a pas de difficultés.
Afiwa a requis son deuxième crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des produits de mercerie. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Afiwa voudrait ouvrir une nouvelle boutique. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit d’assurer la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Afiwa is a 47-year-old woman. She is married to a service promoter. She has four children, of whom three go to school. The first-born is 28 and the last-born is 15 years old.

Afiwa has been working as a reseller since 2007. She sells notions to all types of customers in her shop. She buys her products in Lomé. She works with one other person. At the moment, she has no difficulties.

Afiwa has requested her second loan from WAGES in order to buy notions. She wants to reinvest in her business.

In the coming years, Afiwa would like to open a new shop. She says that with the profits, she plans to pay for her children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy notions.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a 31-year-old married woman with four children who are all in school. She's had a business of selling food items in Buluk, South Sudan for four years.

Grace is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase sugar. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees off her children.

loans.use: to purchase sugar for sale.

loans.name: Zambarau Group

texts.en:
Halima is in her late 40s is married with one child. She has been a food vendor for about ten years now. She works from 6 am to 11 pm and she is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Halima’s second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to increase her stock of food and has paid back her loan successfully. She hopes for a loan to stock more food. Halima’s dream is to one day be an international business woman.

Halima will share this loan with her loan group, "Zambarau", which totals 16 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back the loan.

loans.use: to add to her stock of food.

loans.name: Fayzigul

texts.ru: Файзигул более 15 лет занимается скотоводством. Ей 57 лет. Она замужем. У нее четверо детей. Она имеет среднее образование. Кредит берет для закупа скота.
texts.en: Fayzigul has been involved in animal husbandry for over 15 years.  She is 57 years old, married and has four children.  She has a secondary education.  Fayzigul is requesting this loan for the purchase of livestock.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is 37 years old, married and has two children, one of whom is in school. For the last five years, she has earned a living by selling food at a stall in the town of Buluk, South Sudan. She is applying for this loan to buy beans to sell to her customers. She will use the extra income she earns as a result of this loan to begin building a house.

loans.use: to buy beans to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is a 42-year-old married woman with one child, not in school. She has had a business selling charcoal in Buluk, South Sudan, for the past three months. Rose is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Niño Jesús Group

texts.es:
Niño Jesús es el grupo conformado por 13 mujeres de la ciudad de Curuguaty. Ellas se encuentran en el primer ciclo, ellas dicen que está aprendiendo a trabajar en equipo y a tener mejores ingresos para sus familias. Ellas son mujeres muy trabajadoras y honestas que día a día luchan por tener un mejor estilo de vida.
Una de las miembros es la señora Maria, quien se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de prendas usadas. Comenta que le va muy bien, ya que debido a la crisis económica la gente prefiere las prendas de segunda mano por ser más baratas. ella desea poder seguir creciendo y de esa forma seguir ayudando a su familia.
María solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas de segunda mano para que de esa forma pueda surtirse y tener más variedades para sus clientes.
texts.en:
The "Niño Jesús" (Baby Jesus) Communal Bank is a group of 13 women from the city of Curuguaty. They are embarking on their first loan cycle, and say it means they are learning to work as a team and it is helping them to increase their families' incomes. They are very hardworking, honest women, who strive each day towards a better standard of living.

One of the members is Señora Maria, who sells all kinds of used clothes. It is going well, because, since the economic crisis, people prefer to buy cheaper, second hand clothes. She wants to be able to keep growing her business and so to keep helping her family. María is seeking the loan to buy second hand clothing to stock her business and offer greater variety to her customers.

loans.use: To buy garments to sell on.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is 29 year old and married with one child in school. She has had a business selling charcoal in Buluk, South Sudan for one year.

Lucia is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees for her child.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
He was born in 1944. He is married and has eight children, none of whom are under fifteen years of age. He lives in a six bedroom apartment in Ntsualam, a quarter in Bamenda, in Mezam Division of the Northwest Region of Cameroon. Ill health and the death of his parents are the major challenges he has faced in his life.

He joined GHAPE in the year 2000 and has successfully taken and repaid Empowerment Credit seven times. He invested these past loans in crop cultivation, animal farming, and also in his motorbike transportation business. He used the profit from these loans to feed, clothe, and provide medication for his family. Given a loan, he will invest it again in his motorbike transportation business.

With the profit from his loan, he will repair his house and also to pay for his children’s apprenticeships. He prefers a GHAPE loan because of the training he receives from GHAPE before each loan is disbursed to him.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle and fuel, and to process motorbike documents.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a 49-year-old married woman with six children, all of whom go to school.  She has been selling charcoal in Buluk, South Sudan for two years.

Susan is requesting this loan through Kiva field partner BRAC South Sudan in order to buy charcoal.  If she realizes any extra income as a result of this loan, she plans to use it to pay for her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy charcoal

loans.name: Waly

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un homme marié et père de deux enfants.Il tient un laboratoire de reproduction de photographies. Il exerce ce métier depuis trois ans et parvient à entretenir sa famille avec les revenus que génère l'activité. Il a ouvert un compte à l'UIMCEC pour épargner et accéder au crédit. Il sollicite un prêt de 150000f pour acheter des produits de laboratoire. Son ambition est d'élargir son activité.
texts.en: The borrower is a married man who is father to two children. He runs a photo reproduction lab. He has practiced this profession for three years and manages to look after his family with the revenue that this business generates. He opened an account at UIMCEC to save and to obtain credit. He is asking for a loan of 150000f to buy lab products. He ambition is to enlarge his business activity.

loans.use: to buy laboratory products.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 35 years old and married woman six children, five of whom are in school. She has had a business selling tea in Buluk South Sudan for three years.

Jane is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase sugar and coffee. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase sugar and coffee to sell

loans.name: Ndatte

texts.fr: L'emprunteuse est une femme mariée, mère de deux filles qui vont toutes à l'école.Elle exerce le commerce d'huile d'arachide. Elle achète le produit dans les villages environnants de sa ville auprès des femmes qui transforment les graines d'arachide en huile.Grâce à la forte demande de cet huile,beaucoup moins chère que celui industrielle,elle arrive à obtenir des revenus assez consistants.Elle prend ainsi en charge les frais de scolarité de ses filles ainsi que leurs dépenses d'habillement.Elle soutient aussi son mari dans les dépenses d'alimentation de la famille.Pour renforcer son activité, elle sollicite un prêt de 150000f pour acheter 200 litres d'huile d'arachide. Son ambition est d'implanter une cantine au marché central de sa localité.
texts.en: The borrower is a married woman, mother of two daughters who both go to school. She sells ground nut oil. She buys this product in the villages around her city from women who convert the nuts into oil. Thanks to the strong demand for this oil, much cheaper than the industrial version, she successfully gets quite consistent revenues. Thus she takes care of the school fees of her daughters as well as their clothing expenses. She also supports her husband in their spending to feed the family. To strengthen her business, she is asking for a loan of 150000f to buy 200 liters of ground nut oil. Her ambition is to establish a canteen at the central market in her area.

loans.use: to buy 200 liters of ground nut oil.

loans.name: Ñepuaverekavo Group

texts.es:
Ñepuaverekavo es el grupo formado en la ciudad de Concepción, gracias a que una de las miembros se había informado acerca del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación paraguaya. Después ella comento a sus amigas y vecinas y ellas encantadas decidieron formar parte del desafío. Actualmente son 15 mujeres quienes se encuentran muy felices dentro del grupo, trabajando en equipo.
Una de las integrantes es la señora Nilsa, quien nos cuenta que vende todo tipo de prendas, dice que por medio de este trabajo ella ha podido ayudar a su familia y de esa forma tener los medios necesarios para mejorar la vida que llevan. Ella se define como una mujer muy trabajadora y luchadora cuyo sacrificio es por su familia, ya que no quiere que pasen por ningún tipo de privaciones.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas con lo cual podrá surtirse y de esa forma tener más variedad para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Ñepuaverekavo is the name of this group formed in the city of Concepción, thanks to one of the members who learned about the Fundación Paraguaya’s program of women entrepreneurs. Later she told her friends and neighbors. Delighted, they decided to take up the challenge. Currently, there are 15 women in the group, who are very happy to be working together as a team.

One of the members of the group is Señora Nilsa, who tells us that she sells all types of clothing. 	She says that, by means of this business, she has been able to help her family and have the means necessary to better their lives. She defines herself as a hard-working fighter whose sacrifices are for her family, as she doesn’t want them to suffer any hardships.

She requests this loan for the purchase of clothing with which she will be able to stock her business, and subsequently have more variety to offer her customers.

loans.use: to purchase clothing for resale.

loans.name: James

texts.en: James is married and has two children ages one and two years. He describes himself as an honest and ambitious man. He is a mason and runs a retail store. He has been in the masonry business for the last six years. He has three employees. His business challenge is the high cost of building materials. James will be using the loan of 20,000 KES to buy building materials and home products for the retail store. He hopes to have had diversified his business in the next five years.

loans.use: To buy building materials and home products for the retail store.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty is a 33-year-old married woman with five children who all are in school. She's had a business of selling charcoal in Buluk South Sudan for four years. Betty is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to buy land for her children.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Zipporah

texts.en: Zipporah is 31 years old, is married to a farmer, and has two children ages two and four years. She describes herself as a quiet and social woman. She has been involved in tailoring for the last four years. She sells dresses and school uniforms to students and women. Her business challenge is that she lacks sufficient funds for improving the business. She plans to use the loan of 20,000 KES to buy clothing materials. Zipporah hopes in the future to venture into the van transportation business.

loans.use: To buy clothing materials.

loans.name: Goumbo

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un homme marié, père de quatre enfants. Il exerce le métier d'agent de police dans sa localité. Son revenu salariale lui permet d'entretenir sa famille et de s'occuper des frais de scolarité de ses enfants.Pour améliorer l'équipement de son domicile , il sollicite un prêt de 300000f afin d'acheter un double lit en bois et une coiffeuse. Il ambitionne de mener des activités génératrices de revenus pour améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en: The borrower is a married man, father of four children. He is a policeman in his area. His salary allows him to look after his family and to take care of the school fees of his children. To improve the set-up of his home, he is asking for a loan of 300000f in order to buy a double bed made of wood and a dressing table. He aspires to direct his revenue generating activities in such a way that improves the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to buy a wooden double bed and a dressing table.

loans.name: Aya

texts.en: Aya is a 48-year-old married woman with seven children who all are in school. She's had a business of selling perfumes in Buluk South Sudan for two years. Aya is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase perfumes. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes for sale.

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr: L'emprunteuse est une femme mariée et mère de deux enfants. Elle exerce un commerce de produits de beauté et de produits ménagers.Elle achète ses marchandises dans un pays voisin non loin de sa ville.Elle les vend ensuite à crédit à  ses clients avant de se faire payer au bout de deux mois. Elle parvient à obtenir des bénéfices consistants de son commerce; ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses propres besoins et de soutenir grandement son mari dans la prise en charge des dépenses d'entretien de la famille.Elle sollicite un pret de 200 000f  auprès de l'UIMCEC pour acheter 5 caisses de lait de beauté, 3 cartons de mèches pour tresse et 2 cartons de parfum.Son ambition est de construire une cantine devant son domicile.
texts.en: The borrower is a married woman and mother of two children. She sells beauty and household products. She buys her merchandise in a neighboring country not far from her city. She then sells it on credit to her clients before charging them after two months. She manages to get consistent revenues from her business; this allows her to provide for her own needs and to heavily support her husband in the management of the family's household expenses. She is asking for a loan of 200000f from UIMCEC to buy five crates of lotion, three boxes of hair extensions, and two boxes of perfume. Her ambition is to build a canteen in front of her home.

loans.use: to buy five crates of lotion, three boxes of hair extensions, and two boxes of perfume.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose, 30 years old, is married and has six children, four of them in school. She has operated a business selling clothes in Buluk, South Sudan, for three years. Rose is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase clothes. She will use the extra income from this loan to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for sale.

loans.name: Pyapy Mbarete Group

texts.es:
Pyapy Mbarete es el grupo formado en la ciudad de Concepción, son mujeres muy humildes, pero con ganas de salir adelante y de esa forma ayudar a sus familias. Ellas ven en el programa de la fundación una gran ayuda para ellas y para sus familias.
Blanca es una mujer muy trabajadora, se unió con la esperanza de que por medio del trabajo en conjunto y con la ayuda de sus compañeras pueda salir adelante y ayudar a su familia. Ella comenta que se dedica a la venta de prendas en general, en lo cual le va muy bien, ya que siempre tiene buena variedad de prenda y eso atrae a los clientes.
Ella desea seguir abasteciéndose y de esa forma seguir ayudando a su familia, por lo que solicita el crédito, para la compra de prendas de verano, para que de esa forma siga ayudando a su familia y cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Pyapy Mbarete is the name of this group formed in the city of Concepción. They are very humble women, but with the desire to get ahead and help their families. They see the Fundación’s program as a great help to themselves and their families. 

Blanca is a very hardworking woman. She joined in the hopes that, by working in the group and with the help of her companions,that she could get ahead and help her family.

She comments that she makes her living selling clothing, which is going very well for her since she always has a good variety of clothing which attracts customers.

loans.use: to purchase clothing for resale.

loans.name: Isaie

texts.en: Isaie, 29 years old, is married and has three children between the ages of 1 and 5. He has owned a business transporting people for 3 years. He works from 6 a.m. until 10 p.m. every day. Isaie has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase spare parts (tires, engines, mirrors, etc.) to help him in the business. With the profits from this loan, he will be able to pay his children's school fees and to reinvest in his business.

loans.use: To purchase more tires, mirrors, engines, etc.

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr: L'emprunteuse est une femme mariée.Elle vit avec son mari et ses quatre enfants. Elle tient au marché de sa localité une boutique de vente de produits alimentaires et de consommation courante.Son commerce lui rapporte des bénéfices qui lui permettent de satisfaire ses propres besoins ainsi que ceux de ses enfants.Elle soutient également son mari dans les autres dépenses d'entretien de la famille. Pour renforcer son fonds de commerce en cette veille de fête pendant laquelle la demande est très importante, elle sollicite un prêt de 300 000f auprès de l'UIMCEC pour acheter des sacs de riz, d'oignon, de pomme de terre et de l'huile.Son ambition est d'élargir son commerce.
texts.en:
The borrower is a married woman. She lives with her husband and her four children. At the market of her region she runs a shop selling regularly used food products. Her business brings her profits that allow her to meet her own needs as well as those of her children. She also supports her husband with the other family expenses. 

To strengthen her business during this pre-holiday season during which demand is significant, she is requesting a loan of 300,000f from UIMCEC in order to buy bags of rice, onions, potatoes and oil. Her goal is to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy bags of rice, onion, potatoes and oil.

loans.name: Epiphanie

texts.en: Epiphanie is 34 years old. She is married to a businessman. She has two children, ages three and 15. With the loan, she plans to add more items such as salt, cooking oil, rice, and shoes for the same business she has been running for one year. She plans to use the profits to build her residential house.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs and to add shoes to her inventory.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is married and has three children ranging from 16 to 28 years old. She describes herself as an ambitious woman. She has been selling home products such as sugar, salt, flour, blue band, etc., for the last five years. Her business challenge is the high prices of goods sold when purchasing them. 

Sarah plan to expand the business by using the 20,000 Kenyan shilling loan to buy more home products. She is hoping to have diversified her business within the next five years.

loans.use: To buy more home products such as sugar, salt, flour, etc.

loans.name: Chantal

texts.en: Chantal is 29 years old. She is married with three children between 6 and 10, all of whom go to school. Her husband works as a driver. She sells shoes and sugar. With the loan, she will buy more shoes and sugar to sell. Profits will be used to reinvest in the same businesses. She dreams to have a car in the future.

loans.use: To buy more shoes and sugar to sell

loans.name: Rejoice

texts.en: Rejoice, 35 years old, is married and has five children, all of them in school. She has operated a food stall business in Buluk. South Sudan, for five years. Rejoice is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase onions and oil. She will use the extra income from this loan to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase onions and oil for resale.

loans.name: Jovine

texts.en: Jovine, aged 22 years, has one child who is 4 years old. She sells beer, sodas and Mutzig (a brand of beer). She has been running this business for the period of six months. She is planning to use the loan for expanding her bar business. With the profits, she will reinvest in the same business. She wants to reach a big level of capital in the future.

loans.use: To buy beer and sodas to sell.

loans.name: Claire

texts.en: Claire is 22 years old and single. She sells different foodstuffs such as cooking oil, rice and peanuts, a business which she has been running for the period of one year. With the loan, she will add more items for her shop, and she expects to use the profits to build a house. She dreams to become a wholesaler in the future.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Jean Claude

texts.en: Jean Claude is 31 years old. He is married with two children aged 7 and 8; both go to school. He and his wife work together in the same restaurant. He has been running the restaurant for the past two years. He is requesting the loan to add more equipment as well as different types of food to serve in the restaurant. He plans to use the profits to build a house. In the future, he wants to see his business prospering.

loans.use: To buy more equipment and foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase vegetables, canned goods, noodles, rice and other types of foods.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is 34-year-old married woman with four children, three of whom are in school. She's had a business selling clothes in bulk in South Sudan for four years.

Martha is requesting a loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase clothes. She will use extra income fom this loan to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to sell.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en: Anna is 31 year old and married with four children who are all in school. She has had a business selling bread in Buluk, South Sudan for six years. Anna is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase breads. She will use her extra income from this loan to buy a plot and build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase bread to sell

loans.name: Aflodice

texts.en:
Aflodice is 29 years old and married with four children between the ages of 1 and 4 years old. Aflodice sells rice, sugar, cooking oil, water, juice, etc. His business is well organized. He works from 6 am until 8 pm every day and has four years of experience in this business.

Aflodice has requested a loan from Kiva lender Vision Finance Company in order to purchase soap, water, juice, rice, sugar and so on to sell. With the profits from the loan, Aflodice will be able to reinvest in his business and to pay his children's school fees.

loans.use: To purchase more soap, water, juice, rice, sugar,etc to sell.

loans.name: San Ramon Group

texts.es:
El comité San Ramón es de la ciudad de San Lorenzo, todas ellas son amigas y vecinas de barrio que se unieron con las ganas de salir adelante y ayudarse las unas con las otras. Son todas señora muy trabajadoras, se encuentran en el segundo ciclo del programa de mujeres emprendedoras, lo que me da mas satisfacción es que son muy unidas y trabajan juntas.
María es una de las miembros, ella nos comenta que se dedica a la venta de remedios naturales, es decir de yuyos, ella comenta que es muy sacrificado su trabajo, ya que ella recorre para venderlos y eso es muy agotador. Esta sumamente agradecida con la fundación por la oportunidad que le da, pues no muchas instituciones se la darían.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de remedios yuyos en cantidad, para que de esa forma pueda estar abastecida y tener más variedad de especias.
texts.en:
The San Ramón Group is from the city of San Lorenzo. The members are all friends and neighbors who formed a group with the desire to get ahead and help one another. They are all very hard-working women and they are in their second loan cycle for women in business. I am most pleased by the fact that they are all very united and work together.

María is one of the members. She says she works selling natural remedies, or herbal remedies. She says her job requires a lot of work because she has to travel around to sell her products and it is very tiring. She is incredibly thankful for the opportunity provided by the loan institution, because many other institutions would not offer this help. She is asking for a loan to buy herbal remedies in bulk, so that she can be well-stocked and have a greater variety of products.

loans.use: buy natural remedies for resale

loans.name: Aloysie

texts.en:
Aloysie is 26 years old and married with two children aged between 4 and 6 years old. She owns a tailoring business. This is her eighth year in this business, and she works from 8 a.m. until 6 p.m. every day. Aloysie currently employs one person to help her.

Aloysie has requested a Kiva loan through Vision Finance Company in order to purchase various materials for her tailoring business. With any profits, she will be able to save for her future and be able to buy her own house.

loans.use: to purchase various materials for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Antoine

texts.en:
Antoine is 35 years old and married with two children, ages between 2 and 3 years old. He owns a business selling timber. He has spent two years in this business and works from 9am until 5:30pm every day except on the weekend. He currently employs one person to help him.

Antoine has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand his timber business by buying more timber for resale. With any profits, he will be able to save for his future and reinvest in his business.

loans.use: to expand his timber business.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 47 years old. She is married and has two children. To earn a living, she practices farming. She also earns extra income from her retail shop.  Through Faulu Kenya, she has been able to add cows to her farm, resulting in more milk production.

Nancy hopes to sell milk on a wholesale basis in the future. She has requested 100,000 Kenya shillings to buy a dairy cow.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Yvette

texts.en:
Yvette is 35 years old and married with six children, aged between 3 and 15 years old. Yvette sells eggs, bananas, sugar, etc. Her business is well organized. She works from 6 am until 9 pm every day and has three years of experience.

Yvette has requested a loan from Kiva lender Vision Finance Company in order to purchase a large quantity of tomatoes, eggs, bananas, sugar, etc to sell. With any profit from the loan, Yvette will reinvest in her business and be able to save for her future.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes, eggs, bananas, sugar, etc to sell.

loans.name: Antoinette

texts.en:
Antoinette is 41 years old and married with two children between the ages of 16 and 20 years old. Antoinette has a sewing business. Her business is well organized and clean. She works from 7am until 8pm every day and has eight years of experience.

Antoinette has requested a loan from Kiva lender Vision Finance Company in order to increase her business by buying more clothes for sewing. With the profit, she will be able to buy more food for her family and save money.
