loans.use: to purchase more clothes for sewing.

loans.name: C 5411 Amahoro Group

texts.en:
Angelique is 30 years old and single. Angelique takes care of four dependents. She owns a sewing business which is open from 8am until 9pm every day. She is the leader of a group called "C5411 Amahoro" in the local language which means "Peace" in English. In the photo she is the first person on the left side, second line. Angelique has eleven years of experience.

Angelique has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase various materials for her sewing business. With any profit, she will save money for her future and be able to buy a house.

loans.use: to purchase various materials for her sewing business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more clothing materials for her boutique.

loans.name: Xuan

texts.en: Mrs. Xuan and her husband are taking the loan out for her son, a student named Dung. When he was a child, Dung wished to be a computer technician. That is the reason why he chose Hanoi Polytechnic University as the place for growing his dream. His study duration lasts five years and he will graduate in 2012. He has to study hard to obtain knowledge. During his studies, he has been confronted with difficulties, especially in paying tuition fees and other supplies. He requires to have a loan of 10,206,000 Vietnam dong to partly solve this problem.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees and other supplies.

loans.name: Modeste

texts.en:
Modeste is 42 years old and married with eight children between the ages of 1 and 15 years old. He owns a business selling food and drinks such as milk, tea, cakes, biscuits, water, etc. He has been in this business for ten years and works from 6am until 11pm every day.

Modeste has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand his restaurant by buying more food and drinks such as milk, tea, cakes, biscuits, water, etc. With any profits, he will be able to save for his future and pay medical insurance for his family.

loans.use: to expand his restaurant by buying more food and drinks to sell.

loans.name: Por Siempre Group

texts.es:
Este grupo surge por el contacto de una de las miembros con la asesora de la fundación, ellas entusiasmadas decidieron formar parte del programa de la fundación paraguaya y actualmente ya se encuentran en el décimo ciclo, donde todas ellas trabajan en forma conjunta y dentro de un marco de respeto.
Florinda es una de estas mujeres luchadoras, ellas nos cuenta que por medio de las prendas que vende, ella ha podido ayudar a su familia y salir adelante, su negocio también la ayuda a cubrir los gastos que diariamente surgen en la casa. Uno de sus sueños es tener una gran tienda de ropa donde pueda ofrecerle a sus clientes todo tipo de prendas.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas de verano, con lo cual podrá estar preparada para la demanda de sus clientes en esta época de calor. Ella agradece a la fundación y a kiva por la oportunidad que le dan, pues así está cada vez más cerca de su sueño.
texts.en:
This group came about through the contact of one of the members with the counselor of the foundation. They enthusiastically decided to create a group in the program for the Fundación Paragaya (Paraguayan Foundation) and currently they are in the 10th cycle, where all of them work collectively within a structure of respect.

Florinda is one of these women fighters. She tells us that through the clothes that she sells, she has been able to help her family get ahead as her business helps her cover the daily household expenses. One of her dreams is to have a big clothing store where she can offer her customers all types of clothing.

She is asking for a loan in order to buy summer clothing, so she can be ready for the requests her clients make in this hot season. She is thankful to the foundation and to Kiva for the opportunity that they give her, as each time she comes closer to her dream.

loans.use: to buy summer clothing for resale

loans.name: Damascene

texts.en:
Damascene is 37 years old and married with two children between 1 and 6 years old. He owns a business selling second hand clothing This is his seventh years in this business and he works from 8 a.m. until 10 p.m. every day.

Damascene has requested a Kiva loan through Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more second hand clothing to sell. With any profits, he will be able to save for his future and to pay medical insurance.

loans.use: to purchase more second hand clothing to sell.

loans.name: Quang

texts.en: Mrs Quang and her husband are taking the loan out for their daughter, Bay, who is a student. Bay is attending Travinh Unversity. Her study duration is 2 years and it will be completed by October, 2012.  Bay wants to be a professional accountant so she is studying very hard and trying to overcome the difficulties of obtaining good scores. Currently, she wants to get a loan of 14,580,000 Vietnam dong to pay the tuition fee and buy other study supplies.

loans.use: to pay the tuition fee and buy other study supplies

loans.name: Seth

texts.en:
Seth is 41 years old and is married. Seth has three years of experience selling curtains. The hours of his business are from 7 a.m. to 7 p.m. every day except Saturday.

Seth has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to purchase more curtains for resale. With any profits from the loan, Seth would like to satisfy his family's basic needs and start saving for his future.

loans.use: to purchase more curtains for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To add stock of maize, beans, rice, and peas

loans.name: Symphrose

texts.en:
Symphrose is 22 years old and married with three children. She sells juice, water, biscuits, pampers, etc. Her business runs from 6 am until 8 pm every day and she has two years of experience. Symphrose currently employs one person to help her.

Symphrose has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to expand her supermarket by buying more juice, water, biscuits, pampers, etc. to sell. With any profit, Symphrose will be able to reinvest in her business and save money for her future.

loans.use: to expand her supermarket by buying more juice, water, biscuits, pampers, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Ha

texts.en: Mrs Ha is taking the loan out for her son, student Linh. Linh is attending the University for Electronics. The duration of his study is 4.5 years and it will be completed in 2013.  After graduation, he will become an information technology engineer. He hopes to find a job at a computer company. Currently, he wants to get a loan of 14,580,000 Vietnam dong to pay his tuition fee.

loans.use: to pay her son's tuition fee

loans.name: Baptiste

texts.en:
Baptiste is 27 years old and married with two children between 2 and 4 years old.  Baptiste has six years of experience selling various goods such as cosmetics, cotex, sugar, biscuits, etc. The hours of his business are from 6am to 10pm.

Baptiste has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to purchase more cosmetics, cotex, sugar, biscuits, etc to sell. With any profits, Baptiste would like to satisfy his family's basic needs and reinvest in his business.

loans.use: to purchase more cosmetics, cotex, sugar, biscuits, etc to sell.

loans.name: Kellen

texts.en:
Kellen is 27 years old and married with two children between the ages of 1 and 2 years old. Kellen sells second-hand clothing and belts. Her business is well organized. She works from 7:30am until 8:00pm every day and has two years of experience. She currently employs two people to help her.

Kellen has requested a loan from Kiva lender Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more second-hand clothing and belts for resale. With any profit, she will be able to save for her future and reinvest in the business.

loans.use: To purchase more second-hand clothing and belts for resale.

loans.name: Elijah

texts.en:
Elijah is 43 years old, married and has four children. To earn a living, he sells mainly passion fruits.  He has employed two people in this business.  He also practices dairy farming for more income generation. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has grown his business with his previous loans.
Elijah has requested for 50,000 Kenya shillings to buy a dairy cow.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Jose Gabino

texts.es:
Jose, tiene 59 años de edad, reside en el municipio de Patuca, su familia esta conformada por su esposa quien se dedica a los quehacerse del hogar y sus dos hijos quienes estudian en la escuela. 

Jose inició a trabajar desde muy pequeño, recuerda que no le gustaba mucho ir a la escuela y se escapaba para ir a la finca de cafe de su vecino para ayudar con las labores. Despues el tiempo fue pasando y Jose fue involucrandose mas en el negocio del cafe y cuando llegó a la adultez decidió iniciar su propio cultivo de cafe y actualmente tiene sembradas 22 manzanas de tierra.  

Con el apoyo de este prestamo Jose podrá comprar canastas para la recoleccion del cafe, pagar la mano de obra por la recoleccion y el pago del transporte para sacar su cosecha al mercado. Con el apoyo de este prestamo espera aumentar sus ganancias y de esta forma mejorar la economía de su hogar. Este es su primer prestamo en FAMA y espera cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas puntualmente.
texts.en:
Jose, age 59, resides in the municipality of Patuca. His family is comprised of his wife, who dedicates herself to housework, and their two children, who go to school.

Jose began working when he was very small. He recalls that he did not much like going to school, and he used to leave in order to go to a neighbor’s coffee farm to help with the work. As time passed, Jose involved himself more in the coffee business, and when he became an adult he decided to begin his own coffee farm. Currently, he has 38 acres of planted land.

With the support of this loan, Jose will be able to buy baskets for collecting coffee, pay laborers for the harvest, and pay for transport in order to bring his harvest to market. With the support of this loan he hopes to increase his earnings and in this way improve the economy of his household. This is his first loan with FAMA and he hopes to make all his payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase baskets for collecting coffee, pay laborers for the harvest, and pay for transport in order to bring his harvest to market.

loans.name: Lu

texts.en: Mrs Lu is taking the loan out for her daughter, student Oanh. Oanh is a first-year student of Natural Science at the Hanoi National University.  She has to spend 3.5 more years to finish the program. After graduation, she will be an expert in geography. She hopes to work at a school as a teacher. Currently, she wants to get a loan of 10,206,000 Vietnam dong to pay the tuition fee and other expenditure since her house is very far from the university.

loans.use: to pay her daughter's tuition fee and other expenditure

loans.name: Las Morenitas (Flat) Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama las morenitas ya que son señoras de piel morena y vive en una localidad pequeña.

   La señora quien se le tomo  la entrevista se llama Norma  quien vive en unión libre con el señor Elí y con quien procreo  dos hijos que  aun están  a su  responsabilidad.

 Ella solcito el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de ingredientes como son: pollo, maíz, aceite hojas de guineo, chile  ancho , pasas, entre otros para la elaboración de tamales de mole, en donde lleva trabajando  un año y  cinco  meses en la que comenta que le va bien .

 Lo que ella desea es que con su pequeña actividad pueda seguir trabajando y con el préstamo   y sus ganancias trabajar más días a la semana.
texts.en:
This group is named “Las Morenitas” because the members are dark-skinned women who reside in a small locality. The woman we interviewed is called Norma. She lives with Eli and they have 2 children who are still their responsibility.

Norma is requesting a loan to invest in ingredients such as chicken, corn, cooking oil, banana leaves, broad chiles, and raisins, among other things, for making tamales with mole sauce. She has been doing this for 1 year and 5 months and it is going well, she says.

What Norma wants is for her small business to continue, and that with the loan and her earnings, she will be able to work more days in the week.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for making tamales to sell.

loans.name: Alexis

texts.en:
Alexis is 28 years old and married with one child who is four years old. Alexis sells meat in his business. His business is well organized. He employes two people to help him and he works from 7am until 10pm every day. Alexis has four years of experience in this business.

He has requested a loan from Kiva lender Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more meat to sell. With this profit from the loan, Alexis will reinvest in his business and create another butcher shop in this area.

loans.use: to purchase more meat.

loans.name: Unidos Progresamos Group

texts.es:
Este Banco comunal se llama “Unidos Progresamos” está conformado por 16 emprendedores, quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran venta de joyas, venta de confites, repostería, tejidos, confección, entre otros negocios. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Rancagua.
Mabel presidenta del grupo del Banco comunal quien en la foto se encuentra en la primera fila, ubicada en el segundo lugar de izquierda a derecha, usa una blusa estampada de color oscuro, manga ¾, su cabello es largo y de color castaño claro, con chasquilla, además usa sus gafas sobre la cabeza.
Se dedica al rubro del comercio, específicamente vendiendo ropa para casa, entre cortinas, visillos, cenefas, paños para secar platos, entre otros artículos. Trabaja en éste negocio desde hace 5 años.
Ofrece sus productos en diferentes ferias libres, 4 días a la semana, miércoles, jueves, sábados y domingos. 
Su mercadería la compra por fardo semanalmente (3 fardos), en una distribuidora en la ciudad de Santiago. 
Con el crédito comprará 6 fardos de ropa de casa para abastecer su negocio durante la temporada de navidad.
Una de sus metas son instalarse con una distribuidora de fardos de ropa usada, ya que en la ciudad de Rancagua no existen éste tipo de negocios y muchos comerciantes deben realizar las compras de mercadería en la ciudad de Santiago, por lo que sería un gran negocio para obtener buenas utilidades.
Mabel vive junto a su padre y sus cuatro hijos de 17, 13, 8 y 6 años de edad. Su padre es quien la ayuda con el negocio, ya que se distrae apoyándola. Uno de sus sueños es estudiar la carrera de Trabajo Social.
Las motivaciones de continuar con el negocio, se deben a que es la única fuente de ingreso en su familia. 
Mabel está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad brindada por Fondo Esperanza, ya que le permitió contar con un capital, para invertir en su negocio.
Respecto al grupo del Banco comunal del cual forma parte, comenta que existe una muy buena relación entre sus miembros, por lo que se siente muy cómoda de compartir diferentes actividades e intereses. 
Rancagua pertenece a la región del Libertador Bernardo O´Higgins. Es una moderna ciudad que regula el principal proceso productivo y exportador agro frutícola y vitivinícola de Chile. Es también una ciudad minera, debido a que en su cordillera se encuentra la mina subterránea más grande del mundo “El Teniente”, con 4.500 km. de túneles.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called “Unidos Progresamos” (United Progress). It is made up of 16 entrepreneurs who are engaged in different businesses, among which are jewelry sales, the sale of sweets, a pastry shop, the sale of fabrics, and handicrafts, among other businesses. All the members live in the city of Rancagua.

Mabel, the president of the communal bank, can be found in the photo in the first row, second from the right wearing a dark print, ¾ sleeve blouse. Her hair is long and light brown with bangs. In addition, she is wearing her glasses atop on top of her head. She works selling household goods, specifically, drapes, lace curtains, flounces, and dish towels, among other articles. She has been in this business for 5 years. She offers her products at different street markets 4 days a week: Wednesdays, Thursdays, Saturdays, and Sundays. She purchases three bales of merchandise weekly from a distributor in the city of Santiago.

With the loan she will buy 6 bales of household goods in order to stock her business during the Christmas season. One of her goals is to establish herself as a distributor of used clothing since this type of business does not exist in the city of Rancagua. Many merchants have to carry out the purchase of such merchandise in Santiago, and it would be a great business for obtaining good profits.

Mabel lives with her father and her four children, ages 17, 13, 8, and 6. Her father helps her with the business since he enjoys supporting her. One of her dreams is to study for a career in social work. Her motivation for continuing with the business is that it is her sole source of her family’s income. Mabel is very happy and thankful for the opportunity offered by Fondo Esperanza since it will allow her to have capital for investing in her business.

With regard to the communal bank of which she is a part, she says that there is a very good relationship among the members. This is why they feel very comfortable sharing their different activities and interests. Rancagua is part of the Libertador Bernardo O´Higgins region. It is a modern city that is Chile’s principal center for the production and export of fruit and grapevines. It is also a mining city due to the , nearby mountain range in which one finds the largest underground mine in the world, “El Teniente” , with 4,500 km. of tunnels.

loans.use: to purchase household goods such as drapes and lace curtains to stock her business during the Christmas season.

loans.name: Hieu

texts.en:
Mrs. Hieu and her husband are taking out this loan for their daughter Ha, a student. Ha is a first-year student at the University of Transport. She is studying Information Technology. It will take her 5 years to graduate. 

She hopes to find a good job with a stable income in a computer company. Currently, she wants to have a loan of 14,580,000 Vietnamese dong to pay her school fees.

loans.use: to pay her daughter's school fees.

loans.name: Diana Maria

texts.es: La señora Diana María a sus 31 años es una emprendedora quien conciente de la necesidad de sacar a sus tres hijos adelante, decide iniciar hace tres años en la acera de su casa la elaboración y venta de comidas rápidas y fritos, trabajando todos los días en las mañanas y noches, gracias a este negocio puede generar los ingresos para el sustento de su hogar. Con el ánimo de ingresar a sus hijos a estudiar para que se preparen y tengan un mejor futuro, la señora Diana María necesita de la compra de un carro para preparar comidas rápidas e insumos con el fin de mejorar el servicio que presta y así a la espera que sus ventas mejoren para poder cumplir sus sueños y brindarle un mejor bienestar a sus tres hijos.
texts.en:
Diana María is 31 years old. She is an entrepreneur who knows the necessity of providing for her 3 children. 

She began 3 years ago on the footpath outside her house to make and sell fast and fried food, working every day, morning and night. Thanks to this business she can earn income to take care of her home. 

With the idea of putting her children in school to prepare them to have a better future, Diana María needs to buy a food cart in order to prepare fast food and get supplies to improve the service she has and thus she hopes that her sales will go up, and she can fulfill her dreams of giving her three children a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a food cart so she can prepare fast food and to buy supplies

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 32 years old and single. He owns a boutique where he sells goods such as cosmetics, diapers, and other personal care products. He has had his business for two months and he works from 7 a.m. until 10 p.m. every day.  Joseph currently employs two people to help him.

Joseph has requested a loan via Kiva field partner Vision Finance Company in order to buy cosmetics, diapers, and other personal care products to sell at his store. With any additional profits her realizes as a result of this loan, Joseph plans to reinvest in his business, save for his future, and buy medical insurance.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, diapers, and other personal care products

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza De San Luis Group

texts.es:
Nueva Espernaza de San Luis es de la ciudad de Caaguazú, está integrado por 26 mujeres, quienes están en el cuarto ciclo del programa de mujeres emprendedoras. Ellas se unieron con el propósito de ayudarse las unas con las otras y de esa forma poder salir adelante por medio del trabajo en conjunto. Comentan que desean llegar al nivel máximo del programa de la fundación y de esa forma tener un mejor nivel de vida.
Francisca se define como una mujer muy trabajadora, ella se unió al grupo para poder trabajar con sus amigas y de esa forma ayudarse para que puedan mejorar sus estilos de vida. Dice que se dedica a la venta de carbón en lo cual le va muy bien, ya que este está siendo muy utilizado por las personas. Su trabajo la ayuda a mantener a su familia y también a cubrir los gastos que surgen día a día en la casa.
Ella solicita la ayuda de la fundación para la compra de carbón en cantidad, lo cual le será de mucha ayuda para poder tener en stock suficientes mercaderías para poder cumplir con sus clientes.
texts.en:
The “Nueva Esperanza de San Luis” (New Hope of St. Louis) communal bank is located in the city of Caaguazu, and is composed of 26 women who are in their 4th loan cycle in the “Program for Enterprising Women.” They meet with the proposition of helping one another and, in this way, to be able to get ahead by working together. The women comment that they wish to arrive at the maximum level of the Foundation's program, and thereby, to achieve a better standard of living.

Francisca is characterized as a very hard-working woman. She joined the group to be able to work with her friends and, in this way, to help them improve their style of life.  She reports that she sells charcoal and the business is going very well, since everyone uses it. Her work helps to maintain her family and, also, to cover daily household costs. Francisca is requesting the Foundation's help to buy charcoal in bulk. It will be much help to have a sufficient supply of merchandise in stock to be able to meet  customer demand.

loans.use: to buy charcoal in bulk for subsequent sale.

loans.name: Luis Enrique

texts.es:
Luis, tiene 30 años de edad, es productor de cafe en pequeña escala, reside en el municipio de Patuca, su familia esta conformada por su esposa quien se dedica a los quehacerse del hogar y sus cuatro hijos quienes dependen de él y su esposa. 

Luis inició a trabajar con el cultivo de cafe hace seis años y aprendió del oficio por la enseñanza que su padre le dio. No tiene un horario de trabajo porque siempre hay alguna actividad que realizar en su finca. Su gran sueño es convertirse en un gran productor de cafe. 

Luis solicita este prestamo para comprar canastas para la recoleccion del cafe, pagar la mano de obra por la recoleccion y el pago del transporte para sacar su cosecha al mercado. Con el apoyo de este prestamo espera aumentar sus ganancias y asi mejorar las condiciones economicas de su familia. Este es su primer prestamo en FAMA y espera cumplir puntualmente con el pago de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Luis is 30 years old. He produces coffee on a small scale. He lives in the town of Patuca. He family is made up of his wife who is a housewife, and she cares for the 4 children who depend on them.

Luis began to work growing coffee 6 years ago and he learned the trade through the training his father gave him. He does not have a work schedule because there is always something that needs to be done on the farm. His big dream is to become a major coffee producer.

Luis is asking for a loan to buy baskets for harvesting the coffee, for paying the laborers for harvesting, and to pay for transport to take his harvest to market. With the help of this loan he hopes to expand his earnings and to improve the financial stability of his family. This is his first loan with FAMA and he expects to make his payments on time.

loans.use: to buy baskets, pay the laborers, and to pay for transporting the harvest

loans.name: Cansilde

texts.en:
Cansilde is 51 years old and is married with four children aged between 13 and 24 years old.  She owns a restaurant from where she sells items such as beans, bananas, meat, rice, juice, soda, and water.  Her business is well organized, and she works on weekdays from 6 a.m. until 6 p.m.  She has had her restaurant for three years and she currently employs five people.

Cansilde has requested a loan from Kiva field partner Vision Finance Company in order to buy more inventory for her restaurant, including beans, bananas, meat, rice, juice, soda, and water.  Cansilde plans to reinvest any extra profit she realizes as a result of the loan back into her business, and hopes that some day she will be able to buy a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy beans, bananas, meat, rice, juice, soda, and water for a restaurant

loans.name: Blanca Elvia

texts.es: La señora Blanca tiene un restaurante de asadero de pollos, esta actividad inició luego de haber quedado viuda, por lo que requería de generar sus propios ingresos para su sostenimiento. Con el ánimo de generarle empleo a un familiar y mejorar sus ventas, la señora Blanca necesita de la compra de una olla fritadora con la cual pueda tener una mayor producción y así mejorar su calidad de vida y la del nuevo trabajador.
texts.en: Ms. Blanca has a chicken restaurant, which she started when she became a widow because she needed to generate her own income to sustain herself. With the goal of creating a job for a family member and improving her sales, Blanca needs to purchase a pot for frying. This will make it possible for her to increase her production and thereby improve her own quality of life as well as that of her new employee.

loans.use: to buy a pot for frying

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
La Señora Cristina es de la ciudad de Santaní, tiene 50 años de edad. Ella nos comenta que tiene una despensa a la que se dedica hace 10 años, por lo que ella dice que ya tiene un poco de experiencia en ese trabajo.
Ella se define como una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora que lucha día a día por ayudar en la casa y de esa forma poder cubrir los gastos que día a día surgen en la casa. Comenta que uno de sus sueños es ampliar su negocio y así mas adelante poder tener una carnicería.
Ella solicita el crédito para poder comprar todo tipo de productos, como ser panificados, enlatados, fideos, lácteos, y demás insumos necesarios que son los que más salidas tienen. Ella agradece lo que la fundación paraguaya y kiva le están ayudando.
texts.en:
Cristina is from the city of Santaní and she is 50 years old.  She tells us she has a food store that she has had for 10 years, which is why she says she has a little experience in this work.

She describes herself as a very hardworking and enterprising woman who struggles day after day to help at home to be able to cover the expenses that come up on a daily basis.  She tells us that one of her dreams is to expand her business in the future to be able to have a meat counter.

She is asking for this loan to be able to buy all kinds of products, such as baked goods, canned goods, noodles, dairy products, and other necessary supplies that she is lowest on.  She thanks Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva for helping her.

loans.use: to buy baked goods, canned goods, noodles, dairy products, and other necessary supplies

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is married with four children and her family lives in a five room house in the city of Bamenda in northwest Cameroon. She has faced challenges in life which includes the death of family members, and the theft of her last loan.

Susana joined GHAPE in the year 2000 and has taken and repaid loans eleven times. Her previous loans were used for farming and to build a motorbike transportation business.  The profits from these businesses were used to buy medication for her family and to pay for her children's education.

Susana plans to use this loan to buy a new motorbike for her transportation business and strongly believes the business will succeed because she has competent drivers and she has also made progress in improving her profit margins. The community will benefit from her transportation service, especially as the roads are poor and motorbikes are better able to serve the area. Her bikes will  also be used to transport  produce to and from nearby markets and  farms.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike and fuel

loans.name: Jean Maurice

texts.en:
Maurice is 40 years old and is married with two children aged between 3 and 8 years old. He owns secretarial service business. He has had this business for twenty years and works from 7:30 a.m. until 5:30 p.m. He currently employs one person to help him.

Maurice has requested a loan from Kiva field partner Vision Finance Company in order to buy more materials such as: chairs, machines, printer etc for his secretarial services business. If he is able to realize any additional profit as a result of this loan, he plans to reinvest it back into his business.

loans.use: To buy more materials such as: chairs, machines, printer etc  for his secretarial  services business

loans.name: Etienne

texts.en:
Etienne is 20 years old and is single. He owns a boutique where he sells goods such as lotion, soap, and toothpaste.  He has had his business for five years and works from 6 a.m. until 10 p.m. every day.  He currently employs one person to help him.

Etienne has requested a loan from Kiva field partner Vision Finance Company in order to buy more inventory for his shop such as lotion, soap, and  toothpaste. If he makes any additonal profit as a result of this loan, Etienne plans to reinvest it in his business.

loans.use: to buy goods such as lotion, soap, and toothpaste

loans.name: Beatha

texts.en:
Beatha is 26 years old and is married with one child who is four years old.  She has had a sewing business for five years, and works every day from 8 a.m. until 9 p.m.

Beatha has requested a loan from Kiva field partner Vision Finance Company in order to purchase an additional sewing machine. If she is able to realize additonal profit as a result of this loan, Beatha hopes to open up other outlets of her business in the area.

loans.use: to buy an additional sewing machine

loans.name: Orlando

texts.es:
Orlando tiene 44 años de edad, se dedica a la compra y venta de cerdos, reside en el municipio de Patuca, su familia esta conformada por su esposa quien se dedica a los quehacerse del hogar y sus cuatro hijos quienes les ayudan con las actividades del hogar y del negocio. 

Orlando aprendió del negocio por uno de sus amigos, ya que él lo acompañaba cada vez que iba a comprar o vender los cerdos y observaba que obtenia muy buenas ganancias y entonces Orlando decidió dedicarse al mismo negocio pero no tenia dinero para empezar; asi que se fue a trabajar a una hacienda y despues de un tiempo ya tenia algunos ahorros y entonces compró sus primeros cerditos y actualmente ya tiene su propia granja de cria de cerdos. 

Orlando solicita este prestamo para comprar varios cerdos para engordarlos y luego venderlos. Con el apoyo de este prestamo espera mejorar sus ganancias y las condiciones economicas de su familia. Este es su primer prestamo en FAMA y espera cumplir puntualmente con el pago de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Orlando is 44 years old. He buys and sells pigs. He lives in the municipality of Patuca and his family is comprised of his wife, who is a homemaker, and his four children who help with the household chores and the family business.

Orlando learned this business from one of his friends, who he would accompany each time he went to buy or sell pigs. He observed that his friend earned good income, so Orlando decided to dedicate himself to the same business. However, he did not have enough money to get started, so he went to work on a farm. After a while, he had enough saved up and bought his first piglets. Now he has his own farm where he raises pigs. 

Orlando is requesting this loan to buy and fatten several pigs, which he will later sell. He hopes that with the support of this loan, he will improve his profits and his family's economic conditions. This is his first loan through FAMA and he anticipates being punctual with his repayments.

loans.use: to buy and fatten several pigs

loans.name: Hadidja

texts.en:
Hadidja is 43 years old and she sells charcoal. Her business is well organized. She works from 8 am until 7 pm every day and has four years of experience.

Hadidja has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more sacs of charcoal for resale. Hadidja will reinvest any profit from the loan in her business, and she will be able to save for her future. Hadidja hopes to buy her own house.

loans.use: to purchase more sacs of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Frontera De San Miguel Group

texts.es:
Las mujeres del presente comité son de la ciudad de Caacupé. Ellas están muy satisfechas muy satisfechas con el apoyo que les está brindando la Fundación Paraguaya y kiva, ya que por medio de esta ayuda ellas se ven con un paso más hacia cumplir sus objetivos. El comité está en el ciclo número 2, con 12 integrantes.
Nelida es una de las miembros del grupo, comenta que se dedica a la peluquería. Por medio de su negocio ella puede mantener a su familia y ayudar con los gastos de la casa. Comenta que tiene una buena cantidad de clientes gracias a la buena atención que les da y gracias a los buenos precios que tiene. Uno de sus objetivos es seguir creciendo y de esa forma poder ser más conocida y atraer a más clientes.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de tintes, shampoo, enjuagues, spray y demás insumos necesarios para su peluquería. Está agradecida por la ayuda que le da la fundación y kiva, por que le será muy útil para seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
The women in this communal bank are from the city of Caacupé. They are very satisfied with the support that Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva have provided them, as this help has put them one step closer to achieving their goals. They are in their second loan cycle and have 12 members.

Nelida, a hairdresser, is one member of this group. Through her business, she is able to support her family and to help with household expenses. She comments that she has a good number of customers thanks to the good service she provides and her good prices. One of her objectives is to continue growing so that she can become more well-known and attract more clients. She is requesting this loan to buy hair dyes, shampoo, rinses, hairspray, and other necessary products for her beauty salon. Nelida is grateful for Fundación Paraguya and Kiva's help, as it will be very useful in helping her to continue growing.

loans.use: to buy hair dyes, shampoo, rinses, hairspray and other supplies

loans.name: Halim

texts.en:
Halim, 50 years old, sells various goods such as juice, eggs, cooking oil, toilet paper, etc. Her business is well organized. She works from 6 a.m. until 8 p.m. every day and has two years of experience.

Halim has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase various goods such as juice, eggs, cooking oil, toilet paper, etc. to sell. Halim will use any profit from this loan to reinvest in her business and to save for her future.

loans.use: To purchase various goods such as juice, eggs, cooking oil, toilet paper, etc.

loans.name: Illumine

texts.en:
Illumine is 36 years old and is married with five children aged between five and 15 years old. Illumine sells soft drinks and local drinks such as water and Fanta. Her business is well organized. She works every day from 6 a.m. until 10 p.m. and has had her business for three years.

Illumine has requested a loan from Kiva field partner Vision Finance Company in order to buy more water, Fanta, and other beverages for her business. With any additional profit she realizes as a result of this loan, she plans to reinvest in her business and save for her future.  She hopes that one days she can buy a house of her own.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks and local drinks for resale

loans.name: Jose Virgilio

texts.es: El señor José a sus 29 años de edad es padre de cuatro hijos de 13, 9, 8 y 6 años de edad, por los cuales trabaja día a día en un local donde presta servicios de computadores, Internet y video juegos desde las 9:00 a.m. hasta las 8:00 p.m, con el ánimo de brindarles una buena calidad de vida y educación. El señor José necesita de la compra de dos computadores y un video juego con los cuales pueda mejorar el servicio prestado y sus ventas, lo que le permita apoyar económicamente a su familia puesto que su esposa se encuentra sin trabajo. El sueño del señor José es ver crecer a sus hijos y poder generar empleos directos en su comunidad.
texts.en: José is 29 years old and the father of four children, ages 13, 9, 8 and 6. It is for their sake that he works day in and day out, at a shop that offers computer service, Internet, and video games from 9:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m. His purpose is to offer his children a good quality of life and an education. José needs to purchase two computers and a video game so that he can improve his sales and the service he offers. This will allow him to support his family economically, since his wife is without a job. José's dream is to see his children grow up and to be able to generate jobs in his community.

loans.use: to buy two computers and a video game

loans.name: Jean Claude

texts.en:
Claude is 39 years old and married with six children between the ages of 5 and 16 years old. He owns a shop selling various goods such as eggs, lotions, soap, Colgate, etc. This is his third year in the business and he works from 5 am until 11 pm every week. 

Claude has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase various goods such as eggs, lotions, soap, Colgate, etc., to sell. He will be able to save any profits for his future and to reinvest in his business. Claude hopes to buy his own house for his business.

loans.use: to purchase various goods such as eggs, lotions, soap, Colgate, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Segundo

texts.es: Segundo, de 33 años de edad, es un hombre trabajador y empeñoso, además de solidario y muy amable. Convive con Jesenia quien es ama de casa y ambos tienen dos hijos de 14 y 2 años de edad a los que quiere mucho. Juntos habitan en su propia casa. Las actividades que realiza Segundo, es el de transporte de pasajeros para eso cuenta con un mototaxi que compró con un capital propio más un préstamo bancario hace 4 años. Desde entonces sale a trabajar en sus ratos libres; del mismo tambien se dedica a la crianza de ganado vacuno contando con un terreno de 40 hectáreas que compró hace 12 años, donde cría 20 vacas, asimismo cultiva pasto, que le sirve de forraje para ellos, por tanto debe contratar peones, a quienes les paga un jornal de 20 nuevos soles diarios. Le gusta su trabajo de campo, ya que con eso tiene un oficio pues no terminó sus estudios y viendo que le permite tener un ingreso económico para mantener a su familia, y la educación de sus hijos ya que considera que es la mejor herencia que les pueda dejar, pues el no tuvo esa oportunidad. Tiene planes de abrir una bodega en su casa donde atendería su pareja y de esa manera tener más ingresos. Este será el préstamo número 6 con la institución MFP, se siente agradecido por el apoyo financiero para poder avanzar con sus planes. Además dice estar a gusto con su banco comunal pues se lleva bien con todos sus miembros, a quienes considera ser personas responsables y cordiales. Con el monto solicitado de 3000 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en su negocio de crianza de ganado pensado comprar vacuna para sus animales y para la preparación del terreno para sembrar más pasto para las vacas.
texts.en: Thirty-three-year-old Segundo is a hardworking and industrious man who is also supportive and very kind.  He lives with his partner, Jesenia, who is a housewife and together they have two children who are 14 and 2 years old and whom they love very much.  They live together in their own home.  For a living, Segundo transports passengers on the mototaxi he bought with his own capital and a bank loan four years ago.  Since then he goes out and works when he has free time.  At the same time, he also raises cattle for a living on the 40 ha. he bought about 12 years ago.  He is raising 20 cows and he also grows grass that he uses as their fodder.  He has to hire workers, whom he pays 20 nuevos soles per day.  He likes working in the fields because it gives him a trade since he didn't finish school and because it provides him with the income to take care of his family and pay for his children's education.  He considers that to be the best inheritance he can leave them because he didn't have that opportunity.  He is planning to open a small grocery store in his home that his wife would attend to in order to have more income.  This will be his sixth loan with MFP and he is thankful for the financial support to be able to go ahead with his plans.  He also says that he likes his communal bank because he gets along with all the members, who he considers responsible and friendly.  He will invest the requested 3,000 nuevos soles in his cattle-raising business by buying vaccines for his animals and preparing his land to plant more grass for his cows.

loans.use: to buy vaccines for his cows and to grow more grass

loans.name: Tuyizere I Group

texts.fr:
Viola est une vendeuse d’oignon, âgée de 32ans qui habite à Gitega. Elle pratique cette activité  depuis 10 ans. Elle l’a commencée alors qu’elle faisait l’agriculture. Elle a  fait ses études jusqu’en 6e année primaire. Elle est mariée et mère de 2 enfants. 
Le crédit Kiva qu’elle obtient lui permet d’augmenter son capital pour acheter beaucoup d’oignons à revendre  et réaliser de grands bénéfices. 

Elle est membre  du groupe  communautaire« Tuyizere I».
texts.en:
Viola is an onion seller. She is thirty-two years old and lives in Gitega. She has worked in this business for ten years. She started it while she was working in agriculture. She attended school through the sixth year of primary school. She is married and mother of two children.
The loan from Kiva that she is getting permits her to augment her capital to buy many onions to resell and to make a profit.

She is a member of the community group Tuyizere I.

loans.use: to increase her capital to buy many onions to resell and make a profit.

loans.name: Yuriy

texts.ru:
Юрий выращивает ранние овощи – помидоры и редис. У него уже есть три большие теплицы и две маленькие (для рассады). Участок земли у него достаточно большой, поэтому Юрий хочет развивать свой бизнес дальше и строить еще одну теплицу.  Ему нужно успеть построить ее до морозов и вовремя посеять семена. Юрий – трудолюбивый и ответственный. Эти качества помогают ему преуспевать не только в бизнесе, но и в жизни.
Юрий просит предоставить ему кредит в размере 20,000 гривен на постройку теплицы и покупку пленки.
texts.en:
Yuriy grows a variety of vegetables, including tomatoes and radishes.  He has three large greenhouses plus two small ones for seedlings.  He has enough space to expand his business, so he wants to put up another greenhouse.  He needs to build it and plant seeds before the frost.  He's hard-working and responsible, qualities which help him thrive not only in business but in life.

Yuri is seeking a loan of 20,000UAH to build his greenhouse and purchase plastic sheeting.

loans.use: to build another greenhouse and purchase plastic sheeting.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 31 years old and married with four children between the ages of 3 and 11 years old. She sells various goods such as Colgate, toilet paper, soap, lotions, etc. Her business is open from 6 am until 12 pm every day and she has four years of experience. 

Christine has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to purchase various goods such as Colgate, toilet paper, soap, lotions, etc., to sell. Christine will be able to reinvest any profit into her business and to save money for her future.

loans.use: to purchase various goods such as Colgate, toilet paper, soap, lotions, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Nkulokoh

texts.en:
Born on the 11th of August, 1971, she is single with two children, both younger than 15. They all live in a one room house on Ben and Bros Street, a quarter in the Bamenda Mezam Division of the North West Region of Cameroon. She has faced challenges in life such as death, a broken home, poverty and ill health.

Life had been so difficult for her until she joint GHAPE in 2009. She has borrowed and repaid two loans, which she used to to sell Irish potatoes and to buy fabrics to sew school uniforms. These activities enabled her to pay her children’s school fees, medication and house rent and to provide her children with a balanced diet. She plans to use this loan to buy fabric, cocoyams (taro) and Irish potatoes. She is very positive that her business will succeed because of her experience and better management skills. Furthermore, she sells to her customers at low prices and has good availability of products at all times to make sure the community has a regular supply of commodities.

She plans to use any profit made from this loan to pay her children's school fees, medication and house rent and to cater for other unforeseen circumstances in the family. She prefers a loan from GHAPE because of the low interest rates, convenient installment repayments, no collateral security and training in business tactics before loan disbursement.

loans.use: To buy fabric, Irish potatoes and cocoyams

loans.name: Juventino

texts.es:
El  Juventino se dedica  a la venta de tortillas es repartidor va en su moto a repartir tortillas en su comunidad y comunidades vecinas.
Es un joven trabajador humilde con deseos de superarse y formar una familia .
El pidió el préstamo para la compra de maíz para la elaboración de tortillas mexicanas de manos mexicanas.
Le da las gracias fundación por el apoyo que le ha dado  para seguir adelante y triunfar en la vida.
texts.en:
Juventino sells tortillas for a living, delivering them on his motorcycle.  He delivers tortillas in his community and in neighboring communities.

He is a humble young worker who wants to better himself and start a family.

He asked for this loan to buy corn to make Mexican tortillas with Mexican hands.

He thanks the Foundation for the support it has given him to get ahead and succeed in life.

loans.use: to buy corn to make tortillas

loans.name: Surizadai  Betzabe

texts.es:
La señorita Surizadai Betzabe se dedica a la venta de perfumes y cosméticos desde hace siete meses es una señorita trabajadora.
Estudia la universidad ella nos cuenta que le gusta mucho su negocio por que le deja buenas ganancias.
Ella pidió el préstamo para comprar mas  mercancía como es:perfumes ,sombras, lápices  labiales,cepillos,angel etc.
También se dedica a al venta de calzado por catalogo lo vende en pagos quincenales.
Le da las gracias fundación por todo el apoyo que le ha dado en sus negocios.
texts.en:
Surizadai Betzabe has been selling perfumes and cosmetics for a living for seven months.  She is a hardworking young lady.  

She is in college and tells us that she likes her business very much because it makes a lot of money for her.

She asked for this loan to buy more merchandise, such as perfumes, eye shadows, lip liners, brushes, Angel cosmetics, etc.

She also sells shoes from catalogs, which she sells with bimonthly payments.

She thanks the Foundation for all the support it has given her with her businesses.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and shoes from catalogs.

loans.name: Mingué

texts.fr: L'emprunteuse est une femme mariée, mère de deux enfants. Elle vend des fruits et légumes au marché central de sa localité. Elle se lève très tôt le matin et passe la journée assise devant sa table faiblement protégée des rayons du soleil.Elle s'approvisionne auprès de grossistes venant de la grande cote et écoule son stock sur une période d'une ou de deux semaines environ.Son commerce lui rapporte des revenus assez importants; ce qui lui permet de satisfaire ses besoins propres et de participer à la prise en charge des dépenses d'entretien de la famille , en appui à son mari.Pour renforcer son stock et améliorer ainsi ses revenus, elle sollicite un prêt de 250000f qui servira à l'achat de pastèques, de melon, d'orange et de diverses légumes.Son ambition est d'acheter une cantine à l'intérieur du marché.
texts.en: The borrower is a married woman, mother of two children.  She sells fruits and vegetables at the central market of her town.  She gets up very early in the morning and spends the day sitting at her table, only poorly protected from the sun.  She buys her merchandise from wholesalers located along the "grande côte"  (the stretch of coast north of Dakar, between the Cap-Vert peninsula and the Senegal river).   It takes her one to two weeks to clear her stock.  Her business brings good income, which allows her to provide for herself and to help her husband support the family.  In order to bolster her stock and increase her income, she is requesting a loan in the amount of 250,000 CFA francs (XOF) which will be used to buy watermelons, melons, oranges and various vegetables.  Her long-term goal is to buy a stall at the market.

loans.use: To buy watermelons, melons, oranges and various vegetables.

loans.name: Fifonsi Gbenandou Group

texts.fr: FIFONSI GBENANDOU est un groupe de six personnes, dont les membres habitent dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe Fidèle (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 27 ans et est mariée à un certain Sylvain. Le couple a trois enfants, dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Fidèle vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Fidèle a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire. Depuis un an, Fidèle vend des fruits .Parallèlement à cette activité, Fidèle vend des patates douces et des ignames. Fidèle achète ses produits dans un marché du Bénin et dans une région du Bénin. En vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle, Fidèle et les autres membres du groupe FIFONSI GBENANDOU sollicitent un crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Fifonsi Gbenandou is a group of six people, whose members live in the same neighborhood. The representative of the group, Fidèle (whose hand is raised on the photo), is 27 years old and is married to a certain Sylvain. The couple has three dependent children, of whom some go to school. Fidèle lives together with her husband and children. The couple takes care of the different household responsibilities together. Fidèle stopped school at the primary level.

Fidèle has been selling fruit for one year. At the same time, Fidèle sells sweet potatoes and yams. Fidèle buys her products in a market of Bénin and in a region of Bénin. In order to strengthen their working capital and their business and to better respond to the demands of their clientèle, Fidèle and the other members of the Fifonsi Gbenandou group are requesting a loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: to buy fruit, yams and sweet potatoes.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy cooking utensils.

loans.name: Izigire Group

texts.fr:
Sylvie est une commerçante âgée de 35ans qui habite à Rutoki . Elle fait le commerce de boutique (savons, sucre, sel, riz, fanta, etc) depuis 3 ans. Elle a commencé cette activité alors qu’elle faisait l’agriculture. Elle a fait ses études jusqu’en 3e année primaire. Elle est mariée à Joseph et ont ensemble 5 enfants dont 3 étudient. 
Le crédit Kiva qu’elle obtient, lui permet d’augmenter son capital pour acheter beaucoup d’articles pour sa boutique (savons, sucre, sel, riz, fanta, etc).

Elle est membre  du groupe  communautaire« Izigire».
texts.en:
Sylvie is a 35-year-old shopkeeper who lives in Rutoki. She has been selling in her shop (soaps, sugar, salt, rice, Fanta, etc.) for three years. She started this business while she was farming. She studied up to the third year of primary school. She is married to Joseph and they have five children together of whom three go to school.

The loan that she obtains will allow her to increase her capital to buy many things for her shop (soaps, sugar, salt, rice, Fanta, etc.).

She is a member of the Izigire community group.

loans.use: to increase her capital to buy many things for her shop (soaps, sugar, salt, rice, Fanta, etc.).

loans.name: Gloria Libett

texts.es: Gloria originaria de León nos comparte su experiencia con su primer préstamo Kiva el cual le fue de mucha ayuda pues lo utilizo para comprar tela, hilo ,botones zipers  ya compro bastante material que necesitaba para hacer sus  pantalones, camisas, trajes de niños trajes de señora. Ha visto que su negocio ha prosperado es por ello que solicita un segundo crédito para comprar tela fina de mejor calidad. Debido a que le viene la época en que le solicitan trajes de graduación, birretes , trajes de caballero y necesita tela de muy buena calidad para satisfacer a sus clientes. Una vez cancelado su segundo crédito le gustaría adquirir una máquina de coser semi industrial para mejorar la calidad de sus diseños y hacer crecer su negocio para poder brindar oportunidad de trabajos a otras personas y de esta manera contribuir con su vecindario.
texts.en: Gloria, native of Leon, shares her experience with her first Kiva loan which was very helpful to her.  She used the loan to buy fabric, thread, buttons, zippers, and enough material that she needed to make pants, shirts, children's suits, and ladies suits.  She has seen that her business has prospered therefore she is asking for a second loan to buy fine quality fabric.  Since the time is approaching when she is asked for graduation gowns, caps, and men's suits she needs fine quality fabric to satisfy her customers.  After paying off her second loan she would like to buy a semi industrial sewing machine to improve the quality of her designs and expand her business to provide job opportunities to others and thus contribute to her neighborhood.

loans.use: to buy fine quality fabric.

loans.name: Tawah

texts.en:
Born on  11th of November, 1960, she is married and has 8 children. She lives in the Ntarikon Bamenda Mezam Division of the North West Region of Cameroon in a two-room house with four people per room. She has faced many challenges in life: the burning of her shop and its contents, leaving her with nothing to call her own; her son's death caused by a thunder accident; a broken home; poverty; ill health.

She joined GHAPE on in 2009 and has successfully borrowed and repaid two loans, which were used to buy and sell cocoyams, corn and cassava. The profit from the sales of these goods helped provide for medication, education and other necessities of life. She plans to use this loan to buy maize, cassava and rice. She is very positive that her business will succeed because of its longevity and her experience. This increase in capital will lead to expansion since she will buy more goods for sale. Furthermore, she is very welcoming to her customers and offers motivating prices. With the profit generated from this loan, she promises to improve her family's living standard by providing them with the basic necessities of life.

She prefers a loan from GHAPE because the loans are given without collateral securities and marketing and management skills are taught before the disbursement of loans.

loans.use: to buy beans, maize, rice, cocoyams, Irish potatoes and cassava

loans.name: Akpedji Group

texts.fr: Le groupe AKPEDJI est formé de trois personnes qui vivent dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Julienne Rufine, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la deuxième fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Julienne Rufine est âgée de 50 ans et une veuve. Julienne Rufine est mère quatre enfants tous scolarisés, mais plus aucun enfant n'est à sa charge. Julienne Rufine vit seule et assure seule ses divers besoins. Julienne Rufine a arrêté l’école au niveau secondaire. Depuis quinze ans, Julienne Rufine exerce comme activité, la vente de divers produits (pâtes alimentaires, conserves, etc.) dans un marché du Bénin. De façon secondaire, Julienne Rufine vend des cartes de recharge téléphoniques. Julienne Rufine s’approvisionne au Bénin. Cette activité lui permet ainsi de répondre sans grande difficulté à ses besoins. Dans le souci de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, Julienne Rufine désire renforcer ses stocks de produits et rehausser le niveau de son activité. Pour ce faire, Julienne Rufine sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe AKPEDJI, un deuxième crédit auprès de  ALIDé. Le premier crédit a été bien remboursé.
texts.en: The AKPEDJI group consists of three people who live in the same area of Benin.  The representative of the group, named Julienne Rufine, is the one with her hand raised in the photo.  This is the second time that this group has requested a loan from Alide with the goal of expanding their business.  Julienne Rufine is 50 years old and a widow.  She is mother of four children, all in school, but none are her dependents.  Julienne Rufine lives alone and is solely responsible for her various needs.  She quit secondary school.  For the past 15 years, Julienne Rufine has been in the business of selling various products (pasta, canned goods, etc) in a market in Benin.  In addition, she sells recharge cards for mobile phones.  She stocks up in Benin.  This business allows her to take care of her needs without much difficulty.  In order to better meet the requirements of her customers, Julienne Rufine wants to strengthen her product inventory and increase the level of her business.  To accomplish this, Julienne Rufine and the other members of the AKPEDJI group are requesting a second loan from Alide.  Their first loan was completely repaid.

loans.use: to buy various products (pasta, canned goods) and mobile phone recharge cards.

loans.name: Ibrahima

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un paysan qui exploite des terres situées à quelques kilomètres de sa ville.Il pratique la culture sous pluie avec le mil et l'arachide.A la fin de la saison des pluies qui ne dure que trois mois, il fait du maraîchage à l'aide d'un puits creusé dans son périmètre.Il arrive ainsi à produire des légumes qu'il vend aux commerçants avec des bénéfices consistants suivants les variétés.Son activité lui permet d'entretenir correctement son épouse et ses cinq enfants dont les trois vont à l'école. Toutefois, son problème majeur reste l'accès à l'eau du fait de la profondeur de la nappe phréatique et de la difficulté de l'extraction manuelle du liquide.C'est pour apporter une solution à ce problème qu'il sollicite auprès de l'UIMCEC un prêt de 100000f pour acheter une petite pompe qui l'aidera à tirer l'eau du puits.Son ambition est d'équiper et d'élargir son exploitation.
texts.en: The borrower is a farmer who works the land situated a few kilometers from his town.  He engages in rain-fed farming with millet and peanuts.  At the end of the rainy season that only lasts three months, he truck farms with the help of a well dug at his site.  He manages thus to produce vegetables that he sells to merchants with consistent profits according to the varieties.  His business allows him to properly support his spouse and five children, three of which attend school.  However, his major problem is access to water due to the depth of the water table and the difficulty of manually extracting the liquid.  To provide a solution to this problem, he is requesting a loan from UIMCEC for 100000 francs to buy a small pump that will help him draw water from the well.  His ambition is to equip and expand his operations.

loans.use: to buy a small pump.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.ru:
Александр – предприниматель из города Каменка-Днепровская. Он занимается выращиванием ранних овощей в теплицах на своем участке земли.  У него три больших теплицы. Сейчас он строит еще одну. Трудолюбие и общительность – его основные деловые качества, которые помогают ему развивать свой бизнес. Александр занимается этим бизнесом всего 2 года, но имеет большие планы – в течение нескольких лет построить 6 теплиц, а затем построить себе дом.
Александр просит предоставить ему кредит в размере 20,000 гривен на постройку дополнительной теплицы и установку отопления.
texts.en: Alexander is an entrepreneur from the Kamenka-Dneprovskaya town.  He is involved in growing early vegetables in greenhouses on his plot of land.  He has three large greenhouses and is currently building another one.  Hard work and sociability are his main business qualities that help him to develop his business.  Alexander has been involved in this business for only two years, but has big plans.  He wants to build six greenhouses in the next several years and then build himself a house.  Alexander is requesting a loan in the sum of 20,000 hryvnia to build an additional greenhouse and install heating.

loans.use: to build an additional greenhouse and install heating

loans.name: Komeza I Group

texts.fr:
Pamphile est une commerçant âgé de 64 ans qui habite à Rutegama . Il vend des planches depuis 17ans. Il a commencé cette activité alors qu’il faisait l’agriculture. Il  a fait ses études jusqu’en 6e année primaire. Il est marié à Pauline et ont ensemble 7 enfants dont 3 étudient. 
Le crédit Kiva qu’il obtient lui permet d’augmenter son capital pour acheter beaucoup de planches à vendre, une autre partie du crédit servira à l’achat de bananes destinées aussi au marché. 

Elle est membre  du groupe  communautaire« Komeza I».
texts.en:
Pamphile is a 64-year-old shopkeeper who lives in Rutegama. He has been selling boards for 17 years. He started this business when he was a farmer. He studied up until the sixth year of primary school. He is married to Pauline and they have seven children together of whom three study.

The Kiva loan that he gets will allow him to increase his capital in order to buy many boards to sell; another part of the loan will be used to buy bananas also destined for the market.

He is a member of the community group Komeza I.

loans.use: to increase his capital to buy many boards to sell, and to buy bananas also destined for the market.

loans.name: Elagnon Group

texts.fr: ELAGNON est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Abla Roselyne (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 30 ans et est mariée à un certain Apollinaire. Le couple a deux enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Abla Roselyne vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Abla Roselyne a arrêté l’école au cours secondaire. Depuis une dizaine d’année, Abla Roselyne exerce la coiffure, activité qu’elle exerce et qui lui procure des revenus non négligeables dans son quartier. De façon secondaire, Abla Roselyne vend des produits de coiffure. Abla Roselyne achète ses produits dans un marché du Bénin. C’est la deuxième fois que Abla Roselyne et les autres membres du groupe ELAGNON sollicitent l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle. Le premier prêt a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
Elagnon is a group of three people, whose members live in the same neighborhood. The representative of the group, Abla Roselyne (whose hand is raised on the photo), is 30 years old and is married to a certain Apollinaire. The couple has two dependent children who both go to school. Abla Roselyne lives together with her husband and children. The couple takes care of the different household responsibilities together. Abla Roselyne stopped school at the secondary level. 

For about ten years, Abla Roselyne has been doing hair, a business which brings her not insignificant income in her neighborhood. Secondarily, Abla Roselyne sells hairstyling products. Abla Roselyne buys her products in a market in Bénin. 

This is the second time that Abla Roselyne and the other members of the Elagnon group are requesting financial support from ALIDé in order to strengthen their working capital and their business and to better respond to the demands of their clientèle. The first loan was well repaid.

loans.use: to buy hairstyling products.

loans.name: Virgen De Chapi De Yanacoto Group

texts.es: Feliciana es integrante de la Alcancía Comunal “Virgen de Chapi de Yanacoto” y está conformado por 11 mujeres emprendedoras. Feliciana tiene 62 años de edad es viuda y tiene 03 hijos independiente, en el transcurso de su vida Feliciana  se ha dedicado a distintas actividades como limpieza y lavado de ropa, también a la venta de verduras la cual lo ofrecía en un mercado, pero actualmente nos manifiesta que labora en una municipalidad en el área de mantenimiento, Feliciana es una mujer empeñosa, que gracias a su trabajo a podido educar a sus hijos, y apoyar a uno de sus nietos en su educación. El deseo de Feliciana es alquilar un stand en un mercado donde pueda ofrecer especierías (condimentos) y de esta manera asegurar su vejez. En esta oportunidad solicito el crédito para mejorar su vivienda ya que piensa comprar calaminas para su techo. La Alcancía Comunal “Virgen de Chapi de Yanacoto” agradecen el crédito brindado.
texts.en: Feliciana is a member of the Virgen de Chapi de Yanacoto Communal Bank, which is made up of 11 enterprising women.  Feliciana is 62 years old; she is a widow with three independent children.  Over the course of her life, Feliciana has done different things for a living, such as cleaning, washing clothes, and also selling vegetables in a market, but she currently works in the maintenance department of a municipality.  Feliciana is a hardworking woman who, thanks to her work, has been able to give her children an education and support one of her grandchildren in his education.  Felicia's wish is to rent a stand in a market where she can sell her condiments and thus take care of herself in her old age.  At the moment, she is asking for a loan to improve her home, as she wants to buy corrugated iron for her roof.  The Virgen de Chapi de Yanacoto Communal Bank is thankful for the loan that has been offered.

loans.use: to buy corrugated iron.

loans.name: Fany Monica

texts.es:
La socia ahora se esta dedicando al negocio de venta de trajes tipicos como faldas,blusas y panatlaones,ella alquila los trajes para diferentes danzas tipicas de la ciudad del Cusco,la socia por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante.El sueño de la socia es tener un local mas amplio para que pueda alquilar los trajes tipicos.La socia solicita el credito para comprar una lavadora para implementar su casa.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member is now selling traditional costumes, such as skirts, blouses, and pants.  She rents out the costumes for different traditional dances in the city of Cusco.  This business has allowed her to get ahead.  Her dream is to have a bigger store to rent out her traditional costumes.  She is asking for this loan to buy a washing machine to install in her home.

She is glad to have received this loan and promises to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy a washing machine to install in her home
